story:
Australia vs North America vs Europe! Help fundraise to send a team from Australia to the Rewind LAN at Esports Arena California!


 

For the first time, Team Fortress 2 will be featured in the massively popular Rewind Lan based in LA!  This Lan will be held at California’s world-class dedicated eSports facility, Esports Arena. After the gripping spectacle that was i58, the Jasmine Tea players have been chomping at the bit to not only get another shot at international glory - but to provide the community with another unforgettable competitive TF2 experience. Fortunately, the best teams from North America and Europe have just confirmed their attendance so we are aiming to make this another world-wide competition by sending the best team in Oceania, Jasmine Tea, to the event. With the experience you helped us garner during i58, we are determined to bring the trophy home and finally break the Australian fourth place curse.

 

Unfortunately there is considerable cost sending a team of 6 across the world, so we are reluctantly asking you again - the enormously generous community - for your unrivaled support. With your help, we can ensure that another unforgettable contest of strength between the three biggest scenes in the game can once again be made a reality!

 

Keep up to date with our journey via #JasmineTF2

You can also support the team by donating in-game items via the following scrap.tf campaign

 

The Team

The team we’re sending to Rewind LAN has been at the top of the ozfortress competitive scene since October 2014, with the team making their mark in 2016 on the international scene at i58. The team’s roster has remained intact since then, with one exception - Mike (the one from down under) joins the team as our amazing new medic. Mike has proven to be an invaluable addition to the team ever since our former medic Dave, found out he could not make it to LA (sorry Muma!!).

 

Therefore, the current roster of Jasmine Tea and the roster attending Rewind LAN is:

 

                                                               Medic: Mike

                                                       Pocket Soldier: Geoh

                                                     Roaming Soldier: Zaka

                                                        Demoman: Paulsen

                                                            Scout: Madness

                                                                 Scout: Yui

 

Nearly all of the players on the current roster have won numerous awards for best in class and MVP over the seasons.

 

 

Previous accomplishments (2014 - Present):

#1 OWL 12

#2 OWL 13

#1 OWL 14

#1 Summer cup 1

#1 Summer cup 2

#1 ozfortress Spring Series 0

#1 ozfortress Spring Series 1

#1 ozfortress Spring Series 2

#1 ozfortress Summer Cup

#1 OZF Season 15

#4 i58 Gaming Festival

#1 OZF Season 16

 

Cost Breakdown

In addition to paying for all necessary living expenses (travel costs, food, etc.), each team member will be chipping in approximately $1250 USD for the trip. Taking this into account, we are hoping to raise the minimum amount required to cover the remainder of the costs for the essential expenses of flights and accommodation. A breakdown of these costs is shown below:

 

Flights: 2000 AUD*6 = 12000 AUD = 8689.86 USD

Accommodation = 297 USD*8days =  2376 USD  

Total cost =  11065.86 USD

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Individual contributions = 1250 USD*6

Total Team Contribution = 7500 USD

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Therefore,  11065.86 - 7500 =  3565.86 USD

Indiegogo fees have an upper limit of ~10%, i.e. approximately 357 USD

 

Total goal: ~ 4000 USD

 

This $4000 goal is the minimum amount that would ensure a hassle free attendance at Rewind LAN. If we exceed our target, any extra funds will be used to reimburse the players own investments, or be used to fund prize pools for future TF2 competitions.

 

Perks Breakdown

$10 - BARK ON STREAM - Make Paulsen your bitch for the low, low price of $10!! For every purchase of this perk, Paulsen will bark on stream, just for you.  Don’t worry if he’s not online, a strict tally will be kept to ensure he fulfills your needs.
 

$15 - ITEM SIGNING - Get one of your Team Fortress 2 items signed by a member of the team! Donor must provide weapon and gift wrap, and can choose which team member.

 

$50 - VIP SCRIM ACCESS - Claiming this perk provides access to our mumble and game server during the buildup to Rewind LAN. This perk provides a great opportunity to spectate top level Team Fortress 2 with the added benefit of listening in to our communications while we play, and is an excellent tool for developing an understanding of the game.

 

$100 - ONE HOUR - Claiming the ‘One Hour’ perk provides a donor with an hour of direct in-mumble access to an available member of the team (including Elmo) for any Team Fortress 2 related purpose, whether that be mentoring, demo/stv reviews, mge, or even pubbing.

 

$100 - TEAM FOCUSED MENTORING - This perk is an adaptation of the ‘One Hour’ to better suit a team looking to improve. A team member (once again, including the one and only, Elmo) is at the disposal of your team for an hour of anything Team Fortress 2 related. There are a number of possible effective uses for this perk, such as reviewing a recent Source TV demo of your team, in depth team mentoring, or spectating and providing pointers during a scrim.

 

$150 - BARGAIN BUNDLE - This perk entitles the donor to "Item Signing", "VIP Scrim Access" and a choice between either the "One Hour" or "Team Focused Mentoring" perks at a discounted price!

 

$250 - PAULSEN’S MOUSE - Only used once by the captain of Jasmine Tea to frag people at a local LAN; this good-as-new condition, black Thermaltake Saphira is yours.  It will also be signed by all members of Jasmine Tea at the LAN!

 

$500 - PAULSEN’S PACKAGE - We’ll take a picture of Paulsen dressed as your top dog at the LAN.  Dog onesie and any other dog accessories donated at the LAN will be included.  He’ll also be holding a personal sign adorned with your choice of words (within the realms of political correctness!).

 

How else can I help?

Contribute to the prize pool here: https://youstake.com/projects?PID=1845
There are many cool perks to claim, but more importantly, for each unique user who registers and contributes to the campaign, YouStake will contribute and additional $1 to the prize pool, up to a limit of $5000. That means that if we got 5000 unique users to donate $1, we would increase the prize pool by $10,000. 
Registration/donation tutorial: https://youtu.be/S9dR2RwCqYo

If you can't help out financially, there are other ways to support the cause! Tell your friends about the fundraiser and the event! Plug Rewind LAN on your stream or your twitter! Just be sure to get the word out there!

Once again, thank you again for your support. Without you, the donators, events like these would not be possible.

story:
Update #1: Click here to see!

Update #2: Click here to see!

Update #3: Click here to see!

Update #4: Click here to see!

Hi there! We're Divine Games, a small team of indie developers, and we're trying to create a user-friendly, easy-to-use, modern gamebook editor!

What's a gamebook?

Gamebooks are a special kind of books in which the protagonist is none else than you.
You impersonate a character and make choices for him, and each different choice may lead you to different results: will you succeed in defeating the main enemy or will you lead your character to an early death? When you discover the evil plans of a secret organization, will you fight them or join them? These are only some examples of the situations you can find yourself in while reading a gamebook.

As you can see in our video, you can also make good use of condition-based statistics and items, much like a real rpg game: you can use money as a stat, and there you have shops. You can then use experience, and there you have levels.

The possibilities are nearly limitless.

That sounds fun! How can I create one?

The bad news is, all of the features you see in the video are written in code language, which is very difficult to learn and use if you have no experience in computer programming.

So, here's what we want to do: we want to make a user-friendly gamebook editor which will do all the technical work for you - stuff like navigating through pages, generating trace maps, and most importantly exporting your book as an html page (like the one you see in the video) which you can send to your friends to play with, or publish it anywhere on the internet.

Our goal is to give you a really intuitive tool with which they can create what they have in mind without effort, using simple yet effective commands.

Why is our Gamebook Maker better than other Gamebook Makers?

We have browsed the internet far and wide, and we have found a few gamebook makers, but they are all either incomplete, very hard to use or extremely limited.

On the contrary, our tool will be very easy to use - we will also provide documentation and sample books as tutorials at the release - and will allow you to turn your creativity directly into an interactive html book, without any restriction caused by technical issues.

With your help, our program will set a milestone in the gamebook community.

Note: the program will be developed in .NET 4.0, therefore it will not work outside of the Windows environment. The HTML output, instead, will work on any HTML5-compliant browser, even on smartphones!

What will I get for helping you?

We will start making the editor as soon as we reach our goal, and we will release it shortly after.

Here's what you can get by supporting us:

  • $1: Newsletter: Every dollar counts! We will send you a Thank You mail and keep you informed about development and release (you can choose not to receive any mail if you so wish).
  • $3: Pre-Purchase: All of the above + a copy of the program (price will most likely raise after release).
  • $10: Special Thanks: All of the above + your name will be included in the special thanks area of the program.
  • $25: Collector's: All of the above + we will send you a copy of a very cool gamebook made by us.
  • $50: Divine Associate: All of the above + we will add a link to your website/blog inside our software, and you will get to test the release candidates during the end stage of development.

Help us making this true!

Please consider funding us if you like gamebooks: we guarantee that our tool will be very easy to use while offering the same freedom of choice of a pen-and-paper made book. The only limitation will be your creativity.

Other ways you can help

  • Tell your friends about this campaign! If they are interested in gamebooks, they may be willing to support us.
  • Link this campaign on your website/forum.
  • Share this campaign on your social network(s).
  • Keep visiting! We will update the campaign as the development goes on.

 

Update #1

Hello everyone!

We have received so many questions, comments and suggestions in the last few days, we'd like to thank you all for your interest :)

Moving on to more important things, in this brief update we'll answer some of your questions and tell you more about our plans for the Gamebook Creator.

1) Will our software allow exporting of pdf/rtf gamebooks?
Yes. We guarantee you will be able to export gamebooks in pdf and rtf formats, however they won't have all the features included in the HTML version, for obvious reasons. You can't possibly have a dynamic content RTF gamebook, although you can write a simple branching path book without using variables and conditions. We will explore our options for the PDF format.

2) What are the other options to export and publish your gamebook?
You will be able to export your book in a single-file HTML format, just as the one you can see in our introduction video. This format will allow the writer to use dynamic content such as conditions and variables, which can be used to create advanced gameplay mechanics such as character attributes, inventory, shops, experience levels, dynamic battles and much more.

As for the accessibility of the HTML format, you will be able to read and use HTML books on most of the modern digital platforms: all of the operative systems, tablets and most smartphones. It will also be compatible with most of the screen reader softwares.

3) Will writers be able to include pictures in their books?
Yes. Larger pictures will be resized to a thumbnail which you can click and view full size.

4) Will our tool allow to print a tracemap of the book?
Yes, we will include an option to generate a PNG image showing a color-coded map of all paths and locations in your book.

5) Will our software feature a random generator of events?
Yes. We will include a random number generator which you can use to skill-test or luck-test the reader. I will provide a couple examples:

  • You are trying to break through a wooden door: you will succeed if a sum of your strength attribute and a random value is greater than 15, otherwise you'll fail.
  • You are looking for an elusive creature that you need to kill before you can advance in your adventure: each time you visit its lair, a random number is rolled and if it is greater than 10 you will find your creature in there.

6) Will you be able to create graphical adventures with our tool?
No, we are talking gamebooks and text adventures only. Graphics you can use are limited to pictures you provide.

7) How do you write a book using our tool?
Most of the features required to write a gamebook or a text adventure will be performed through the use of three simple commands: [condition], [operation] and [jump].

  • The [condition] command will check if a a condition is true, i.e. if you own a certain item, if your strength is greater than a certain value, if you killed a certain enemy, if you have enough money, if you invited someone to your party and so on. If the condition is true, its associated text will be displayed, otherwise it won't.
  • The [operation] command will be used to declare and edit variables, i.e. if the reader collects some money you must use an operation to increase its money value.
  • The [jump] command will be used to create choices and branching paths.

These commands will be used in a bbcode-like fashion, which we find to be the easiest to understand and to use in a text editor. Here are some examples:

  • [condition=Strength>10]This text will be shown only if your strength is greater than 10[/condition]
  • [operation]Money = +50[/operation]
  • [jump=Page 3]Go to page 3[/jump]

In addition, there will be many other utility commands for text-formatting, reader input and more.

8) What makes our tool better than other tools already out there?
We aim at providing the simplest and and most complete tool ever made in the field of gamebooks and text adventures.

We have browsed through other existing softwares and I can say without a doubt that none of them offers BOTH the ease of use and all the features of our tool.

Usually gamebook editors are very limited, poorly structured and bad looking: more often than not they don't include a dynamic content system (no variables and conditions, no RNG), they force you to create tons of copypasted pages for each choice you want the reader to make, or they have a very bad internal navigation system, meaning that when you reach a considerable amount of pages, you won't have a clue where to go when looking for something.
Our tool will not suffer from such problems as it will include dynamic content and an excellent internal navigation system with a tree-view of the book structure, the aforementioned tracemap and a jump-detect system that will show all jumps FROM and TO a certain page, creating buttons you can use to navigate directly through pages. Moreover, our program will include all the features of an advanced text editor such as automatic keyword highlighting, color coding, auto-complete and text folding.

On the other hand, text adventure editors are complete and not very limiting, but they are incredibly complicated to use. The large majority of those require some sort of programming knowledge, and the few ones which don't have 30+ pages of documentation describing features you will likely never use. A writer at his first book will feel overwhelmed and confused by the sheer amount (and uselessness) of options these softwares provide, and readers will probably miss the opportunity of having a new good book or adventure to play.
Our tool will not require any kind of programming knowledge and writers will be able to understand how it works intuitively and immediately, although we will provide a detailed documentation anyways.

 

Update #2

Hello again folks,

we worked very hard last week in order to ready something for you to see, and we managed to build an alpha version with some of the basic commands which our software will have at the release. Please note that this is a very early stage of development, therefore you will not see all of the features which will be present in the final release. In the following pictures you will see examples and demonstrations of:

  • An early stage of the editor UI, including the tree structure;
  • The three main commands: condition, operation and jump;
  • Some basic text-formatting;
  • The random number generator;
  • HTML export.

On to the pictures:

  1. This is the “root” folder, where you set the name and starting page of your book. When those features are ready, you will also be able to set the summary page (left page), stats points and stats themselves in this folder.
    1. Root Folder
  2. This is an example of a page and its HTML output.
    1. Page → Page Output
  3. These are the three main commands: [cond] stands for Condition, [op] stands for Operation and [jump] stands for… well, jump.
    1. Main Commands → Main Commands Output
  4. Some advanced features you can use with the three commands.
    1. Main Commands Advanced → Main Commands Advanced Output
  5. This is how the random number generator works.
    1. Random Number Generator → Random Output 1 or Random Output 2
  6. Some text formatting.
    1. Text Formatting → Text Formatting Output
  7. Folders can be useful to create an organized structure of your book, i.e. when you are in a large area and you want to name your pages after it, but you don't want to repeat that title every time, you can use a folder Prefix.
    1. Folder: Book Folder
    2. Example of Prefix usage: Book Structure → Book Structure Output
  8. Finally, this is a page featuring all we have showed thus far. Your book pages will look something like this, perhaps with more formatting and longer text.
    1. Sample Page → Sample Page Output 1 or Sample Page Output 2 and Sample Page Output 3

You will probably notice that output pages have a lot of empty lines corresponding to unverified conditions, resulting in a bad looking text. Don't worry about this. We have already planned a [trim] command to remove any unwanted space.

Update #3

Hello again.

With this update we proudly present you our updated website: http://www.divinegames.it ! There you will find FAQs and screenshots of Divine Gamebook Creator as well as some info about our team.

Last week we managed to produce an early version of the book you see in our presentation video, this time using only our tool. In the following pictures you will see examples of:

  • The Summary (Left) Page;
  • Input System;
  • Stats System;
  • Advanced jumps using from().

On to the pictures:

  1. This is how you add stats to the book using the root folder.
    1. Adding Stats
  2. This is the summary page.
    1. Summary Page → Summary Page Output
  3. This is an example of how a reader can input its player name.
    1. Name Input → Name Input Result
  4. Here you can see how you allow readers to input their stats. Notice the [statsleft] command, which manages stats points to distribute.
    1. Distributing Stats Points → Distributing Stats Points Output
  5. In this (apparently) complex page you see how the program acquires stats points through the get() function, and how you can use advanced jumps.
    1. Character Creation 1 and Character Creation 2 → Character Creation Output 1, Character Creation Output 2, Character Creation Output 3, Character Creation Output 4
  6. Here you can see an example of a real book page and initialization of many of the summary page variables.
    1. Real Book Page 1 → Real Book Page 1 Output
  7. Another example of a real page: here you chose to take the money from page 1, therefore the summary page has updated your possessions.
  8. Real Book Page 2 → Real Book Page 2 Output

Update #4

Hello folks, this is our fourth and last update. You may have not heard much from us recently, but we have been working on the project and we are finally approaching the polishing stage. Release candidates will be sent out soon to anyone who is entitled to see them.

Due to the shortage of funds we couldn't improve very much on graphics and language support, however the basic code structure is very solid and we've tested lots and lots of features such as tracemaps, RTF/PDF exporting and visually impaired support.

We hope you will enjoy our product!

As for the accessibility of the HTML format, you will be able to read and use HTML books on most of the modern digital platforms: all of the operative systems, tablets and most smartphones. It will also be compatible with most of the screen reader softwares.
3) Will writers be able to include pictures in their books? Yes. Larger pictures will be resized to a thumbnail which you can click and view full size.
4) Will our tool allow to print a tracemap of the book? Yes, we will include an option to generate a PNG image showing a color-coded map of all paths and locations in your book.
5) Will our software feature a random generator of events? Yes. We will include a random number generator which you can use to skill-test or luck-test the reader. I will provide a couple examples:


You are trying to break through a wooden door: you will succeed if a sum of your strength attribute and a random value is greater than 15, otherwise you'll fail.


You are looking for an elusive creature that you need to kill before you can advance in your adventure: each time you visit its lair, a random number is rolled and if it is greater than 10 you will find your creature in there.


6) Will you be able to create graphical adventures with our tool? No, we are talking gamebooks and text adventures only. Graphics you can use are limited to pictures you provide.
7) How do you write a book using our tool? Most of the features required to write a gamebook or a text adventure will be performed through the use of three simple commands: [condition], [operation] and [jump].


The [condition] command will check if a a condition is true, i.e. if you own a certain item, if your strength is greater than a certain value, if you killed a certain enemy, if you have enough money, if you invited someone to your party and so on. If the condition is true, its associated text will be displayed, otherwise it won't.


The [operation] command will be used to declare and edit variables, i.e. if the reader collects some money you must use an operation to increase its money value.


The [jump] command will be used to create choices and branching paths.


These commands will be used in a bbcode-like fashion, which we find to be the easiest to understand and to use in a text editor. Here are some examples:


[condition=Strength>10]This text will be shown only if your strength is greater than 10[/condition]


[operation]Money = +50[/operation]


[jump=Page 3]Go to page 3[/jump]


In addition, there will be many other utility commands for text-formatting, reader input and more.
8) What makes our tool better than other tools already out there? We aim at providing the simplest and and most complete tool ever made in the field of gamebooks and text adventures.
We have browsed through other existing softwares and I can say without a doubt that none of them offers BOTH the ease of use and all the features of our tool.
Usually gamebook editors are very limited, poorly structured and bad looking: more often than not they don't include a dynamic content system (no variables and conditions, no RNG), they force you to create tons of copypasted pages for each choice you want the reader to make, or they have a very bad internal navigation system, meaning that when you reach a considerable amount of pages, you won't have a clue where to go when looking for something. Our tool will not suffer from such problems as it will include dynamic content and an excellent internal navigation system with a tree-view of the book structure, the aforementioned tracemap and a jump-detect system that will show all jumps FROM and TO a certain page, creating buttons you can use to navigate directly through pages. Moreover, our program will include all the features of an advanced text editor such as automatic keyword highlighting, color coding, auto-complete and text folding.
On the other hand, text adventure editors are complete and not very limiting, but they are incredibly complicated to use. The large majority of those require some sort of programming knowledge, and the few ones which don't have 30+ pages of documentation describing features you will likely never use. A writer at his first book will feel overwhelmed and confused by the sheer amount (and uselessness) of options these softwares provide, and readers will probably miss the opportunity of having a new good book or adventure to play. Our tool will not require any kind of programming knowledge and writers will be able to understand how it works intuitively and immediately, although we will provide a detailed documentation anyways.
 

Update #2

Hello again folks,
we worked very hard last week in order to ready something for you to see, and we managed to build an alpha version with some of the basic commands which our software will have at the release. Please note that this is a very early stage of development, therefore you will not see all of the features which will be present in the final release. In the following pictures you will see examples and demonstrations of:


An early stage of the editor UI, including the tree structure;


The three main commands: condition, operation and jump;


Some basic text-formatting;


The random number generator;


HTML export.


On to the pictures:


This is the “root” folder, where you set the name and starting page of your book. When those features are ready, you will also be able to set the summary page (left page), stats points and stats themselves in this folder.


Root Folder




This is an example of a page and its HTML output.



Page → Page Output





These are the three main commands: [cond] stands for Condition, [op] stands for Operation and [jump] stands for… well, jump.



Main Commands → Main Commands Output





Some advanced features you can use with the three commands.



Main Commands Advanced → Main Commands Advanced Output





This is how the random number generator works.



Random Number Generator → Random Output 1 or Random Output 2





Some text formatting.



Text Formatting → Text Formatting Output





Folders can be useful to create an organized structure of your book, i.e. when you are in a large area and you want to name your pages after it, but you don't want to repeat that title every time, you can use a folder Prefix.


Folder: Book Folder



Example of Prefix usage: Book Structure → Book Structure Output





Finally, this is a page featuring all we have showed thus far. Your book pages will look something like this, perhaps with more formatting and longer text.



Sample Page → Sample Page Output 1 or Sample Page Output 2 and Sample Page Output 3





You will probably notice that output pages have a lot of empty lines corresponding to unverified conditions, resulting in a bad looking text. Don't worry about this. We have already planned a [trim] command to remove any unwanted space.

Update #3

Hello again.
With this update we proudly present you our updated website: http://www.divinegames.it ! There you will find FAQs and screenshots of Divine Gamebook Creator as well as some info about our team.
Last week we managed to produce an early version of the book you see in our presentation video, this time using only our tool. In the following pictures you will see examples of:


The Summary (Left) Page;


Input System;


Stats System;


Advanced jumps using from().


On to the pictures:


This is how you add stats to the book using the root folder.


Adding Stats




This is the summary page.



Summary Page → Summary Page Output





This is an example of how a reader can input its player name.



Name Input → Name Input Result





Here you can see how you allow readers to input their stats. Notice the [statsleft] command, which manages stats points to distribute.



Distributing Stats Points → Distributing Stats Points Output





In this (apparently) complex page you see how the program acquires stats points through the get() function, and how you can use advanced jumps.



Character Creation 1 and Character Creation 2 → Character Creation Output 1, Character Creation Output 2, Character Creation Output 3, Character Creation Output 4





Here you can see an example of a real book page and initialization of many of the summary page variables.



Real Book Page 1 → Real Book Page 1 Output





Another example of a real page: here you chose to take the money from page 1, therefore the summary page has updated your possessions.



Real Book Page 2 → Real Book Page 2 Output




Update #4
Hello folks, this is our fourth and last update. You may have not heard much from us recently, but we have been working on the project and we are finally approaching the polishing stage. Release candidates will be sent out soon to anyone who is entitled to see them.
Due to the shortage of funds we couldn't improve very much on graphics and language support, however the basic code structure is very solid and we've tested lots and lots of features such as tracemaps, RTF/PDF exporting and visually impaired support.
We hope you will enjoy our product!

story:
Our Story

Originally conceptualized in 2008, Gamers United is an organization bringing the video gaming community and industry together, showcasing the positive aspects of video gaming to the world. Each year we help organizations, such as children's hospitals, in need of support. Gamers United is dedicated to giving back and highlighting the video gamers’ youthful and giving spirit.

 

The Impact

Do you remember what it feels like to be sick? Do you remember a time where your had a fever so high you felt as if you were on fire or felt so weak that even just lying in bed made you uncomfortable? This is nothing compared to what some of the children in hospitals are feeling and experiencing every day of their young lives.

 

This is your chance to make that experience a little bit easier by providing entertainment that can help act as a temporary escape from reality as well as be used for rehabilitation and exercise for recovery.  

 

We need your to help make this dream a reality but regardless of the outcome of this campaign, we are committed to our cause and will continue to make a positive impact on children and their families through video gaming.

 

What We Need & What You Get

By taking part in this campaign, you are helping us help children throughout Southern California.  Your contributions will help us purchase new hardware, software, and additional gaming equipment for hospitals, as well as reach out to new beneficiaries who may not have gaming options available for patients.  While some games are designed to entertain and escape reality, we also focus on games that can educate, stimulate, and allow for physical development. Our goal is to reach out and connect with as many hospitals as we can and establish gaming centers within these facilities so children will have a place to escape to outside the confines of their hospital rooms. Additionally, we are aiming to reach beyond Southern California in the upcoming months.

 

This is a unique campaign because of the varied number of perks available.  Some of the perks exclusive to this campaign include artwork from Andie Tong and Kevin Mellon, in-game art from Game Mechanics, a personalized voicemail recording from True Blood star Janina Gavankar, as well as prize packs from Nyko, Konami, Disney, Sony Online Entertainment and more.

 

On behalf of Gamers United and our beneficiaries, thank you for your support on this campaign.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Are you unable to make a financial contribution, but still want to get involved?  Follow us on Twitter or “Like” us on Facebook and help evangelize our campaign to all your friends. 


Check out the donations page on the Gamers United official site if you would like to donate items for our beneficiaries and send items to:

Gamers United, Inc.
360 W. Avenue 26, Suite 437 
Los Angeles, California 90031

story:
Aincrad Rift

After watching Sword Art Online, did you ever dream of living in the world of Aincrad? Do you want to fight monsters, clear levels, join a guild and buy your own house in Virtual Reality?

Well that dream will become a reality.

Since Oculus Rift Consumer Version will be released next year, we need a solid VRMMORPG Game that has many levels and has thousands of players online. 

Aincrad Rift is a Virtual Reality game inspired by Sword Art Online and will have hundred of quest, items and monsters. It will have a unique character creator and will have different skills and stats per individual. The game will also have a voice chat for communication and team battle strategies.


What is Aincrad?


Aincrad  is the first Realized World shown in the Sword Art Online series and the stage for the first VRMMORPG, Sword Art Online, created by Kayaba Akihiko. It later became one of the nine realms of New ALfheim Online and the stage for the game's second Grand Quest.


 Requirements

  • A reliable internet connection
  • Oculus VR Head-Mounted Display
  • Compatible HDMI 1.3 video output
  • 2 USB 3.0 ports
  • Windows 7 SP1 or newer
  • Virtuix Omni/Cyberith Virtualizer (Optional)
  • PrioVR (Optional)

The Game will support the Virtuix Omni, Cyberith Virtualizer, and PrioVR for better presence and immersion of the game.


Features

  • 100 Floors to explore.
  • Unique Character Creator.
  • Voice Chat Messages
  • Player vs Player Battles
  • Ingame Vacation House
  • Crafting and Cooking System
  • SAO inspired Main Menu
  • Artificial Intelligent NPC
  • Virtuix Omni/Cyberith Virtualizer Support
  • PrioVR Support
  • Multi-Player dungeon run
  • and many more to come.

Where will the Money Go?

The funds will be used mainly for programming the game. We will also buy quality softwares for creating a rich and immersive environments. The remaining funds will be used to pay for our servers.


About Us

VR-Next is a team of gamers and programmers who are passionate to create Virtual Reality contents that will allow everyone to fully enjoy and interact with other player in a virtual world. Our team has a background in Information Technology, Digital Simulation and Gaming, Computer Science and Engineering.



Risk and Challenges
Since we will be creating a game inspired by Sword Art Online the game itself will not be a full replica of Sword Art Online due to copyrights but we hope to keep it as close to the show to give you the best experience of Sword Art Online.

story:
Jump into the world of Dwarven Wizard Soccer Leagues. A very competitive fast-paced, beer-drenched sport!

Compete in shouting matches with up to 3 of your friends over some good old healthy couch competitive rivalry!

The game is being worked on by a tiny team of developers that are nearly finishing their college degrees. We need your help to ensure our vision can be achieved. As students it will be pretty hard to afford the cost of a soundtrack, voice acting, more art and all the legal fees. Every bit helps!

Try not to step on your beards out there!

We are having a blast designing various Wizards for you to enjoy. Each one is carefully crafted around its theme. We try to make each one as fun and powerful as we can without breaking the game!

The Occultist can quickly Teleport around the field. Swap positions with your enemies to cripple their defenses!

The Warlock can leave Tentacle Traps™ that hurdle the ball towards their master's desired direction!

Stay tuned for the many others that will follow!

Want to design a Wizard?  There's a reward for just that!

Making a game requires effort and money. We've been taking care of both of those but the latter id getting hard to handle. Your kind donations will go to the following:

The game has no sound yet, so a lot of funding will be needed for that.

Making it online multiplayer is also pretty tough. Dedicated servers are not cheat and neither is the ammount of code needed for the game to run smoothly on the player end. Implementing this is probably the biggest risk with the project.

Support our development of the game and get one of these:

Your donation will get your name on the game credits!

One Champions of the MountainHomes steam key!

Your name on the credits!

One Champions of the MountainHomes steam key!

Receive Beta testing versions of the game and help shape it!

Your name on the credits!

Four Champions of the MountainHomes Steam keys to share among friends!

Your name on the credits!

Work with the team to design a Wizard of your liking!

Tell us what it should look like and what abilities you'd like it to have!

Try to keep it coherent with the style of the game.

Appear in the credits as a Designer for your Wizard!

The game is rather ambitious in the ammount of Wizards and Maps that we want to implement but we're pretty sure that we've proven our worth with the ones we made already.

Online multiplayer will be a pain to implement and will probably take the longest to arrive to beta testers.

We are thinking of also adding a single player campaign that would feature a story arch and various bosses with their own fields but it will depend on what money we can raise. Think of it as a stretch goal.

If we miss our goal

The game will get done with or without money. We just really wanted to have it be as good as it can be and some things would have to be scrapped if we don't raise what we need. The custom soundtrack and the single player campaign would probably be the first things to go.

If you can't afford to help us with money (that's okay, we can't help ourselves that way either), you can still help a lot by spreading the word to your friends and on social media!

Use the indiegogo share buttons and help us get out there!

Thank you!

story:
Mobility-Gaming has been in the E-Sports scene since 2007 and has been Self Sponsored the entire time, Mobility-Gaming CS:GO has been tearing it up since last year at ESEA final 1.6 and this year as the ESEA Im Champions Online! 

Mobility-Gaming CS:GO was invited to the ESWC Qualifiers in Montreal Canada July 18-19th 2014 Where we were able to get a Second Place finish against IBuyPower - 

Because we placed second we qualify for ESWC Paris but we have to fund it ourselves. After spending all our Prize money from ESEA IM Championships to fly/drive to Montreal we are Broke! And need everyone's help getting us to Paris! 

Our Goals 

We need $10,000-12,000  Minus all our Indiegogo fees and reward fee's  To help fund our Trip to Paris each player needs about $1500-$1,800 as well this is on top of personal contributions and will help us get to ESWC Pairs 2014.  

Anything past our funding  needs will be used to Provide Gamer Jersey to our teams instead of T-Shirts, as well as Attend some Local NA lans when we return. 

With everyone's help Mobility-Gaming can attend ESWC Paris 2014 and get a shot at being an International Team! We have been trying for 7+ years to reach this goal and Get into a Major World Event and we can finally do it with all of your help! and support. 

All we ask is that if you cannot Donate even $5 to at least Share our Link and Spread the word! It only will take a minute and its only going to take 1000 People giving us $10 to make this dream come true! 

If someone can get $60,000 for Potato salad than this should be a walk in the park please make our e-sports dreams come true and send us to Paris Games Week!

Sponsors in E-Sports

Sponsors are few and far between and there are thousands of gaming teams around the world, and they cant all have sponsors. The problem with e-sports today is the best 24-32 teams in the world are the same teams that have been the best 24-32 teams in the world since when E-Sports began because they have the sponsors and the funding to go to every single event, it is almost impossible to get a sponsorship at the same level these teams already have.  Please help Mobility-Gaming break into the International scene and become a top world team to contend with the top Organizations today! 

    Risks & Challenges

    The Risks are that we could still come in last place in Paris but it would be a Great Gain for Mobility-Gaming CS:GO and the Organization.

    Competing on an international Level is something Mobility-Gaming has been striving for since 2007 with a large Online presence we want to take Mobility International! to LANs across EU and NA 

    Please help our team reach our E-Sports goals by helping us get to ESWC Paris! during the Games Week in October/November  2014

    All rewards will be fulfilled after we return from Paris and production has been completed, we will have people that ordered custom t-shirts fill out their name/gamer tags on time when the info is requested and everything should be completed by January 2015

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We understand that not everyone can afford to donate or has the ability to donate. What would help us is if you shared our Indiegogo campaigns with everyone you know, and ask them to share it with everyone that they know. Word of mouth travels far on the internet with the power of 10 Please help us help you help us get to ESWC Paris 2014! and make our E-Sports Dream a reality.

story:
HISTORIA

 

Hace ya mucho mucho tiempo, en un pueblo muy muy lejano... nah! Mejor dejo esa forma de expresarse para los de Star Wars, pero por ahí van los tiros.

Recuerdo en mi niñez los cyber como un punto de reunión de todos aquellos "frikis" de la época y lo recuerdo con cierto cariño y ternura.

Lo que propongo es una evolución muy grande de ese concepto: un local donde la gente que le gusten los videojuegos, manga, anime, películas, etc se puedan reunir y disfrutar entre ellos no sólo de su compañía, sino también de los servicios que el bar ofrece como eventos, torneos, directos... Un lugar donde nadie queda fuera. Donde sentirse como en casa.

 

 

 

¿Porqué esa meta?

 

Los 15.000€ flexibles de este proyecto servirían como un seguro para el proyecto.

Por todos es sabido que un alquiler, unas obras y, en definitiva, un proyecto de ese calibre puede salir muy bien pero siempre hay tendencia a tener imprevistos y eso es lo que podría hacer caer este sueño.

Con vuestra ayuda, no caeremos.

 

 

GRACIAS A TI

 

Gracias a tu aportación tendremos un punto de encuentro para todos con un único fin: pasarlo bien.

Para ello, aparte de la barra de bar, contaremos con:

  • 12 PC de última generación con los juegos más nuevos del mercado y más importantes del competitivo actual.
  • 5 pantallas dispersadas por el local con diversos streamings de videojuegos.
  • Múltiples consolas con las que poder jugar sólo o con amigos como si estuvieses en tu propia habitación.
  • Proyector con sofás donde poder disfrutar las mejores competiciones del mundo competitivos de los mejores videojuegos.

 

 

FORMAS DE COLABORAR

 

Obviamente la forma más directa de colaboración es a través del proyecto crowfunding pero, en caso de no poder, agradecería mucho que apoyases el proyecto compartiendo esto a través de cualquier red social.

 

Ya sabes, cualquier ayuda cuenta.
story_txt:
HISTORIA
 
Hace ya mucho mucho tiempo, en un pueblo muy muy lejano... nah! Mejor dejo esa forma de expresarse para los de Star Wars, pero por ahí van los tiros.
Recuerdo en mi niñez los cyber como un punto de reunión de todos aquellos "frikis" de la época y lo recuerdo con cierto cariño y ternura.
Lo que propongo es una evolución muy grande de ese concepto: un local donde la gente que le gusten los videojuegos, manga, anime, películas, etc se puedan reunir y disfrutar entre ellos no sólo de su compañía, sino también de los servicios que el bar ofrece como eventos, torneos, directos... Un lugar donde nadie queda fuera. Donde sentirse como en casa.   ¿Porqué esa meta? Los 15.000€ flexibles de este proyecto servirían como un seguro para el proyecto.
Por todos es sabido que un alquiler, unas obras y, en definitiva, un proyecto de ese calibre puede salir muy bien pero siempre hay tendencia a tener imprevistos y eso es lo que podría hacer caer este sueño.
Con vuestra ayuda, no caeremos.
  GRACIAS A TI
 
Gracias a tu aportación tendremos un punto de encuentro para todos con un único fin: pasarlo bien.
Para ello, aparte de la barra de bar, contaremos con:

12 PC de última generación con los juegos más nuevos del mercado y más importantes del competitivo actual.
5 pantallas dispersadas por el local con diversos streamings de videojuegos.
Múltiples consolas con las que poder jugar sólo o con amigos como si estuvieses en tu propia habitación.
Proyector con sofás donde poder disfrutar las mejores competiciones del mundo competitivos de los mejores videojuegos.

 
 FORMAS DE COLABORAR
 
Obviamente la forma más directa de colaboración es a través del proyecto crowfunding pero, en caso de no poder, agradecería mucho que apoyases el proyecto compartiendo esto a través de cualquier red social.
 
Ya sabes, cualquier ayuda cuenta.

story:
We are a small team of dedicated game developers working on casual mobile games. We live in the Czech Republic (yeah, that small country in the middle of Europe) and we have always dreamed of making games and now finally after months of hard work we can show you guys fruition of our work. 

Since our young age we have been interested in computers and game development and all of us have some past experience with game development but T-Pong will be our first big project and we need that little boost from you guys to get it started. 

For our game we decided that best possible choice we have is campaign at indiegogo. As a new indie studio we most certainly didn’t want to be tied to a publisher. The main reason is because we care about our games and we really want to put our heart and soul in our work. And that’s a lot harder when you have a publisher. So we decided to tell you guys about our work and let the customers, gamers and people who want to support our project decide if T-Pong is worth your hard earned cash.


For those of you who don’t know what is original Pong. It’s very old and it is one of the earliest arcade video games. It’s a tennis sports game featuring simple 2D graphics.

2 players battle each out in small playing field using bats. Score is calculated by a hit in enemy goal. Player with most points wins the match.



For our first game we decided to go with old-school classic Pong. It’s quite sad that no one tried to adopt this game to new mobile technologies. 

There is so much more new stuff that can be added, it’s incredible. In our opinion PONG is a great game concept but it can be improved by quite a bit. And we want to bring those improvements to you. Possibilities are endless and with support from you we can bring some of these to you.

As a kids we loved classic PONG so it just seems right to recreate it and make it even more awesome then before. And lets face it. Who doesn't like pong? We sure do.

It’s an old school legend wrapped in a new style. Using cartoonish graphics together with awesome new way of playing pong makes this game so much more fun. 

We have many different improvements – small and big. Game will feature full blown customization and you will be able to see huge focus on personalization of your game. This will be done by our so called “skins” and other customization options – begging form simply coloring your name to complete game overhauls. 


But that’s not all! For sake of diversity we added 3 types of bats each witch their own advantages and disadvantages. For example, big bat will be the slowest of all bats but on the other hand it will be ….well, the biggest. This allows players to shape the game to their liking and not play by the “rules”. If you don’t want to play with a big slow bat, no one is forcing you, just select the other one. 

On top of all this we added in-game skills. They are basically special abilities you can use to either help yourself or to confuse your opponent. These will be divided into two categories – defensive and offensive. You can activate defensive skills when you are in trouble and need that extra help. Just slow your opponent ball or build yourself a wall. On the other hand offensive skills will be used when you really want to score that point. You can split a ball in two or even change trajectory of the ball. At release the game will have 18 unique skills and for each game you will be able to choose 3. This creates very immersive and dynamic experience never seen in pong games before. 


Our ultimate goal – Multiplayer. This will be our main feature. You will be able to play T-PONG against anyone from the entire world. Matches will be divided in 2 types. Co-op multiplayer (more on that later) and versus with includes 2 players matches and progression in ranking ladder. 

You can play multiplayer either with your friends or complete strangers. And each match will be recorded in your statistics. You will be able to view statistics in your profile page. Those will feature many things, like win/lose ratio or usage of each of your abilities. You will even be able to see what your favorite bat is. 

CO-OP

If we reach 100% we will add co-op matches. These matches will have up to 4 players divided into teams of two. The matches will be the same as classic 2 players versus multiplayer, but we will tweak the game mechanics to fit 4 players playing in single match and ensure best possible experience. Matches can be played either with friends or completely random people. You will be able to invite your buddy to a team and together crush anyone who dares to challenge you. Or play a friendly match with 4 other friends and have a great time playing the game together.  


EVENTS IN MULTIPLAYER MATCHES

From time to time we will launch special online events where players can battle for valuable rewards. For example we can do stuff like IOS vs ANDROID where entire platform will get a brand new exclusive skin. If they win off course.


To release a game. We need to pay developer license and fees to app stores. Money to buy needed software. And also we need your help to monetize our game. If we manage to reach 100% we will include co-op campaign.


STRETCH GOALS


You on the other hand you will get great rewards. We offer you huge amount of in game cosmetic bonuses like new exclusive looks or colored names. And that’s not all! We will give you guys proper recognition in credits or our T-pong webpage. And you will be able to get our exclusive T-PONG and TTWELVE T-Shirt. And for those of you who really want to participate and help us make this game awesome we prepared something special! You will name your achievements and skills! You can become our advisor in development! We also offer exclusive USB card with 8GB of memory, postcard send right to your home and even a TPONG themed mouse pad. There will also be our "be a ball reward" in with you can send your face to us and we will make it an in-game ball or you will be able to design your very own skin.


USB CARD 8GB - INDIEGOGO EXCLUSIVE

T-SHIRT B/W - INDIEGOGO EXCLUSIVE


MOUSE PAD - INDIEGOGO EXCLUSIVE


POSTCARD - INDIEGOGO EXCLUSIVE

Proof of concept, 3D render - PUPPY (not the final product)


WALLPAPERS  - INDIEGOGO EXCLUSIVE

SKINS  - INDIEGOGO EXCLUSIVE

REWARDS


You can follow us on twitter or visit our webpage. But most importantly spread the word! Let people know about us! If we don’t raise enough money we won’t be able to release some parts of our game. And that would make us very sad. We really want to make this game awesome!

story:
SEE GALLERY FOR APP MOCKUP

I am a determined 16 year olds who have a great idea for a new iPhone game. It is called Wheel of Death and is about a man who is standing ontop of a wheel. The wheel is above a pool of lava. When the game starts, the wheel begin to to turns slowly and speed up over time. In order to survive, the player would need to tilt the iPhone, making the man ontop of the wheel run (more tilt = faster run). Over time, the wheel wil begin to switch directions and do other things. If the player happens to fall into the lava, he will lose one of his three lives. The longer time the player can stay ontop of the wheel, the more points he or she will recieve. I guarantee you that it will be a fun game. I have contacted many developers, who said that it would be easy to design. However, the devoloper that offered the best price said thathe would need about 10.000 dollars. Once I get the money I will accept his offer and he will begin working on the app. We also need about 5,000 dollars for advertising purposes. I have been designing this app for five years now and have worked very hard on it. I will personally see to it that all the money raised goes towards the app. Thank You. Anything helps!

story:
Short Summary

I just really want some guns skins so I don't look like such a scrub.

What We Need & What You Get

All the money goes straight to buying guns and if you donate $10 I'll name the gun whatever you want me to.

The Impact

It will make me feel way cooler when I'm playing CS:GO.

Other Ways You Can Help

You could always just send me some skins at http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198087051336/

story:
World Football 2014 is being developed by a group of games industry veterans – between us we've around 90 years of experience making games.  We have been working on this game in our spare time for many man years now.  In terms of "safe bets" you can be sure that we'll get this game out on time and have delivered a fun game!

It is a traditional football action game, with a slightly “retro” look so as to differentiate from a visual perspective against our key competitors.

The game is viewed from a side-on angle, much like ISS was back in the day.

Game modes include World Tournament, World League and Scenarios, along with Quick Match friendlies.  In the World League mode a currency system will be utilised allowing users to upgrade player stats, overcome injuries faster and so on.  Scenarios put you in the shoes of real life events and you have to match or better those events to advance.  Additional scenarios will be made available for download during the course of the summer.

We are actively attempting to sign a variety of high profile licenses for the game, having these will help massively with regard to raising our profile and the promotion of the game. These licenses will also enable us to include official content in the end product.  As and when any license is actually signed we'll announce it on these pages.

The game will be released on iOS, Android and Windows 8 phones and tablets in late May 2014.


UPDATE:

We're delighted to be able to finally announce that legendary football commentator John Motson will be recording the in-game commentary for us.  Probably the most famous and respected English commentator of the last 40 years, we are honoured that Motty has agreed to work with us on this project.

He'll be in the recording studio in south east England at the start of April.  Backing the "They think it's all over" perk to the right will mean you can come and join us in the studio.

 

 

World Football 2014 is a product of the Greenshoots programme, jointly developed by Creative England and Microsoft and supported by the Government's Regional Growth Fund.  The funding we received from that programme allowed us to sign-up a football commentator for the game, money has been set aside for improved UI, visuals, audio, localising the game into 6 languages and so on. It’s also enabled us to develop a Windows 8 version too.

It’s been great to get that money and it’s all been put to very good use.  Already we have a much stronger game than we did 6 months ago.

So why do we need money from you via Indiegogo? Quite simply to make the game even better!! We've got a game that we feel confident plays very well and has come on a lot, but we feel we could increase the quality a little bit more. Therefore we're looking to raise £10,000 to help us achieve our goals.

None of our development team is being paid any money to make this game. We're doing it for the love of football games and to make the kind of game we all enjoy playing. Hopefully the game will do well enough that we'll get something back post release. But all money we receive will go towards a better end product and nothing else, which in turn benefits our end users.


There are 5 key areas that will all benefit directly from every penny we raise, beyond the cost of the perks. 

Animations:  Increase the range and quality of player animations.

Graphics:  Improve the quality of player models and in-game graphics.

Audio:  Increase the number of sound effects, adding more variety.  Also increasing the number of audio tracks in the game, again so there's a variety of tunes you'll hear when in the front end.

Localisation:  Spending money on localising text into further languages will increase the reach of the game.  Additional languages will include Dutch, Russian and Indian as a minimum, taking our in-game text to at least 11 languages –
English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Brazilian/Portugese, Chinese,
Japanese, Indian, Dutch and Russian.

Promotion:  Getting word out about the game isn’t easy. We’ll also spend some of what we raise on a PR & Marketing campaign to raise awareness.

 

As we mention above, we don't need the money to complete the game, purely to improve the quality of it.  So don't fear, if we fall short the game will still be released in May this year.  We'll just not be able to do all of what we mention above.


Naturally, there are risks and challenges associated with all projects.  We have held off doing this crowd funding until the latter part of development so that the majority of our risks have already been addressed.

Our team still have to finish the conversion across all formats of the game. The conversion to Windows 8 phones and tablets will be a first for our development team


Some of the licenses we had hoped to sign up by now are still to be completed.  Getting a number of these licenses will give us a great PR story.  Without these licenses the PR and marketing will be a lot tougher.  But our Licensing Agent is working relentlessly on ironing out the issues we have in bringing these deals to completion.  He is about to record a video talking about this, which we'll publish next week.  A bigger marketing budget, which we hope to achieve via this funding, will help with our marketing plans, which in turn will help to complete the deals.


As you can see from the perks on the right, there's a wide range of perks being made available.

We've a wide range of World Football branded merchandise available.  In addition we are creating a "Matchday Programme", much like you can buy at football grounds around the world.  This will include features with the development team and interviews with our commentator.  It will also include interviews and photo's of some of our contributors, along with a full list of all contributors.  So everyone who contributes £15 or more will get a copy of this delivered to your door as a unique record of your involvement in getting this game made.

At the top end, one donator will get to spend the day in a recording studio with our commentator to watch a real expert at work. A number of you will also be invited to our launch event, location and timing is to be confirmed, but the free alcohol on offer is definitely confirmed!  Transport costs won't be provided for these perks though, so please consider this when making your pledge.

We also have some perks that involve creating content and being actively involved in the development of the game.  This is a great chance to get a credit in a game that we're sure will be well received by the public and media alike.

 

As we say, World Football 2014 is being developed by a group of games industry veterans.  Some of the team are employed with other development teams and are doing this project in their own time because of our collective desire to create a great football game. Because of this we haven't attached our names to this project.

All members of our team development, production and design/community have been involved in some of the best loved football games of the last 20 years – with the exception of PES and Football Manager, two games we ALL love!  These games include but aren't limited to Sensible Soccer, Super Kick-Off, Actua Soccer, Premier Manager, Soccer ’97 and versions of FIFA. 

We’re all passionate football fans, love gaming and are now working together on our own football game!!  Most of us have season tickets for the teams we have supported all of our lives.

with the development team and interviews with our commentator.  It will also include interviews and photo's of some of our contributors, along with a full list of all contributors.  So everyone who contributes £15 or more will get a copy of this delivered to your door as a unique record of your involvement in getting this game made.At the top end, one donator will get to spend the day in a recording studio with our commentator to watch a real expert at work. A number of you will also be invited to our launch event, location and timing is to be confirmed, but the free alcohol on offer is definitely confirmed!  Transport costs won't be provided for these perks though, so please consider this when making your pledge.We also have some perks that involve creating content and being actively involved in the development of the game.  This is a great chance to get a credit in a game that we're sure will be well received by the public and media alike. As we say, World Football 2014 is being developed by a group of games industry veterans.  Some of the team are employed with other development teams and are doing this project in their own time because of our collective desire to create a great football game. Because of this we haven't attached our names to this project.All members of our team development, production and design/community have been involved in some of the best loved football games of the last 20 years – with the exception of PES and Football Manager, two games we ALL love!  These games include but aren't limited to Sensible Soccer, Super Kick-Off, Actua Soccer, Premier Manager, Soccer ’97 and versions of FIFA.  We’re all passionate football fans, love gaming and are now working together on our own football game!!  Most of us have season tickets for the teams we have supported all of our lives.

story:
Short Summary

The Oasis game is no ordinary game. Its mission is to mobilise people to transform a space in their area into an Oasis, and in the process, create community from the bottom up.

Last year we played the game in Newham with Momentum and Lush and the impact of the game has had real lasting effects in building a resilient community.

Now, a group of 60 of us from around the world are going to play the game in Brazil  and in the process, learn to faciliate it ourselves and take it to new places.

We each need to raise £1700 to make it happen. Which is where you come in. You give us a bob or two and we'll help make people's dreams come true! Literally.

What We Need & What You Get

I'm raising £1700 for the Elos Institute who run the training programme.

The money goes towards:

- Making a documentary

- Food and Accomodation for trainees

- Stationary and materials to run the game

- Staff costs in liaising with the local community and selecting candidates

As a means of expressing my gratitude and spread the love I'll be sending out some gifts made by myself or sourced from local companies who share the values of this project - connecting people and building community.

The Impact

Immediate impact:

  • Help us play the game - mobilising hundreds of people to create an Oasis in their area - this will be in one of the favelas around Santos, Brazil where it all started
  • Enable 60 young people from around the world to live as a community for a month and learn through experiencing the art of community-building

Long term impact:

  • Once I've learned it, I aim to take the game to new contexts to help catalyse resilient communities elsewhere
  • Enable 60 trainees to do the same, taking the game back to where they came from - among them India, Turkey, Bolivia, Zimbabwe and across Brazil
  • Long-term benefits for the local community - In Newham the game catalysed numerous positive initatives including the kids starting their own community choir and kick-started a long-term process of resilience-building in the community - find out more about the amazing things that have happened here: Ted X Newham

Other Ways You Can Help

Any amount, great or small, will help us on the way to playing the game.

If you can't spare financial capital, use your social capital - spread the word through your networks, and get the word out about the Oasis game on facebook, twitter, over a cup of tea.

Thank you. Obrigada!

To find out more:

Read my blog

Listen to a talk by the game's inventor, architect and social entrepreneur and all-round legend Edgard Goveia Junior

story:
Friday 20 September:

- A PREVIEW of our game is now available at http://www.shiftjoy.com/kickstarterdemo.html

(You'll need Unity Webplayer, google it).


Latest video (will update) :



Hello everyone, thanks for visiting our post :).  We are ShiftJoy, and we are the team behind Predator Realm. We're all teenagers (I'm 14, don't laugh, read on) but we have lots of experience in gaming, game design and technology and have help from our families for all the legal and money stuff :3

I'm Sol. Don't underestimate me just because I'm 14 :P. I started learning Unity (the game engine I am using) nearly 2 years ago and now I have enough experience to start creating my own game. I have always been into technology and gaming: I'm also a good web designer, and I've picked up several clients in my town to design websites for. 

I worked hard designing websites and making small games in Unity for 8 months, until I had enough money to buy my very own Macbook Pro :D. It's certainly my most prized possession! Now I am using it to develop Predator Realm, with the help of my family and friends for some graphics design, legal stuff and sorting out the money.

The rest of us have a similar sort of experience as me, and we make a great, hard-working team!

We're not the only teenagers who have made games. Robert Nay created 'Bubble Ball' when he was 14, and that became the top App Store game (beating Angry Birds) in 2011. Harry Moran created 'PizzaBot' when he was 12 which became the top Mac App Store game in 2011, too. (Yes, I've done my research!). I'm sure there are many more...

Well, enough about me, and us. Don't worry, we're not the sort of people who give up easily, and we're aiming to update our group website (http://www.shiftjoy.com) with videos and snaps from development once a week at least :D.

Our workstation ^


Predator Realm is an awesome third-person zombie shooter. It has more of a casual, arcade style compared to other FPS zombie games, but we are working on awesome graphics and different gamemodes to suit every PC gamer. 

We're working on these game modes:

- Infinite Survival (Single Player) - infinite waves of zombies, gets harder and harder, ends when you die

- Adventure (Single Player) - progress through the levels

- Co-op Infinite Survival (2-4 Players) - Same as Infinite Survival, but with your friends online

- Deathmatch (2-8 players) - No zombies! Kill your rival players, the most kills wins!

(possibly a CTF gamemode too - thinking about it).

The main character is Zayn, a perfectly normal man, who is the only survivor of a mini-apocalypse in his hometown, up in the Heora Mountains. He must travel to the city and warn his fellow humans, and help them escape, before the whole area is taken over!

Currently Zayn has one weapon, an ACWR automatic rifle. It has a 26-round capacity and reloads in 1.5-2.5 seconds. We will, of course, be adding more weapons as the game progresses - one of the things we need the indiegogo money for is weapon design.

We're currently working on the Zombie AI and it is proving very successful. The zombie knows when to attack and will even attack other zombies if Zayn isn't close :P

We'll add a playable demo to our website (http://www.shiftjoy.com) once we've sorted the GUI.

The first release will be for Mac, Windows and Linux. 

If we reach the stretch goal below, we'll also develop it for iOS :D

We're not sure whether to make the game freemium (free, but pay for extras), or charge a small amount.

Of course, we're a very small team so we rely a lot on the internet for models, animations and stuff like that. Unfortunately, this costs a lot>_>.

Here is a rough breakdown of where your kind donations will be going:

- £1000 = Unity Pro (yes, we're still using the free version), this will mean better graphics and much better performance for you!

- £70 - Mac App Store Licence for our first year publishing

- £200 - Animations, 3D models, weapon design and sound effects to make the game look better and feel better

- £80 - PayPal and IndieGogo fees


I am an OK musician (grade 5 piano, love Logic Pro and synthesisers) so we won't have to pay for music scoring, hopefully :)

In case you guys are ultra kind, we've put together some stretch goals!

£1500 (+£150) = 3 more maps, 1 more gamemode

£2000 (+£650) = Game available to play FOR FREE ONLINE (pay for extras)

(this is expensive because we would need a server)

£3000 (+£1650) = iOS plus all above!


PLEASE CHECK OUT THE PERKS YOU CAN GET FOR PLEDGING! -----> 

If you can't donate, you can also help by sharing the link above with your friends and family. It is much appreciated!


If you have any questions, feel free to email us at shift.joy.com@gmail.com OR live-chat with us on our website, http://www.shiftjoy.com :D

story:
Rátkai István szöveges kalandjátékai a '80-as évek Commodore 64-es magyar játékainak megkerülhetetlen klasszikusai. 2015-ben egy hirtelen ötlettől vezérelve visszafejtettem az Időrégészt, az első Rátkai-játékot, majd újraírtam, hogy a böngészőben és Androidos mobiltelefonokon is játszható legyen

Idézetek az Időrégész felújított verziójáról:

"Gergőnek óriási riszpekt, a facebookos olvasóknak köszönet a projektben nyújtott segítségért, Gergőnek pedig óriási riszpekt (kettő is jár neki, legalább)." - IDDQD
"Azt androidos verzió kapcsán azt még kiemelném, hogy míg a legtöbb mobiljáték swipe-os irányítása eléggé lebuktatja a júzert, hogy játszik, egy szöveges kalandjátékkal pötyögni mobilon egészen olyan, mintha fontos emailt írna az ember. :) Szóval DOB MUNKA, JÁTSZIK IDŐRÉGÉSZ TELEFON." - IDDQD
".es meg a zene is Hat ez brutal :D koszonom az App-ot. Asszem megint vegig kell vinnem :D" 5*
"Hatalmas köszönet! Kb 10 éves lehettem amikor utoljára játszottam Idörégészel egy barátomnál mivel nekünk nem futotta C64re akkoriban.Azóta sem találkoztam a játékkal.Egy gyerekkori álmot váltottál valóra :) Köszi!" 5*
"Visszahozza az eredeti játék hangulatát, jól meg van csinálva. Gratula a fejlesztőnek!" 5*
"Őrült egy ötlet, de teljesen leköt. Annak idején hamar meguntuk, most igyekszem végigvinni. Mintha megint 12 lennék... Na, végigvittem. Király volt!" 5*
"Köszönöm a munkát, ami a játék működésre bírásához kellett
androidon. Jó érzés visszatekinteni a múltba." 5*
"Nagyon jó! Szerencsére nem koptak meg az emlékék, a megjelenés napján gyorsan végig is toltam (pontosabban amint hallottam róla). És emlékeztem mindenre 20 év távlatából. Nagyon igényes lett a mobilport, le a kalappal!" 5*

Most a második Rátkai-játékon, az idén 30 éves Bosszún a sor!

A Bosszú a klasszikus kungfu- és ninja-filmek világát eleveníti meg. Ellentétben a nagyrészt statikus világban játszódó Időrégésszel, gördülékeny története országokon átívelő kalandot mesél el.

"Még csináljatok támogatói verziót, mert szerintem lennénk páran, akiknek megér pár ezrest, hogy ismét gyerekek lehessünk. :)" 5* kritika a Google Play Store-on

A fenti kommentelő most megkaphatja, amit szeretne! A Bosszú visszafejtése felfedte, hogy az eredeti játék is már egy direkt erre a célre kifejlesztett, virtuális számítógépen futott. Ez azt jelenti, hogy ha ezt a virtuális gépet modern böngészőben és mobiltelefonon újraírom, akkor garantáltan 100%-os hűséggel prezentálható a játék!

Természetesen a projekt Rátkai István előzetes hozzájárulásával jött létre! 

A tervezett Bosszú összehasonlítása az Időrégésszel

  • A legfontosabb különbség, ahogy fent említettem, hogy a játék-logika nem újraírva lesz, hanem az eredeti program fog egy új virtuális gépen futni. Ez azt jelenti, hogy a játék teljes mértékben megegyezik az 1988-as eredetivel!
  • A webes verziót teljesen újra fogom írni, hogy választhatóan vagy az eredeti Bosszú színvilágát, vagy egy modern, szemnek kellemes, semleges színsémát használjon (hasonlóan a mobilos Időrégészhez). Természetesen a mentés/betöltés a böngészőben is működni fog! A webes verzió legfrissebb demóját itt próbálhatod ki.
  • A mobilos verzió nagyrészt hasonlítana az Időrégészhez, egy kicsit kiforrottabb felhasználói felülettel (gyorsgombok betöltéshez, elmentéshez és a legutóbbi parancs visszavonásához), és választhatóan az eredeti játék színeivel. Az Android verzió legfrissebb demóját innen töltheted le.
  • Ha sikerül az elérhetetlennek tűnő 4000 dollárt összekalapozni, akkor veszek belőle egy Mac gépet a fejlesztéshez, és megcsinálom a macOS-es és iOS-es verziót is!

Mi garantálja, hogy ha összejön a pénz, akkor valóban meg tudom csinálni a programot?

Egyrészt az Időrégész a Play Store-on jelenleg 4.3 csillagot kapott, és a fent idézett visszajelzések is magukért beszélnek; másrészt a Bosszú visszafejtésével már készen vagyok, már csak a böngészős és a mobilos felület megírása van hátra.

Androidra elkészült egy demo-verzió! Klikkelj ide a letöltéshez!
