story:
Ace Tales – A revolutionary flying adventure game, combining entertainment with helping homeless dogs.

What if you could play an entertaining game on your mobile device, and help feed a homeless dog at the same time?

So many dogs are abandoned each day, that dog shelters fill up and have trouble feeding and taking care of them. Many of the dog shelters function only because volunteers devote their money and time to help. It is said that around 4 million dogs get abandoned every year in the USA alone, and only 1 out of 10 dogs born will ever find a permanent home.

Our products available for pre-order


Please only enter a contribution that corresponds to the price of the perk you wish to purchase. Excess contributions will be treated as pre-orders for diamond packs and dog biscuits usable in the game with a code.To pre-order only diamond packs and dog biscuits, please choose "No perk" and enter a contribution corresponding to the amount of diamond packs and dog biscuits you wish to purchase.

Bugbyte and Ace Tales Big Mission

Bugbyte started in March 2012, consisting of two brothers with a passion and joy for gaming. We love games and have been playing games since early childhood. We also love animals and especially dogs. That's why we decided to combine the two!

Ace Tales is a game meant to support dog shelters all over the world. This game will be free to play with in-app purchases and advertisement, helping create real life value to homeless dogs. We here at Bugbyte have a vision to unite gaming and helping, by making revolutionary mobile games.

Bugbyte already has developed a game called Daredogs, focusing on helping dog shelters all over the world. The new game will work with the same concept, but this time we are more serious and doing it in a professional way.

Join us on the adventure to make a difference in a homeless dogs life. We find that a game that unites the whole world to help is an idea to fight for!

How does it work exactly?

Ace Tales will be published worldwide on Android and iOS, meaning most of the mobile devices today will be covered. As an easy to play game, it will contain a charity challenge feature, where you - the players - get us to donate simply by playing the game! 

Players main objective will be to collect dog biscuits, which are floating around in the game and rewarded when missions are completed. These biscuits can be donated to a biscuit pool, and when the pool is full the challenge is beaten! Players all over the world collect biscuits to this pool together.

This is all possible due to our revenue model. Our game revenue will consist of in-app purchases but advertisement revenue will also play a big part. The advertisement revenue is the reason why anyone can play the game for free and make a difference in a homeless dogs life. As a total we will donate 10-20% of the proceeds from Ace Tales. Our key focus is to become a company that can make many games, and find new dog shelters to help!

Why are we doing all of this?

We want to combine our joy and passion for both gaming and dogs. Our dog Pikko made our childhood a much happier one. He was always there greeting us when we came home, like he had not seen us in 10 years. This is our way of giving back.

Yes, we want to be a successful company but we also want to give back and be part of something bigger. It's the way of life we have chosen. Our mission is to make one of the best games ever, so that you will be entertained and feed a homeless dog at the same time!

Why indiegogo?

Bugbyte and its projects have been entirely self-funded up until this point. We risked it all to go indie and try to unite entertainment with real life helping. We have completed one project (Daredogs), and are very far on our second one (Ace Tales). Now we want to pre-sell Ace Tales products and Diamond packs for the game, to fully realize the Ace Tales potential.


The impact

If everything goes well, this game will be able to support multiple dog shelters with monthly donations. Which in turn will provide food and care for many many homeless dogs. If our game is a success our company will also be better fit to make new games in the near future, with the same concept.

Together we can change the future for homeless dogs for the better, one dog at a time!

Stretch Goals

The Game


The Bugbyte team

Everyone in our team takes part in making decisions regarding games, we want everyone to be heard and have a say in important matters. Even so, our team members do have main tasks to take care of.

Allan Junkkila, the one who makes it work.

Doc O'Hare, the faithful oddball companion to Ace.

Aksel Junkkila, the one who takes care of business.

Matti Vanhala, the one who makes it look good.

Ace, the hero who flies for his hometown.

Jenny Junkkila, the one who always helps.

Your money is safe with us: We have completed and published one game before, and been able to donate money to dog shelters. We also have a lot of trustworthy partners, which shows that we take things seriously.

Our partners

Kodittomat Espanjan Koirat ry

Founded in 2006, Kodittomat Espanjan Koirat ry has worked to better the life of homeless dogs. The operation is targeted mainly on the area of Costa del Sol in Spain, where the organization co-operates with carefully selected dog shelters. The operation consists mainly of helping the dog shelters with donation and finding new homes for homeless dogs.

NaNi Dogwear

NaNi is a Finnish company, which designs and makes handmade clothing for small dogs. The inspiration for design has been our own small dogs and their need for clothes.

HelsiTar

HelsiTar takes great pride of their custom made products and always try to be as environmentally friendly as possible. HelsiTar products are made by hand and with high quality which Finnish Avainlippu label also identifies.

Nina Ottosson

Nina Ottosson's philosophy is that the dog has four legs and one head, and all five need activity in different ways - both physical and mental. Nina Ottosson's range of durable interactive games have been designed to stimulate a dogs brain whilst reinforcing his relationship with people. Each design has a unique mechanism that requires mental as well as physical dexterity to work through the challenges and reveal hidden food rewards. 

Planet Pet Society

We are proud to offer your pet the best products available keeping your pet's well being in mind. We currently carry products for dogs and cats but in the near future our product range will also cover rodent and bird products too.

Risks, challenges and order cancellations

We feel very confident in our capabilities to complete this project, because we have done it before. Even though we are a young team, we have already gathered up a lot of experience. We know so much better now what it takes to make a good game. Our working methods have also changed to much more efficient ones, striding the project forward at a good pace.

1. The difficulty of porting the game to iOS is a little unknown. Our game development platform supports porting to some extent, but not yet perfectly. It might require a little tweaking, but with time we will have the game running on iOS as well.

2. Delays may occur with the deliveries of products if the amounts become really big, which we hope will happen by the way! Don't worry, we will work hard to get your purchases to you in a timely manner and keep you updated.

3. The confirmation of your order will be automatically e-mailed to you by indiegogo to the address you have provided to the service when signing up.

4. Orders of the Hau-Hau Wildlife Toy and the Treat Maze by Nina Ottosson may be cancelled within 14 days of receipt of the delivery. If you wish to cancel an order of such products, please provide the seller Bugbyte Productions (VAT FI24658122) with a notice (including your bank account number) to the e-mail address support@bugbyte.fi and return the unopened products in their original condition to the address Bugbyte Productions, Käsityöläiskatu 4a, 20100 Turku, Finland, whereupon we will refund your payment for the returned products by bank transfer.

5. Please note that orders of other Ace products sold on this page are non-refundable and order cancellations cannot be accepted. However, all contributions are naturally refunded if our campaign is unsuccessful in accordance with indiegogo's refund policy.

6. Our privacy policy. Should you have any questions with regard to the products or this campaign, please contact us: support@bugbyte.fi

We are committed and ready to take on all the possible challenges that may lie ahead of us. Since we are a small indie team it means we are also more dynamic, and adaptable to changes.

Frequently asked questions

What happens if the goal of $50 000 is not reached?

We will still complete the game for Android with basic features. Sadly, we cannot implement everything we wanted in the game. If the game brings us enough revenue, we will port the game to iOS later on.

We will also have to say good bye to Matti for now, which saddens us a lot.

How much do you donate?

As with our last game called Daredogs, we donate 10% of proceeds to good causes. We feel 10% is a good number, but hope to be able to donate more in the future. Now, when we are in the beginning, we also need money to build up the company.

If our 100 000 or 200 000$ stretch goals are met, we will up the donation ratio to 15% and 20% respectively!

How is it possible that I can play the game for free, and still help in real life value?

Our revenue model is based on in-app purchases and advertisement. So even if you don't buy anything, you are always worth something as a customer for advertising. It's just like in tv, the advertisements will have a slight negative impact on the game, but they will also make donations possible through free gaming.

You talk about a charity challenge, is it possible the challenge is never beaten and you keep all the money?

No. The challenge will always be beaten eventually. Our key focus is to be able to donate as much as we can, while keeping our company making new games and finding new dog shelters to donate to. The donation amount depends on how much the game has been played.

If I buy something in the game will I affect more?

Yes. A portion (10-20%) of everything that is bought will be donated to dog shelters.

I want many different products, how can I get them?

You can select and contribute multiple times. So select one perk and go ahead with payment. After it's done you can repeat the process with another perk you want.

How do I choose the right t-shirt?

If your dog weighs 1-6kg or 2 to 13lbs choose the Ace Dog T-Shirt small. We will send you an e-mail and ask you for your dogs exact size and color preference.

If your dog weighs more than 6kg or 13lbs please choose the Ace Dog T-Shirt big. We will send you an e-mail and ask you for your dogs exact size and color preference.

We will contact you after the campaign is over and ask you for the exact size and color you want.

Do I have to pay separately for shipping?

No. We have included the price of shipping to the products, making it easier for you to participate.

Get the word out & Referral Contest!

Even if you can't contribute, we are very grateful for your help in raising awareness. You can share this on social media with the IndieGoGo sharing tools up under the video, or emailing the page to someone you feel would be interested in this campaign.

Top 100 referrers will be rewarded with diamond pack prizes!

You can participate in this competition simply by sharing this campaign through the indiegogo tools below our video up top. Please do this while you are logged in to indiegogo! (Ensures that your actions are registered). Read about how it works here: Indiegogo referral contest

Places 1-20 will be rewarded with $100 diamond and biscuit packs.

Places 21-50 will be rewarded with $50 diamond and biscuit packs.

Places 51-100 will be rewarded with $20 diamond packs.

Ace Tales Facebook

Ace Tales Twitter

Ace Tales YouTube
story_txt:
Ace
Tales – A revolutionary flying adventure game, combining entertainment with helping homeless dogs. 



What if you could play an entertaining game on your mobile device, and help feed a homeless dog at the same time?
So
many dogs are abandoned each day, that dog shelters fill up and have
trouble feeding and taking care of them. Many of the dog shelters
function only because volunteers devote their money and time to help. It is said that around 4 million dogs get abandoned every year in the USA alone, and only 1 out of 10 dogs born will ever find a permanent home.

Our products available for pre-order
Please
 only enter a contribution that corresponds to the price of the perk you
 wish to purchase. Excess contributions will be treated as pre-orders 
for diamond packs and dog biscuits usable in the game with a code.To
 pre-order only diamond packs and dog biscuits, please choose "No perk" 
and enter a contribution corresponding to the amount of diamond packs 
and dog biscuits you wish to purchase.

Bugbyte and Ace Tales Big Mission 




Bugbyte started in March 2012, consisting of two brothers with a passion and joy for gaming. We love games and have been playing games since early childhood. We also love animals and especially dogs. That's why we decided to combine the two!
Ace Tales is a game meant to support dog shelters all over the world.
This game will be free to play with in-app purchases and advertisement, helping create
real life value to homeless dogs. We here at Bugbyte have a vision to
unite gaming and helping, by making revolutionary mobile games.



Bugbyte
already has developed a game called Daredogs, focusing on helping dog shelters all over the world. The new game will work
with the same concept, but this time we are more serious and doing it in a professional way.


Join
us on the adventure to make a difference in a homeless dogs life. We
find that a game that unites the whole world to help is an idea to
fight for!How
does it work exactly?






Ace Tales will be published worldwide on Android and iOS, meaning most of
the mobile devices today will be covered. As an easy to play game, it
will contain a charity challenge feature, where you - the players - get
us to donate simply by playing the game! 

Players main objective will be to collect dog biscuits, which are floating around in the game and rewarded when missions are completed. These biscuits can be donated to a biscuit pool, and when the pool is full the challenge is beaten! Players all over the world collect biscuits to this pool together.


This
is all possible due to our revenue model. Our game revenue will
consist of in-app purchases but advertisement revenue will also play a big
part. The advertisement revenue is the reason why anyone can
play the game for free and make a difference in a homeless dogs
life. As a total we will donate 10-20% of the proceeds from Ace Tales.

story:
The campaign has ended, but you can still get a Bowslinger at www.wemak.in!


Wow!  The Indiegogo campaign has ended with the equivalent of 151 Bowslingers sold.  We'd like to thank all of our supporters for all your contributions, likes, shares, and tweets!  The first production run is finished, and they look (and shoot) awesome!

The Bowslinger is now available for purchase at the WeMakin shop, as well as Amazon.com and eBay.  Use discount code INDIE20 at the WeMakin shop for an instant 20% discount!


Bowslinger: Loom Band Gun

Bowslinger is a compact 6-shot rubber band gun specifically designed to fling those multicolored "loom bands" at an incredible speed!  

If you're familiar with loom bands, we're betting you've already flung some yourself with great results.  They really go!  

But what's missing is a compact and elegant delivery system that lets you target those bad boys right where you want 'em, one after another.  Whether it's dinner table mayhem, dorm warfare or office blitzkrieg, the Bowslinger can put an invisibly fast  loom band right on your target!


Bowslinger uses our own custom design of the classic 6-shooter escapement to provide quick and reliable slingin', while delivering an incredibly satsifying "clacka - clack" with every shot.  It's easy to load, and even easier to fire.

This project is already fully designed, modelled, prototyped and verified by the tooling house for manufacturability.  We need your help to fund the first run of mass production!  

But hey, even if you aren't interested - please pass the project along to your mischievous friend.  ;)   @Wemakin, or on Facebook, or www.wemak.in.

Just In - The first test shots of Bowslinger!

The Story

Bowslinger started with a simple, laser-cut acrylic plinker.  After several (read: many) revisions to work out the dimensions and get the trigger and spur operating correctly, we produced a few that workedso well, we wanted to expand and bring this fun little device to others.

Further experimentation showed that it wasn't going to be easy to produce consistent results on the teensy tiny pieces when using the laser cutter.  After kicking around some ideas and more experimentation, we determined that to produce a consistently awesome product...  It really needed to be injection molded!

We took our original 2D CAD files and enlisted the help of a 3D modelling engineer we'd met online.  This guy works in the molding industry and his hobby is modelling and molding toy guns.  Talk about a match made in heaven!

We kicked around more ideas and came up with some drafts that became our first CAD model.  We got a prototype made using SLS (Selective Laser Sintering).  It looked too realistic and fired terribly!  Although Rev A was a beautiful device, it was way too realistic and the function just wasn't there.

By changing the body profile and shifting the trigger mechanism higher in the body, we came up with a design that stretched the bands tight, low, and flat for jam-free loading while giving the band a nice "kick" upon release to smoothly clear it from the end hook. 

We also decided to move away from a realistic-looking gun.  It was never really the intention (but our CAD guy was awesome at it!), and just didn't fit the spirit of the project.

During some sketch sessions, we realized just how close our new design ideas were to a classic retro toy.  We changed the the shape and the proportions for rigidity and firing constraints, but by squaring out the body while keeping the barrel rounded we were able to make our improved design somewhat reminiscent of a classic shape you'll know and love.  That's why we call this model "The 8-bit"!

With CAD files in hand, we began talking to vendors about tooling.  Our CAD guy had quite a bit of molding experience and vendors were generally very pleased with our design and mold strategy.  

But there were still a few more improvements for mass production that we incorporated after prying tips and tricks from the molding guys.  Some for rigidity and easy alignment, some for clean injection and avoiding flow marks in the final plastic, and a couple to improve injection resolution to the point where we could get very fine detail when the tooling was built with EDM (Electrical Discharge Machining).

The next revision incorporated the manufacturability tweaks from the molding guys.  We decided it would be nice to add a bit of color to the the prototype, so we ran it through a round of fabric dye with great results!

It looked good, and fired like a dream!

We found the Bowslinger worked best with authentic Rainbow Loom rubberbands.  Some after-market loom bands were very soft and thin, and could potentially cause a jamming problem during fast firing.  We decided we needed to prevent this case entirely, so one more rev was made to allow slingin' of all types of mini rubberbands.

So... Is it going to work?

It sure is.  We started way back in the CAD phase talking to molding vendors about all aspects of the process: mold flow, molding variation, warp/sink/rigidity issues among many others.  We've produced a design that is robust, reliable, and easily manufacturable.  Actually, it's probably way overengineered for a little plastic toy.  But that's exactly the way we want it.

Our CAD models have been prototyped using high-resolution SLS and verified for smooth and reliable operation.  They have been double, and triple checked by the EDM (Electrical Discharge Machining) guys for production of a detailed and precise mold.  And they have had tons of plastic flow analysis and modelling to ensure excellent injection.  We've had more than one vendor tell us that even our first CAD files were 100% manufacturable even before doing our final polishing on the design!

The Bottom Line

We believe in this project.  It's a cool device, and it's going to be incredibly gratifying to have it produced in a slick and professional form.  You may have noticed that Bowslinger's funding goal is really quite low for an injection molding project.  That's because we believe so strongly, and are so confident in the design that we have already paid for most of the tooling costs ourselves.  

All costs from start of tooling to preparation of the first test shots (coming soon!) have already been 100% funded by us.  We need your help in funding the second part of the tooling preparation and the setup and manufacturing fees for the first production run.  It really is the final stretch here, folks.

Schedule

The tooling has just started.  It will take about 20 days to get a rough mold milled, at which point we will make "T1" test shots to check the injection, part fit and movement.  The results of that test will be posted here.

Then the mold needs about 7 days for final EDM shaping and polishing before "T2" test shots and color test can be done.

Once those are complete, we will be ready to do the first production run in early June and ship in Late June or early July.  This is not vaporware you'll wait a year for - if this Indiegogo campaign is successful, it will happen and it will happen NOW!

Risk

1) In the very worst case, our manufacturer botches T1-T3 test shots without providing a working device.  We have no further obligation to them, and we will walk away.  We will take your vote on whether to tool at our second manufacturer or just get your money back.

2) It works, but takes some tuning.  Our manufacturer has committed to tooling this to our satisfaction.  Small tuneups may take another week or two, and a full retool will be another month.  Again, we can walk away if the device is not molded to our satisfaction in 60 days.

3)The device is fully operational, but has cosmetic issues. A judgement call.  We won't accept a junky looking device, but we understand that weird molding marks or slight color mismatch is a risk in any injection molding project. We have negotiated up to 8 injection ports to minimize flow marks in the final product, and our vendor has assured us that our colors are among the easiest to produce. If the cosmetic issues are slight, we will move forward with production. If it looks terrible, we will exercise our right to walk away.


Help us Pick the Color!

UPDATE: Our manufacturer has agreed to run a multiple-color run for our first batch.  Everyone will get the color they choose!  No voting necessary!


Since we can have the device molded in any standard Pantone color, there's literally thousands to choose from.  We're opening a vote to choose the color of the first production run to you, our backers!  

To make it easy for you to consider the colors, we have narrowed the list down to a set of colors that parallel the colors of standard Lego bricks.  So if you want to see what our green will look like, go dig in the Lego pile to find yourself a good old green brick.  That's it.  Pantone 348C. Beautiful!

The first tier of contributions (only 8 bucks!) is set up to get you a completed Bowslinger  and a vote for your favorite color.  We hope your color wins, but bear in mind that you will get a Bowslinger in the final winning color, whatever it is. 

Here's the list:

·  Red -Pantone 032 C  (LEGO Bright Red)

·  Yellow -Pantone 116 C  (LEGO Bright Yellow)

·  Green -Pantone 348 C(LEGO Dark Green)

·  Blue -Pantone 293 C   (LEGO Bright Blue)

·  Purple -Pantone 2685 C(LEGO Medium Lilac)

The online color charts for ABS are not great, so we suggest you look at real color swatches, or simply real LEGO bricks to see how the final color looks in ABS.  All the color choices are quite standard with the exception of Purple - that purple is the deep, rich purple used for the Joker in the Lego Batman sets.  Another great color, that one.

Thanks

Thank you for reading our story and learning a little about the project.  

Whether you're a rubberband gun enthusiast or not, please consider picking up a Bowslinger to help our campaign, or just passing along our link to your friends.  Thanks in advance!  Your support is appreciated.

 After several (read: many) revisions to work out the dimensions and get
the trigger and spur operating correctly, we produced a few that workedso well, we wanted to
expand and bring this fun little device to others.

Further experimentation
showed that it wasn't going to be easy to produce consistent results on the
teensy tiny pieces when using the laser cutter.  After kicking around some
ideas and more experimentation, we determined that to produce a consistently
awesome product...  It really needed to be injection molded!We took our original 2D CAD files and enlisted the help of a 3D modelling engineer we'd met online.  This guy works in the molding industry and his hobby is modelling and molding toy guns.  Talk about a match made in heaven!
We kicked around more ideas and came up with some drafts that
became our first CAD model.  We got a prototype made
using SLS (Selective Laser Sintering).  It looked too realistic and
fired terribly!  Although Rev A was a beautiful device, it was way too realistic and the function just wasn't there.

By changing the body profile and shifting the trigger mechanism higher in the body, we came up with a design that stretched the bands tight, low, and flat for jam-free loading while giving the band a nice "kick" upon release to smoothly clear it from the end hook. 
We also decided to
move away from a realistic-looking gun.  It was never really the intention
(but our CAD guy was awesome at it!), and just didn't fit the spirit of the
project.
During some sketch
sessions, we realized just how close our new design ideas were to a classic
retro toy.  We changed the the shape and the proportions for rigidity
and firing constraints, but by squaring out the body while keeping the barrel
rounded we were able to make our improved design somewhat reminiscent of a classic shape
you'll know and love.  That's why we call this model "The
8-bit"!

With CAD
files in hand, we began talking to vendors about tooling.  Our CAD
guy had quite a bit of molding experience and vendors were generally very pleased with
our design and mold strategy.  
But there were still a few more improvements for mass production
that we incorporated after prying tips and tricks from the molding guys.
 Some for rigidity and easy alignment, some for clean injection and
avoiding flow marks in the final plastic, and a couple to improve injection
resolution to the point where we could get very fine detail when the tooling
was built with EDM (Electrical Discharge Machining).
The next revision incorporated the manufacturability tweaks from the molding guys.  We decided it would be nice to add a bit of color to the the
prototype, so we ran it through a round of fabric dye with great results!

It looked good, and fired like a dream!
We found the Bowslinger worked best with authentic Rainbow Loom rubberbands.  Some after-market
loom bands were very soft and thin, and could potentially cause a jamming
problem during fast firing.  We decided
we needed to prevent this case entirely, so one more rev was made to allow slingin' of all types of mini rubberbands.


So... Is it going to work?

It sure is.
 We started way back in the CAD phase talking to molding vendors about all
aspects of the process: mold flow, molding variation, warp/sink/rigidity issues
among many others.  We've produced a design that is robust, reliable, and
easily manufacturable.  Actually, it's probably way overengineered for a
little plastic toy.  But that's exactly the way we want it.
Our CAD models
have been prototyped using high-resolution SLS and verified for smooth and reliable
operation.  They have been double, and triple checked by the EDM
(Electrical Discharge Machining) guys for production of a detailed and precise
mold.  And they have had tons of plastic flow analysis and modelling to
ensure excellent injection.  We've had more than one vendor tell us that
even our first CAD files were 100% manufacturable even before doing our final polishing on the design!
The Bottom Line
We believe in this project.  It's a cool device, and it's
going to be incredibly gratifying to have it produced in a slick and
professional form.  You may have noticed that Bowslinger's funding goal is
really quite low for an injection molding project.  That's because we
believe so strongly, and are so confident in the design that we have already paid for most of
the tooling costs ourselves.  
All costs from
start of tooling to preparation of the first test shots (coming soon!) have
already been 100% funded by us.  We need your help in funding the second
part of the tooling preparation and the setup and manufacturing fees for the
first production run.  It really is the final stretch here, folks.ScheduleThe tooling has just started.  It will take about 20 days to get a rough mold milled, at which point we will make "T1" test shots to check the injection, part fit and movement.  The results of that test will be posted here.Then the mold needs about 7 days for final EDM shaping and polishing before "T2" test shots and color test can be done.Once those are complete, we will be ready to do the first production run in early June and ship in Late June or early July.  This is not vaporware you'll wait a year for - if this Indiegogo campaign is successful, it will happen and it will happen NOW!Risk1) In the very worst case, our manufacturer botches T1-T3 test shots without providing a working device.  We have no further obligation to them, and we will walk away.  We will take your vote on whether to tool at our second manufacturer or just get your money back.2) It works, but takes some tuning.  Our manufacturer has committed to tooling this to our satisfaction.  Small tuneups may take another week or two, and a full retool will be another month.  Again, we can walk away if the device is not molded to our satisfaction in 60 days.3)The device is fully operational, but has cosmetic issues. A judgement call.  We won't accept a junky looking device, but we understand that weird molding marks or slight color mismatch is a risk in any injection molding project. We have negotiated up to 8 injection ports to minimize flow marks in the final product, and our vendor has assured us that our colors are among the easiest to produce. If the cosmetic issues are slight, we will move forward with production. If it looks terrible, we will exercise our right to walk away.
Help us Pick the Color!UPDATE: Our manufacturer has agreed to run a multiple-color run for our first batch.  Everyone will get the color they choose!  No voting necessary!
Since we can have
the device molded in any standard Pantone color, there's literally thousands to
choose from.  We're opening a vote to choose the color of the first
production run to you, our backers!  
To make it easy
for you to consider the colors, we have narrowed the list down to a set of
colors that parallel the colors of standard Lego bricks.  So if you want to
see what our green will look like, go dig in the Lego pile to find yourself a
good old green brick.  That's it.  Pantone 348C. Beautiful!
The first tier of
contributions (only 8 bucks!) is set up to get you a completed Bowslinger  and a vote for your favorite color.  We hope your color wins,
but bear in mind that you will get a Bowslinger in the final winning color,
whatever it is. 
Here's the list:
· 
Red -Pantone 032 C 
(LEGO Bright Red)
· 
Yellow -Pantone 116 C 
(LEGO Bright Yellow)
· 
Green -Pantone 348 C(LEGO Dark Green)
· 
Blue -Pantone 293 C  
(LEGO Bright Blue)
· 
Purple -Pantone 2685 C(LEGO Medium Lilac)
The online color
charts for ABS are not great, so we suggest you look at real color swatches, or
simply real LEGO bricks to see how the final color looks in ABS.  All the
color choices are quite standard with the exception of Purple - that purple is
the deep, rich purple used for the Joker in the Lego Batman sets.  Another
great color, that one.

Thanks


Thank you for reading our story and learning a little about the
project.  Whether you're a rubberband gun enthusiast or not, please
consider picking up a Bowslinger to help our campaign, or just passing along our link to your friends.  Thanks in advance!  Your support is appreciated.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Syaxamaphone! I make video games! You can play a bunch of them for free! One of them is even on Steam! Right now I'm working on my next game, War Girl. It's a platformer about a girl who really has it out for some robots. It's also going to be on Steam!

The game has been in development for a couple of years now and I've fronted all of the costs so far contracting artists and musicians to help me fill the game's world with life. On top of that I also serve as the game's programmer, writer, designer and just about everything in between (It's a lot of work!)

Unfortunately due to some pretty big changes in my personal life (I'm moving for work! It's expensive!), I've lost the disposable income I once had to put towards the game and I don't know when I'll be able to go back to regularly putting money into it.

What We Need & What You Get

The goal of this campaign is to raise money to cover development costs. This way I can continue paying the wonderful and talented artists who have helped me make the game look and sound the way it does!

If this campaign is successful, Everyone on the team can continue to work and get paid for their work with no interruptions! Otherwise, we'll likely need to take a large break from the game until I'm in a situation where it's financially viable to continue to commission art again. That means your contribution helps us make the game faster!

Risks & Challenges

Making an entire video game is a lot of work and takes a lot of time! Lucky for you guys I've done this a few times before! However, War Girl has so far been my most ambitious project to date and has had the largest team working on it out of any of my games so far. So far I've spent over $9,000CAD of my own money over the past three years to make this game a reality.

Expenses so far, right out of my little spreadsheet!

Regardless of whether or not we make our goal, I will continue to work diligently at the game until it is ready! Every little bit helps!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, that's ok! Sharing the campaign is greatly appreciated! Tweet it on Twitter! Tumble down to Tumblr! Go out into the street and scream, "Give Syaxamaphone money!" Any and all sharing are greatly appreciated!

story:
Hi. We are BrokenKings! 
We like making games.

Exciting news! We’ve started working on Castle Conflict 2. But now we need your help. Please take the moment to consider backing us.

Help us turn this:

Sir Theodore Quentin III makes an appearance.

Into this:

 

 

Any donation of $5 or more earns you access to any campaign we make ever! See updates for more details.

 

The Goal: 
Castle Conflict 2 will feature 100% fully functional, real-time online multiplayer. This feature has been requested time and time again, and with your help, it can finally happen. It will also feature a campaign map, and hopefully many morelater!

The funds will be used to:
-pay our audio engineer - Josiah Tobin, (first $1000)
-pay our artist - Sean Dunkley, (second $1000)
-help pay for advertising - which is really important but as an indie, really hard to pay for! (whatever we have extra after that - up to $3000)
-and make sure YOU receive your promised rewards. 

Development officially started in May 2012 and we hope to release in the Fall. The funds we raise here will ensure we can pump out a couple of campaign updates with the same focus to quality and user experience. 

Atleast one before Christmas, and another by Spring of 2013.
With your help.

 

The Sequel:
This is where your funding comes in. Castle Conflict 2 is still very much like the original Castle Conflict in which it “...merges the best elements of tower defence and real-time strategies to create something truly unique” only so much BETTER.

Castle Conflict 2 will feature:

  • Sweet HD graphics
  • Compatibility with all the latest iDevices and Mac
  • Global real-time Player vs Player
  • Extensive single player Campaign Mode
  • Game Center Stats/Achievements


I mean, you can battle it out with your friends (and enemies!) across the planet in real-time. Or embark on a campaign mode all on your own.

 

 

The Backstory:
In 2009, my husband Stephen needed a creative outlet. So with the help of our friend Josiah Tobin for audio and art, Castle Conflict was born. (Hooray!)

Here's what the original looked like:

With Campaign, QuickPlay, and local Multi-Player modes.

 

Interested in trying it out? Go ahead and click here.

Castle Conflict was created purely out of love, with no budget, and with many insane hours on top of already insane work commitments - in 8 days. (The campaigns were added at later points.) It had been a very trying, but also very fulfilling experience. Only the really mentally unhinged make crazy goals like these two did, but I remained supportive, if not always friendly. XD

We've released other games during our BrokenKings House phase, too. The most notable of which is Dirt. A story about a cat exploring an underground labyrinth with a pickaxe.

 

What You'll Get:

Here's some of our progress so far:


Running on both Retina and non-Retina display iPhone and iPad.
(Glitch on iPad retina display has since been fixed.)

A screenshot with some of the already available units.
 
We've made more progress since these pictures, but we want to keep some things a surprise. It's part of the excitement! If you get the chance, try out the original Castle Conflict for a feel of what to expect.
 
There's still lots of opportunities to grow and make it better so feel free to send us comments, suggestions, and questions:
www.BrokenKings.com 
 
xo,
Berni

story:
Short Summary

We make metal coins for board games, RPG, LARP, party favors, and just for fun.  This project is a reminting of our most popular items along with a few new sets, bars, and gems.  Here are the basics.

  • Any coin you see on this page is available in bags of 10 each so you can mix and match.
  • The more coins we make, the better the cost and we pass those savings onto you.
  • While we try to overproduce for excess inventory, there is no guarantee that these will be available on our website after the project is fulfilled in a significant quantity for all items.  It's best to get them now to secure your coinage!

What You Get

  • Select any coin design you see here in packs of 10.  Mix and match how you like to create a perfect gaming coin pack for your needs.
  • Save by getting more!  Our quantity discounts give you the ability to get these at near wholesale prices.
  • Domestic Orders (USA) over $300 get a wooden (pine) crate which thier coins ship in.  This crate can also serve to hold your loot!

Dwarven Small Bars:  100mm x 50mm x 4mm

Cthulhu Small Bar:  Antique Gold or Silver (same design):  60mm x 40mm x 4mm

Credit 2 Set:  Lighter version of Copper, Silver, and Gold.

Small Credit Bar:  20mm x 19mm x 2.5mm

Silver

Gold

First Player Tokens

50mm x 30 x 3mm

40mm x 3mm

 

The Impact

Your contribution helps us out tremendously!  The more we can produce, the better the cost savings and the easier it will be for our supplier.  

  • You get high quality metal gaming coins at an all time industry low.
  • We have already made these coins and this is a reprint so we know all costs involved.
  • With your help we can make even more designs in the future, maybe you have suggested one already?!

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks with any project; however, we have been doing this for a while and have all foreseeable risks reduced to a minimum.

  • Delays in production:  Our supplier has purchased 2 new machines so they can crank these babies out faster than ever before!
  • We will be handling all packing in our warehouse in the USA to reduce production time even more.
  • We can't stop a ship from sinking; however unlikely that sounds, it is still possible.  About as possible as Pirates stealing our booty!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute, but still want to help?

  • Help out by sharing this page; don't forget about the IndieGoGo sharing tools!
  • Send us an email with your own coin ideas!  Some of our best coins came from supporters like you.

story:
Can you survive the aftermath of a nuclear and biological apocalypse? You are the leader of a faction of survivors competing against others for primacy. Assemble your party, assign your equipment and set out to explore the wastes, claim resources and actualize your agenda. Build and manage your town to protect your citizens and resources. You will have to make and break treaties to endure, amidst a myriad of bribery, betrayal and hubris by the other players. 
 

  Fallen Land is set in the ruinous aftermath of post-apocalyptic America and is a thematic board game for 2-5 players. Featuring sandbox style game play, it combines the elements of a strategy board game with card building and role-playing. Driven by macabre stories of a world gone mad, players must adapt to the ever-changing variables: the cards, stories, interactions and threats.  Fallen Land: A Post Apocalyptic Board Game is the first of several upcoming releases for Fallen Dominion Studios. 

Click To Read Our Rule Book

Fallen Land Game play #1

Fallen Land Game play #2

 

"I got the chance to play Fallen Lands last night, and boy, did it blow me away. The variety of game play elements gave me the chance to conquer the wastelands with my own style through customizing my party and including some light role-playing opportunities. Though I got thoroughly stomped, I had more fun with this FL than I have with most games sitting on my shelf. 10/10! Will play again!" ~Rex Connor 

"These people have poured their heart and soul into making a uniquely awesome experience here." ~Jesse Reese

"Got a chance to play this game tonight and it was a great experience. Game play was very smooth, a good combination of cards and dice infused with player interaction. Graphics and story line clearly show the time invested by these innovative game designers. Look forward to supporting this company with their Kickstarter campaign and to see them take off after the upcoming convention." ~Tom Lin

"Fun! Two ways to win! Tons of 'Easter Egg' humor and plenty of room for table talk wheeling and dealing. I want to play again!" ~Kimberly Burke 

 

                                                     

 
 

Our Money-Back Guarantee 

We're confident in our product. If you do not like our game Fallen Land, simply return it within 30 days. We will issue you a full refund and even reimburse you for shipping (within reason). No hassle. No questions asked.

Our Pledge to You 

We will always be transparent and communicate with you honestly. Without crowdfunding this epic game is not possible. Our backers will always come first. You are making this game a reality through your support!  We guarantee that our backers will receive their copies before retail distribution begins. Period.  

We Need Your Support

For the last eleven years we have self funded this ambitious game, from its humble origins to its epic completion.  Now that it's complete, we simply need your support to go to print and bring this amazing project to the gaming community.

Gaming Community

Nothing is more important to us than our backers and fans. And we listen. We have been play testing Fallen Land for over nine years. In that time, we have incorporated player feedback and suggestions to help make Fallen Land even better! And we'd love to hear from you too.

   Retailers are important to us at Fallen Dominion Studios, LLC.  We would love to hear from you regarding any orders, questions or concerns.  Remember, Fallen Lands, A Post-Apocalyptic Board Game is only the 1st of SEVERAL upcoming releases for our studio.  Please direct all retail related inquires to: 

Seancahill@fallendominionstudios.com

Thank you!

 

Playtesting and interviews shot during International Table Top Day at The Hobby Corner in Iowa City.

  As with any game, playtesting is crucial for clarity and success.  Fallen Land: A Post-Apocalyptic Board Game has been play tested for nine of its eleven years of existence.  In the last two years alone, it has been playtested 158 times and our play testers have logged over 600 hours played.  Blind playtesting encompasses 85% of these sessions.  

  Not only have we spent countless hours collecting and analyzing the incredible amount of data provided by these playtesters, but we have used it to refine and polish Fallen Land again and again.  The final version of the game we are offering on Kickstarter, is a result of over eleven years of hard work by the creators and staff--but made POSSIBLE by our awesome pool of playtesters.  These heroes have selflessly dedicated themselves to helping make Fallen Land: A Post-Apocalyptic Board Game a reality!

 In 2005, my long time friend Sean Cahill and I began designing Fallen Land: A Post-Apocalyptic Board Game. Our intent was to design a hybrid thematic game that combined the elements of a strategy board game, card game, and role-playing game. Our vision was to make it an epic event, a story driven board game that featured unlimited playability and sandbox-style game play.

  Fallen Land: A Post Apocalyptic Board Game is dedicated to our families. We cannot even begin to express our gratitude for their patience, help and encouragement. It is also dedicated to the many people who helped us on this long journey and to gamers everywhere. Without everyone's contributions (both big and small), this behemoth game wouldn't have been possible.  Thank you!

                            

Sean Cahill and Jon Lonngren

Jon Lonngren

I am a native of Iowa City, Iowa and a Political Science and International Relations graduate of the University of Iowa.  I have also attended several other major universities, in DC and abroad. My focus was on Cold War studies and the former Soviet Republics.  I am an avid sci-fi writer and passionate board game designer.  I also love to cook gourmet food.  My most important roles are as a husband to my incredible wife, a father to my two sons and a handler of our two comedic Dachshunds.

Sean Cahill

I am a native of Iowa City and a US Army veteran.  I love graphics design, techie and mechanical stuff.  I am a golf and baseball fanatic and play every type of board and computer game I can get my hands on.  Designing board games, wood working and building stuff is what I do.  I have a beautiful wife, three wonderful children and a slew of pets.

Eleven Years of Fallen Land

Warren, Patrick, Sean, Bonz and Jon (2013)

 

Fallen Land:The Post-Apocalyptic 

Board Game  

*Full Game Credits, 2005-2016*

Jon Lonngren

Game Designer and Executive Producer (2005-2016): Concept, development, rules and strategy. Writer and project manager. Coordination, analysis, secondary editing and proofs.  Web design, secondary graphics design and concept sketches.  

Sean Cahill

Game Designer and Executive Producer (2005-2016): Concept, development, rules and strategy. Lead graphics design, card templates and layout. Secondary editing and proofs, web site design, web design, FAQs and IT solutions.

Warren Ripley

Art Director and Lead Artist (2007-2016): Pencils, inks, colors, proofs, graphic design and art layout. Box and Rule Book art. Character, Spoils, Action Card and symbols artwork. Final map, 3D modeling, video editing and proof reading.

Patrick "Tall Pat" Phillips

Lead Play-Tester (2008-2016): Rules and concept analysis, tertiary development and proof reading.

Justin "Bonz" Jones

Mechanics Analyst (2012-2016): Analysis, proof reading and final cuts.

Bill "One man army" Pitcher

Editor (2016): Final analysis, play testing and proof reading. Also IT support and solutions, spreadsheets and card symbol updates.

 Erik Lemke

Fairchild, Haldane Morris, Brett Schreiner, Chadron Stalkfleet and "Lurch" Aaron Alter.

The Play Test Crew: Jesse Reese, "Lurch" Aaron Alter, Jason "Bear" Boyd, Kenneth "Robo" Hicks, Sara Hicks, Aaron Green, Jonathan Paul Fairchild, Erik Streff, Ben Allen, Paul Harper-Shirk and Jeffery Harper-Shirk, Lucas "Owlbear" Monx, Eric Miller, Wendy Lonngren, Scott Warren, Mathew Topol, Scott Finlayson, Brett Schreiner, Matt Brenton, Kelsey Steffen, Jenika Shannon, Kimberly Burke, Nicklas Cahill, Paul Waterman, Will Rosenstangle, Bob Bogs, Tim Williams, Joan Williams, Kirk Reissen, Daniel Young, Craig Wright, Tom Woolums, Josh Woolums, Elizabeth Sease, Chadron Stalkfleet, Luke Engleheart, Jon Maakestaad, Justin Brown, Geoffry Giarmo, Lauren Giarmo, Jeff Dolan, John Malsom, Sid Blommers, Billie Wilson, Shawn Michael White, Marius Meyer, Cody Holzhauser, Dan Akers, John Glispie, Laurens Van Beek, Tom Lin, Jo Andreasson and Patrick Johanns.

  Fallen Dominion Studios strives to create exceptional board games. Games people will want to play over and over again. We take great pride in meticulously crafting every aspect of our games, from their eye-popping artwork to their pulp storytelling, innovative designs and multi-level strategy content. Since 2005, we have been burning the midnight oil to create and produce Fallen Land: A Post-Apocalyptic Board Game. Slotted as the first of several upcoming releases for our studio, it is over eleven years in the making.

  In the future, our gaming system and our upcoming titles will span across a multitude of different genres. They too will feature interchangeable aspects and unlimited playability. Combining aspects from multiple games will allow players to customize their gaming experience to best fit their interests and play styles.

  For now however, we simply hope you have the opportunity to play Fallen Land. Adventure and intrigue await! On behalf of everyone at Fallen Dominion Studios, I hope you enjoy playing our game as much as we have enjoyed creating it for you.

~Cheers,

Jon Lonngren

©Fallen Dominion Studios, LLC 2005-2016 - All Rights Reserved.

 

Risks and challenges

Frequent communication and transparency are how we meet risks and challenges at Fallen Dominion Studios, LLC. Our supporters and fans come first and we take GREAT pride in everything we do. We are very confident that our research over the last year and a half has thoroughly prepared us for our own campaign, despite this being our first project. We believe that being an active participant ourselves in the crowdfunding community as a company is a great way to learn. As we have backed and followed other projects, we have cheered out loud at their incredible success and we have cringed as a few projects we supported and loved, failed. There are lessons to be learned at both ends of the spectrum.

To prepare for our own campaign, we have tirelessly researched manufacturing, pricing, distribution and shipping. We have spoken to industry veterans, in all roles, from creators to manufacturers. We have also researched and read every article and blog about crowdfunding we could find, to help us succeed. In addition, books like Jamey Stegmaier's A Crowdfunder's Strategy Guide and Don Steinberg's Kickstarter Handbook, Real-Life Crowdfunding Success Stories, were invaluablel in our preparations.

We have also been working closely with our game manufacturer WinGo Industry, Ltd to assure that our game Fallen Land: A Post Apocalyptic Board Game will be produced at the highest quality. We are satisfied after our lengthy discussions with WinGo that their focus is on quality and getting things done right. However, if anything unforeseen does arise, rest assured we will communicate honestly and transparently with you and post frequent updates until the situation is rectified.

As for the delivery date, Fallen Land is 99% complete. We have self-funded the artwork, stories and designs during the game's creation. Completing this massive project proves our dedication and experience, as it took many long years to create. Its quality and value can be seen in our final product. We will however, be listening to you, our backers, and making minor adjustments after the campaign ends to reflect our supporters input. It is also possible that we will be creating new content as a result of pledge levels and stretch goals (which we are VERY excited about) and we have designed them to not delay the project. From there, we will simply need to transfer the funds and final files to WinGo for production.
story_txt:
Can you survive the aftermath of a nuclear and biological apocalypse? You are the leader of a faction of survivors competing against others for primacy. Assemble your party, assign your equipment and set out to explore the wastes, claim resources and actualize your agenda. Build and manage your town to protect your citizens and resources. You will have to make and break treaties to endure, amidst a myriad of bribery, betrayal and hubris by the other players. 
 
  Fallen Land is set in the ruinous aftermath of post-apocalyptic America and is a thematic board game for 2-5 players. Featuring sandbox style game play, it combines the elements of a strategy board game with card building and role-playing. Driven by macabre stories of a world gone mad, players must adapt to the ever-changing variables: the cards, stories, interactions and threats.  Fallen Land: A Post Apocalyptic Board Game is the first of several upcoming releases for Fallen Dominion Studios. 





Click To Read Our Rule Book



Fallen Land Game play #1

Fallen Land Game play #2




 
"I got the chance to play Fallen Lands last night, and boy, did it blow me away. The variety of game play elements gave me the chance to conquer the wastelands with my own style through customizing my party and including some light role-playing opportunities. Though I got thoroughly stomped, I had more fun with this FL than I have with most games sitting on my shelf. 10/10! Will play again!" ~Rex Connor 
"These people have poured their heart and soul into making a uniquely awesome experience here." ~Jesse Reese
"Got a chance to play this game tonight and it was a great experience. Game play was very smooth, a good combination of cards and dice infused with player interaction. Graphics and story line clearly show the time invested by these innovative game designers. Look forward to supporting this company with their Kickstarter campaign and to see them take off after the upcoming convention." ~Tom Lin
"Fun! Two ways to win! Tons of 'Easter Egg' humor and plenty of room for table talk wheeling and dealing. I want to play again!" ~Kimberly Burke 
 
                                                     
 

 

Our Money-Back Guarantee 
We're confident in our product. If you do not like our game Fallen Land, simply return it within 30 days. We will issue you a full refund and even reimburse you for shipping (within reason). No hassle. No questions asked.
Our Pledge to You 
We will always be transparent and communicate with you honestly. Without crowdfunding this epic game is not possible. Our backers will always come first. You are making this game a reality through your support!  We guarantee that our backers will receive their copies before retail distribution begins. Period.  
We Need Your Support
For the last eleven years we have self funded this ambitious game, from its humble origins to its epic completion.  Now that it's complete, we simply need your support to go to print and bring this amazing project to the gaming community.
Gaming Community
Nothing is more important to us than our backers and fans. And we listen. We have been play testing Fallen Land for over nine years. In that time, we have incorporated player feedback and suggestions to help make Fallen Land even better! And we'd love to hear from you too.




   Retailers are important to us at Fallen Dominion Studios, LLC.  We would love to hear from you regarding any orders, questions or concerns.  Remember, Fallen Lands, A Post-Apocalyptic Board Game is only the 1st of SEVERAL upcoming releases for our studio.  Please direct all retail related inquires to: 
Seancahill@fallendominionstudios.com
Thank you!




 



Playtesting and interviews shot during International Table Top Day at The Hobby Corner in Iowa City.
  As with any game, playtesting is crucial for clarity and success.  Fallen Land: A Post-Apocalyptic Board Game has been play tested for nine of its eleven years of existence.  In the last two years alone, it has been playtested 158 times and our play testers have logged over 600 hours played.  Blind playtesting encompasses 85% of these sessions.  
  Not only have we spent countless hours collecting and analyzing the incredible amount of data provided by these playtesters, but we have used it to refine and polish Fallen Land again and again.  The final version of the game we are offering on Kickstarter, is a result of over eleven years of hard work by the creators and staff--but made POSSIBLE by our awesome pool of playtesters.  These heroes have selflessly dedicated themselves to helping make Fallen Land: A Post-Apocalyptic Board Game a reality!

 In 2005, my long time friend Sean Cahill and I began designing Fallen Land: A Post-Apocalyptic Board Game. Our intent was to design a hybrid thematic game that combined the elements of a strategy board game, card game, and role-playing game. Our vision was to make it an epic event, a story driven board game that featured unlimited playability and sandbox-style game play.
  Fallen Land: A Post Apocalyptic Board Game is dedicated to our families. We cannot even begin to express our gratitude for their patience, help and encouragement. It is also dedicated to the many people who helped us on this long journey and to gamers everywhere. Without everyone's contributions (both big and small), this behemoth game wouldn't have been possible.  Thank you!
                            

Sean Cahill and Jon Lonngren
Jon Lonngren
I am a native of Iowa City, Iowa and a Political Science and International Relations graduate of the University of Iowa.  I have also attended several other major universities, in DC and abroad. My focus was on Cold War studies and the former Soviet Republics.  I am an avid sci-fi writer and passionate board game designer.  I also love to cook gourmet food.  My most important roles are as a husband to my incredible wife, a father to my two sons and a handler of our two comedic Dachshunds.
Sean Cahill
I am a native of Iowa City and a US Army veteran.  I love graphics design, techie and mechanical stuff.  I am a golf and baseball fanatic and play every type of board and computer game I can get my hands on.  Designing board games, wood working and building stuff is what I do.  I have a beautiful wife, three wonderful children and a slew of pets.

Eleven Years of Fallen Land

Warren, Patrick, Sean, Bonz and Jon (2013)
 
Fallen Land:The Post-Apocalyptic

story:
Born from the centuries-old ashes of the ancient game of blackjack, Trumped: Genesisis a new mobile app that revolutionizes blackjack-style games in a whole new way. 

Designed by the world-famous Full Sail University gaming department,  http://www.fullsail.edu/game-school, Genesis is the brainchild of Karly C., a high school student from Orlando, FL and aspiring young entrepreneur! With the help of her father Brian, Karly has taken an age-old favorite and transformed it into a social-style card game that combines all the elements you love about modern games.

By winning hands you can win coins, collect rare items and earn rewards that you can use to unlock different features and levels and advance through the game. With your coins and rewards, you can customize your avatar and add accessories and other bonus items that will increase your skill level. As you rise through the ranks of a Novice player all the way to Grandmaster, you can unlock different features of the game, including Player vs. Player, Play with Friends and Pit Boss Battles! Once you've collected enough coins, rare cards, treasure chests and other items, you can level up to take on the big boys, the Pit Bosses, in a battle to the death! 

 
Genesis is dealt like blackjack, but the similarities end there because the game has all new features and an entirely new fun and strategic scoring system. No longer is the goal to reach "21" or bust trying, hand after hand after hand. A new patented scoring system includes the game's namesake -- the diabolical "Trump" card. This card is the "One Card to Rule Them All" and is preciousss  because it is part of the hand and used as a tiebreaker to "trump" the dealer's hand. That adds all new strategic elements to the game and gives the player more ways to beat the dealer! 

Genesis is fast, easy to learn and appeals to game players of all ages and abilities. The rules are amazingly simple (our lawyers won't let us reveal all the details but trust me, it's awesome) yet the game is challenging in ways blackjack hasn't ever seen! :) 

You will also be able to share your high scores and achievements online through the leaderboard and social media sites while connecting with your friends through Facebook, Twitter and others.

But that's not all, folks, a one-time subscription to the game will keep you coming back for more new features, items, collectibles and characters that will guarantee you hours and hours of playing fun!

How's that for a 21st Century card game?

So please pledge your support and help Karly realize her dream of creating a game that promises to bring you hours and hours of gaming pleasure!

Thank you for all your support! --  Karly  :)

Trumped: Genesis is patent pending. All excess funds will be used to add new updates and features and to develop versions compatible with  social gaming sites and other platforms for you to enjoy as well! 

                                      **************************

      "I've seen the wireframes, features, rules and rough storyboard for this game and I've never seen anything like it in all my years of game development. A truly amazing concept. There's never been another game like it."

     -- T. Long, professor of game development, Full Sail University

                                            ************     

  "This game combines elements from a variety of game genres -- RPGs, farming games, blackjack games and puzzle games -- I can't wait to play it!" 

    -- C. Thomas, vice president of game development, KB Games Inc.

story: .

About us

Meiko Miniatures is a small company producing miniatures for Fantasy Football. We offer alternative designs to the ones existing and we provide the players with a wide variety of miniatures to help them complete their teams. To achieve this we always work with the most talented sculptors.

You can see here our previous 4 Meiko Indiegogo campaigns: Lizardmen, Kaos Dwarves, Ratmen and Undead / Necromantic. All the packages of these four campaigns were shipped just 3 months after the end of each campaign, accomplishing the estimated shipping dates stated on the campaign descriptions:

http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/meiko-miniatures-lizardmen-fantasy-football-team

http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/meiko-miniatures-chaos-dwarf-fantasy-football-team

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/meiko-miniature-s-ratmen-fantasy-football-team

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/meiko-s-undead-necromantic-fantasy-football-team

Why crowdfunding?

The Meiko Miniatures new project is the Ultimate Kaos Pact Team. The Kaos Pact Team will include the following 15 Players: 1 Mutated Ogre, 1 Mutated Troll, 1 Mutated Minotaur, 1 Dark Elf Renegade, 1 Ratmen Renegade, 1 Goblin Renegade, 5 Marauders with no Mutation and 4 Mutated Marauders (Two Heads, Extra Arm, Claws and Big Hand). The campaign will also include 3 Star Players that can play with the Kaos Team, two Mutation Sprues (one for miniatures of standard size and the other one for Big Guys) and several more items: two Kaos Pact Pitches (Puzzle-like Hard Pitch and Rollable Plastic Gaming Pitch), Mutated Football, racial Range Ruler, a Marauder Coach / Referee, Block Dice and three Skill Dice very useful to play with this team (Animosity Dice for the Renegade players, Bone Head for the Ogre and Always Hungry for the Troll).

The sculpting of most of these miniatures has already been made. Only two of the Star Players need to be sculpted. But we need your help to speed up the casting process. That way, we will be able to release the Meiko Kaos Pact Team much sooner than what was initially planned. Using Indiegogo as a platform to rise funds helps us a lot since we can finance new miniatures and other interesting items, obtain feedback from our customers and it gives us confidence to keep working on. In exchange you will get some cool rewards.

All the miniatures will be casted in metal, including the Mutated Football. The master moulds will be made by Miniaturas Alemany, the mouldmaker of other successful Fantasy Football Indiegogo campaigns like the Willy Chaos Team and the Willy Amazon Team.

The sculptor of all the miniatures of this team is Franarcilla, the skilled sculptor of many other Meiko teams like the Kaos Dwarf, Undead, Necromantic, Ogre, Goblin, Rotter, Orc and Wood Elf Teams, just to mention some of them. Franarcilla is one of Meiko Miniatures flagship sculptors. His dark sculpting style specially fits with all the chaotic races, and his Kaos Pact minis will fit with the image we all have in mind when we think about this team. We specially like the “gladiator” look that he gave to the Marauders. Currently, Franarcilla is considered by many Fantasy Football fans as one of the best and most talented Fantasy Football sculptors worldwide. 

How does this Kaos Pact Team look like?


How can you support this team?



LEVEL 1 

7 EUR

If you are already a contributor to this campaign, you can claim this perk to get a Dark Elf Renegade. It will be shipped together with your other perks of Level 4 or higher.

LEVEL 2 

7 EUR

If you are already a contributor to this campaign, you can claim this perk to get a Ratmen Renegade. It will be shipped together with your other perks of Level 4 or higher.

LEVEL 3 

7 EUR

If you are already a contributor to this campaign, you can claim this perk to get a Goblin Renegade. It will be shipped together with your other perks of Level 4 or higher.

LEVEL 4 

14 EUR

You will receive a Mutated Ogre. In addition you will receive one Mutated Football. Free shipment included.

LEVEL 5 

14 EUR

You will receive a Mutated Troll. In addition you will receive one Mutated Football. Free shipment included.

LEVEL 6

14 EUR

You will receive a Mutated Minotaur. In addition you will receive one Mutated Football. Free shipment included.

LEVEL 7

19 EUR

You will receive a Set of 3 Renegades: Dark Elf, Ratman and Goblin. In addition you will receive one Mutated Football. Free shipment included.

LEVEL 8

27 EUR

You will receive a Set of 4 Mutated Marauders (Two Heads, Extra Arm, Claws and Big Hand). In addition you will receive one Mutated Football. Free shipment included.

LEVEL 9 

29 EUR

You will receive a Kaos Pact Rollable Plastic Gaming Mat and one Kaos Pact Range Ruler. Free shipment included.

This Range Ruler is made of flexible plastic and is 1 mm thick. That is the same thickness than a plastic Credit Card.

The Plastic Gaming Mat is printed in oilcloth, so it’s waterproof and you will be able to easily roll it for a comfortable transportation.

The Gaming Mat includes 2 Dugouts with their 3 sections: Bench, Unconscious and Dead-Injured. Also includes Re-roll, Turn and Score Counters, two Throw-in templates and two Quick Reference Lists with all the possible results of the Kickoff, 2 marks where players usually throw the kickoff, a colored Table to establish Ranges when throwing the ball, a Weather Table and a Scatter template.

LEVEL 10

33 EUR

You will receive a Set of 5 Marauders with no mutation. In addition you will receive one Mutated Football. Free shipment included.

LEVEL 11 

39 EUR

You will receive a Puzzle-like Hard Pitch and one Kaos Pact Range Ruler. Free shipment included.

This Range Ruler is made of flexible plastic and is 1 mm thick. That is the same thickness than a plastic Credit Card.

The Puzzle-like Hard Pitch is divided in six pieces. These puzzle-style pieces allow you to quickly do and undo the field, so you will be able to easily fit it in your travel bag.

When mounted  the pitch size is 60 cm wide x 90 cm long, while the size of each single piece is of 30 cm x 30 cm. Due to the small size of the single pieces they are really handy to transport. The pitch is made with a light and water-proof resistant plastic material.

The pitch includes 2 Dugouts with their 3 sections: Bench, Unconscious and Dead-Injured. Also includes Re-roll, Turn and Score Counters, two Throw-in templates and two Quick Reference Lists with all the possible results of the Kickoff, 2 marks where players usually throw the kickoff, a colored Table to establish Ranges when throwing the ball, a Weather Table and a Scatter template.

LEVEL 12

40 EUR

You will receive a Set of 3 Big Guys: one Mutated Ogre, one Mutated Troll and one Mutated Minotaur. In addition you will receive one Mutated Football. Free shipment included.

LEVEL 13  (only 30 available)

60 EUR

(EARLY BID) You will receive one Kaos Pact Team of 12 Players. Each Team includes 1 Dark Elf Renegade, 1 Ratmen Renegade, 1 Goblin Renegade, 5 Marauders with no Mutation and 4 Mutated Marauders (Two Heads, Extra Arm, Claws and Big Hand). All the miniatures are different from each other. In addition you will receive one Mutated Football. Free shipment included. (only 30 available) 

LEVEL 14 

70 EUR

You will receive one Kaos Pact Team of 12 Players. Each Team includes 1 Dark Elf Renegade, 1 Ratmen Renegade, 1 Goblin Renegade, 5 Marauders with no Mutation and 4 Mutated Marauders (Two Heads, Extra Arm, Claws and Big Hand). All the miniatures are different from each other. In addition you will receive one Mutated Football. Free shipment included.

LEVEL 15  (only 30 available)

90 EUR

(EARLY BID) You will receive one Kaos Pact Team of 15 Players. Each Team includes 1 Mutated Ogre, 1 Mutated Troll, 1 Mutated Minotaur, 1 Dark Elf Renegade, 1 Ratmen Renegade, 1 Goblin Renegade, 5 Marauders with no Mutation and 4 Mutated Marauders (Two Heads, Extra Arm, Claws and Big Hand). All the miniatures are different from each other. In addition you will receive one Mutated Football. Free shipment included. (only 30 available) 

LEVEL 16 

99 EUR

You will receive one Kaos Pact Team of 15 Players. Each Team includes 1 Mutated Ogre, 1 Mutated Troll, 1 Mutated Minotaur, 1 Dark Elf Renegade, 1 Ratmen Renegade, 1 Goblin Renegade, 5 Marauders with no Mutation and 4 Mutated Marauders (Two Heads, Extra Arm, Claws and Big Hand). All the miniatures are different from each other. In addition you will receive one Mutated Football. Free shipment included.

STRETCH GOALS and REWARD GOALS



If we reach 2.500 EUR  All contributors will get a Goblin Bomber Star Player for just 7 EUR, adding the Stretch Level for it. This miniature will be sculpted by Franarcilla. This Stretch Level will be created once the campaign reaches the amount stated above.

If we reach 3.500 EUR, all contributors of Level 13 or higher will get an Kaos Dwarf Blunderbuss Star Player for free. This miniature is sculpted by Franarcilla.

If we reach 4.500 EUR  All contributors will get an Orc Chainsaw Star Player for just 7 EUR, adding the Stretch Level for it. This miniature will be sculpted by Franarcilla. This Stretch Level will be created once the campaign reaches the amount stated above.

If we reach 5.500 EUR, all contributors of Level 13 or higher will get a Set of 3 Block Dice for free. These dice are made by Meiko and the color is translucent blue.

If we reach 6.500 EUR  All contributors will get a standard size Mutation Sprue for just 7 EUR, adding the Stretch Level for it. This sprue will be sculpted by Franarcilla. This Stretch Level will be created once the campaign reaches the amount stated above.

If we reach 7.500 EUR, all contributors of Level 13 or higher will get a Set of 3 different Meiko Skill Dice for free. These dice are the following ones: Animosity Dice for the Renegade players, Bone Head for the Ogre and Always Hungry for the Troll.

If we reach 8.500 EUR  All contributors will get a Big Guys Mutation Sprue for just 9 EUR, adding the Stretch Level for it. This sprue will be sculpted by Franarcilla. This Stretch Level will be created once the campaign reaches the amount stated above.

If we reach 9.500 EUR, all contributors of Level 13 or higher will get a Stunned / Prone Marker for Big Guys. This marker will be sculpted by Franarcilla.

If we reach 10.500 EUR  All contributors will get a Marauder Coach / Referee for just 7 EUR, adding the Stretch Level for it. This miniature will be sculpted by Franarcilla. This Stretch Level will be created once the campaign reaches the amount stated above.

Estimated shipping date: before July 31st 2015
story_txt:
About us
Meiko Miniatures is a small company producing miniatures for Fantasy
Football. We offer alternative designs to the ones existing and we provide the
players with a wide variety of miniatures to help them complete their teams. To
achieve this we always work with the most talented sculptors.
You can see here our previous 4 Meiko Indiegogo campaigns:
Lizardmen, Kaos Dwarves, Ratmen and Undead / Necromantic. All the packages of these four campaigns were shipped just 3 months
after the end of each campaign, accomplishing the estimated shipping dates
stated on the campaign descriptions:
http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/meiko-miniatures-lizardmen-fantasy-football-team
http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/meiko-miniatures-chaos-dwarf-fantasy-football-team
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/meiko-miniature-s-ratmen-fantasy-football-team
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/meiko-s-undead-necromantic-fantasy-football-team

Why crowdfunding?
The Meiko Miniatures new project is the Ultimate Kaos Pact Team. The Kaos Pact
Team will include the following 15 Players: 1 Mutated Ogre, 1 Mutated Troll, 1
Mutated Minotaur, 1 Dark Elf Renegade, 1 Ratmen Renegade, 1 Goblin Renegade, 5
Marauders with no Mutation and 4 Mutated Marauders (Two Heads, Extra Arm, Claws
and Big Hand). The campaign will also include 3 Star Players that can play with
the Kaos Team, two Mutation Sprues (one for miniatures of standard size and the
other one for Big Guys) and several more items: two Kaos Pact Pitches
(Puzzle-like Hard Pitch and Rollable Plastic Gaming Pitch), Mutated Football, racial Range Ruler, a Marauder Coach / Referee, Block
Dice and three Skill Dice very useful to play with this team (Animosity Dice
for the Renegade players, Bone Head for the Ogre and Always Hungry for the
Troll).
The sculpting of most of these miniatures has already
been made. Only two of the Star Players need to be sculpted. But we need your
help to speed up the casting process. That way, we will be able to release the
Meiko Kaos Pact Team much sooner than what was initially planned. Using
Indiegogo as a platform to rise funds helps us a lot since we can finance new
miniatures and other interesting items, obtain feedback from our customers and
it gives us confidence to keep working on. In exchange you will get some
cool rewards.
All the miniatures will be casted in metal, including
the Mutated Football. The master moulds will be made by Miniaturas
Alemany, the mouldmaker of other successful Fantasy Football Indiegogo
campaigns like the Willy Chaos Team and the Willy Amazon Team. 
The sculptor of all the miniatures of this team is Franarcilla, the skilled
sculptor of many other Meiko teams like the Kaos Dwarf, Undead, Necromantic,
Ogre, Goblin, Rotter, Orc and Wood Elf Teams, just to mention some of them.
Franarcilla is one of Meiko Miniatures flagship sculptors. His dark sculpting
style specially fits with all the chaotic races, and his Kaos Pact minis will
fit with the image we all have in mind when we think about this team. We
specially like the “gladiator” look that he gave to the Marauders.
Currently, Franarcilla is considered by many Fantasy Football fans as one of
the best and most talented Fantasy Football sculptors worldwide. 
How does this Kaos Pact Team look like?
How can you support this team?

7 EUR
If you are already a contributor to this campaign, you can claim this perk
to get a Dark Elf Renegade. It will be shipped together with your other perks of Level 4 or
higher.

7 EUR
If you are already a contributor to this campaign, you can claim this perk
to get a Ratmen Renegade. It will be shipped together with your other perks of Level 4 or
higher. 
LEVEL 3  
7 EUR
If you are already a contributor to this campaign, you can claim this perk
to get a Goblin Renegade. It will be shipped together with your other perks of Level 4 or
higher.
