story:
Antur Nadolig Plaid - Plaid Christmas Adventure


13eg Rhagfyr 2014 - 13th december 2014


100 milltir yr awr i lawr y zipwire uwchben Chwarel y Penrhyn, Bethesda !!!

Bydd Hywel Williams AS (Arfon) a Rhun ap Iorwerth AC (Aelod y Cynulliad dros Ynys Môn), ynghyd â staff eraill Plaid Cymru, yn gwneud y zipwire cyflymder yn Zipworld Bethesda dydd Sadwrn 13 Rhagfyr i helpu i godi arian ar gyfer elusennau lleol.

Yn gyrru at tua 100 milltir yr awr i lawr y zipwire uwchben Chwarel y Penrhyn, bydd tîm Plaid Cymru yn ceisio codi cymaint o arian â phosibl ar gyfer y elusennau lleol yma:

CYFRANNWCH OS GWELWCH YN DDA, A CHEFNOGWCH YR ELUSENNAU ANHYGOEL YMA!


100mph down the zipwire above Penrhyn Quarry, Bethesda!!!

Hywel Williams MP (Arfon) and Rhun ap Iorwerth AM (Welsh Assembly Member for Anglesey), along with other Plaid Cymru staff, will be doing the high velocity zipwire at Zipworld Bethesda on Saturday 13th December to help raise  money local charities.

Speeding at about 100mph down the zipwire above Penrhyn Quarry the Plaid Cymru team will aim to raise as much money as possible for these local charities:

PLEASE DONATE, AND HELP SUPPORT THESE AMAZING CHARITIES!


Awyr Las – Blue Sky

Awyr Las yw’r elusen sy’n gweithio tuag at sicrhau gofal iechyd gwell yng Ngogledd Cymru.
Drwyddom ni, gallwch chi wneud gwahaniaeth mawr i gleifion a’u teuluoedd. Gall eich rhoddion gefnogi ystod o wasanaethau ledled Gogledd Cymru; mae eich cefnogaeth chi yn ariannu cyfarpar newydd, gwell adnoddau ac adeiladau, hyfforddiant a phrosiectau arbennig.


Awyr Las is the charity for better healthcare in North Wales.

Through us, you can make a big difference to patients and their families. Your donations can support a range of services across North Wales; your support funds new equipment, better facilities and spaces, training, research and special projects.

www.awyrlas.org.uk/


Apêl Eleanor Jones Appeal

Sefydlwyd yr apêl gan Eleanor Jones i godi arian i brynu offer angenrheidiol i ward Alaw Ysbyty Gwynedd. Hyd yma mae Eleanor a'i chyfeillion wedi codi mwy na £20,000 drwy wahanol weithgareddau. 

The appeal was established by Eleanor Jones to raise funds to purchase vital equipment for the Alaw ward at Ysbyty Gwynedd. So far Eleanor and her friends have raised more than £20,000 through various activities.)


Mae actifyddion lleol Plaid Cymru ar draws Arfon ac Ynys Môn hefyd yn gweithio yn galed i gasglu cymaint o nawdd ag y bo modd gyda chopïau papur o'r ffurflenni noddi.

CYFRANNWCH OS GWELWCH YN DDA,  A CHEFNOGWCH YR ELUSENNAU ANHYGOEL YMA!


Local Plaid Cymru activists across Arfon and Anglesey are also hard at work collecting as much support and sponsorship as possible with paper copies of sponsorship forms.

PLEASE DONATE, AND HELP SUPPORT THESE AMAZING CHARITIES!



Nodwch:

Rydym yn ymddiheuriadau os bydd pobl yn dod o hyd i'r dull talu ar y wefan hon ychydig yn anodd. Yn anffodus hwn oedd yr unig ffordd y gallem greu un dull sy'n seiliedig ar y we i gasglu nawdd ar gyfer y ddwy elusen. Ni fyddai wedi bod yn bosibl i ddefnyddio gwefannau fel 'Just Giving' oherwydd ni all Apêl Elennor Jones  cofrestru arno, a byddai wedi golygu ddwy wefan/dudalennau ar wahân i reoli.

Felly, rydym wedi penderfynu mae'r dewis  a'r dull gorauo oedd i greu dudalen gwefan ar gyfer casglu arian oedd drwy wefan gyllido dorf. Fodd bynnag, rydym yn croeso pob sylw a barn a bydd yn ein helpu i greu dull gwell o gasglu nawdd ar gyfer y tro nesaf gan mae prif pwysigrwydd y gweithgarwch nawdd yw i helpu a cefnogi elusennau ac achosion da lleol.

Please note:

We apologies if people find the payment method on this website a little difficult. Unfortunately this was the only way we could create a single one stop web based method of collecting sponsorship for these two charities. It would not have been possible to use websites such as ‘Just Giving’ as currently Apel Elennor Jones Appeal cannot be registered on just giving, and would have meant two separate websites/pages to manage.

We therefore decided that the best alternative and method of creating a website page for collecting funds was through a crowd funding website. However, all comments and views are gratefully received and will help us to create a better method of collecting sponsorship for next time as the primary importance of this sponsorship activity is to help support local charities and good causes.

story:
What's our project?

We're making a spot the difference game for iOS called "Splat the Difference".

In case you didn't immediately figure it out, the gameplay is styled so that you mark differences on a picture using coloured "splats".

Imagine throwing jelly at a window to solve a puzzle.

Wasn't that fun?

Plus, you can play against a friend, live and in real-time over the internet!

Who are we? 

Lightwood Games is a small, independent developer who has produced a number of puzzle games for iPhone, iPad and iPod touch.

We're passionate about social gaming experiences, so our titles include multi-player online modes. We created the first ever online competitive word search puzzle (Word Search Party), which has now been played more than 10 million times.  We made a jigsaw app (Jigsaw Party) that lets you create puzzles from your own photos and then race to solve them against a friend in real time.  Our sudoku game (Sudoku Party) has a crazy two-player mode like nothing you've ever seen before!

Our two-person programming team works quickly and efficiently to deliver stunning results.  At the recent GameHack event in London, which challenged developers to create an original game in just 24 hours, we picked up two prizes - "Best Use of Mobile" and "Most Innovative Idea".  Here's a video.

What do we need?

The code for Splat the Difference is functionally complete.  At the time of writing, we have a playable solo game and a playable online two-player game.  There's some work still to do to polish the app and to add more social features to increase its virility, but this project is well under way, and it will definitely be released!

However, there's one area where we're currently falling short: creating awesome spot the difference puzzles.

Here's what we first thought a puzzle would look like:

Was it fun?  Did you find many differences?  Does this make you want to play our game?

Thought not.  After playtesting, we discovered that what we really need for a casual mobile game is something more like this:

Hopefully you agree - it's more engaging, less headache-inducing, and even though the version here is smaller than you'd see in the game, you can probably spot all ten differences pretty quickly!

We made a bunch of puzzles using photos that were to hand, figuring that all it needed was an artist to do some cunning photo editing to make them fun.  We were wrong.

We've learned that we totally underestimated what would be needed to give this game the content it deserves.  We want to put that right, but we already burned the graphics budget getting to this stage.

That's not to say all the puzzles we already have are garbage.  Some of them are perfectly good; some will work if we only include a few differences but many are just so mind-bendingly impossible that we don't want them to scare players away!

If we ever make a super-serious spot the difference game with extra hard levels, we'll use them... but that's not this game.

We feel we've learned a lot about how to do this right.  We want to launch the game with a great set of puzzles, made using great pictures that we'll license from great photographers.

Where will the money go?

We only need money to create new graphical content.  We already have a Mac :o)  We already have a great team, and we already have the game engine.

We calculated that each puzzle costs about $25 to create, including licencing fees for stock photos and a freelance artist's time to do the image manipulation and generate the files we need to load it into the game.

We're not even factoring in our own time to do quality assurance, testing the puzzles on various display sizes.  That's actually a pretty fun job :o)

So every $25 pledged will result in one brand new puzzle being created.  Backers will even be able to see them in a gallery as they're selected and made.

We have chosen flexible funding so that we can use every dollar that is pledged to enhance the game.  The target of $2,500 reflects our goal of having 100 awesome puzzles available at launch.

If we exceed the goal, every additional $25 will result in another puzzle being created.  We won't include many more than 100 puzzles at first launch, but to give the game longevity we need to keep adding new puzzles to keep the game interesting.  Additional funding will help us get a jump start on this.

Why 100 puzzles?

Because everyone likes round numbers :o)

We'd originally planned on having 50 puzzles at launch, but again playtesting revealed that this was short-sighted.  Although the way we're constructing puzzles gives them some replay value (each photo has between 7 and 10 possible differences and the game asks you to find a randomly-chosen set of three) we realised that competent players would regularly be clearing a round in under 15 seconds.

Players can easily see 20 or more puzzles in a 10 minute play session, and the most avid players (the ones we really want to keep happy) would cycle through 50 puzzles very quickly.

Also, in the App Store description, being able to say "more than 100 free puzzles" has a really nice ring to it!

Free, you say?

Indeed.  All our games are free to play.  They're supported by advertising, which can be removed via an in-app purchase, and other upgrades which can be purchased for a small fee.

Splat the Difference implements an in-game currency system.  You earn one "splat" for every difference you find during gameplay, and extra bonus splats for completing levels quickly or winning multi-player games.

Save up enough splats and you can trade them in for hints to use in the game when you get stuck, a "continue" option to keep your high-scoring game alive just a little longer, or new game modes.  To start with, there'll be untimed mode, mirror mode and memory mode.

For the impatient with a credit card, it's possible to buy extra splats for a fee.

But all the puzzle content will be made available to all players, free or paid.  There are no extra content packs to buy.  You'll all get it all.

What about the perks?

We have awesome perks!

Almost every backer will get access to an exclusive developer blog, where we'll keep you up to date with progress and present a gallery of all the photos we're using in the game - from those we're considering turning into puzzles to those we've actually completed but decided were too hard.  If you have even a passing interest in how puzzle games are made, it's going to give you a fascinating insight into the kind of decisions we made and the workflow involved.

You actually want the game?  Well, it's going to be free to play for everyone.  But we can throw you some in-game currency so you can play harder, faster and longer and unlock new game modes.

You want to play the game now?  Then become a beta-tester.  You'll get to play the game right away, plus you'll be able to playtest new puzzles as soon as they're created. Plus, as an added bonus, we'll even listen to what you think about the game!

You want real stuff sent through the mail?  We've got postcards, fridge magnets and coasters.  Here's some photos.

You want us to make a puzzle using a photo of you?  Are you insane?  That'll be $40 please.

Can I donate photographs?

The easiest way for us to deal with this is to say no, because we don't want to offend any individual by saying we don't want to use your photo.

We're intending to select specific images from stock photography sites which meet the guidelines we've developed through the course of making this game.

If you feel you have an exceptional picture that would make a perfect spot the difference puzzle and you want to see it in the game, claim the "Name the difference" perk and we'll see if we can use it.  Photos must be your own work and you'll need to sign a licence agreement.

Please note that we absolutely cannot use any photographs that contain human faces, unless they're created as part of the "Be a difference" perk.

How else can I help?

If you can't pledge money, you can still help!  Please consider doing one of the following:

- Share this campaign on Facebook, or tweet about it.  There are handy Indiegogo share tools at the top of the page.

- Follow @lightwoodgames on Twitter.

- Like us on Facebook.

- Join our mailing list.

- Download and review the game, once it's done.

Thank you.  We will genuinely appreciate every ounce of support you provide!
story_txt:
What's our project?
We're making a spot the difference game for iOS called "Splat the Difference".

In case you didn't immediately figure it out, the gameplay is styled so that you mark differences on a picture using coloured "splats".
Imagine throwing jelly at a window to solve a puzzle.
Wasn't that fun?
Plus, you can play against a friend, live and in real-time over the internet!
Who are we? 
Lightwood Games is a small, independent developer who has produced a number of puzzle games for iPhone, iPad and iPod touch.
We're passionate about social gaming experiences, so our titles include multi-player online modes. We created the first ever online competitive word search puzzle (Word Search Party), which has now been played more than 10 million times.  We made a jigsaw app (Jigsaw Party) that lets you create puzzles from your own photos and then race to solve them against a friend in real time.  Our sudoku game (Sudoku Party) has a crazy two-player mode like nothing you've ever seen before!
Our two-person programming team works quickly and efficiently to deliver stunning results.  At the recent GameHack event in London, which challenged developers to create an original game in just 24 hours, we picked up two prizes - "Best Use of Mobile" and "Most Innovative Idea".  Here's a video.
What do we need?
The code for Splat the Difference is functionally complete.  At the time of writing, we have a playable solo game and a playable online two-player game.  There's some work still to do to polish the app and to add more social features to increase its virility, but this project is well under way, and it will definitely be released!
However, there's one area where we're currently falling short: creating awesome spot the difference puzzles.
Here's what we first thought a puzzle would look like:

Was it fun?  Did you find many differences?  Does this make you want to play our game?
Thought not.  After playtesting, we discovered that what we really need for a casual mobile game is something more like this:

Hopefully you agree - it's more engaging, less headache-inducing, and even though the version here is smaller than you'd see in the game, you can probably spot all ten differences pretty quickly!
We made a bunch of puzzles using photos that were to hand, figuring that all it needed was an artist to do some cunning photo editing to make them fun.  We were wrong.
We've learned that we totally underestimated what would be needed to give this game the content it deserves.  We want to put that right, but we already burned the graphics budget getting to this stage.
That's not to say all the puzzles we already have are garbage.  Some of them are perfectly good; some will work if we only include a few differences but many are just so mind-bendingly impossible that we don't want them to scare players away!

story:
Intro

Hello Hello

Im mySelf on this and i need some boost in the budget so i can hire programmers and 3d artist to finish up the game to the last state. Right now you can try the demo version of the game on http://pixi5000.webs.com

The game is a 3D Third person shooter. It will be available on the net and it will be for free. I mean on the net where you will have a real 3D GAME and not some illusion of 3d space. The game should be available for the facebook users as well :)


HOW CAN YOU HELP? 

- You can help make a revolutionary change in the web gaming. It is finaly possible to   bring the third dimension into the web-browsers 

- play the demo and see it for your self :) http://pixi5000.webs.com 


The story

Pixi 5000 is a lonely robot living in the future and he is fighting the evil theft robots. The evil thefts are stealing the stars from the universe and Pixi 5000 is on a mission to stop them. Simple ha? :)

 . 

The Impact

Help with the 3D revolution in the indie web gaming. 

The money will go towards three things.

1. Programmer. The code is good as it is, but I'd prefer to get a professional coder to really polish it and to make sure everything will run smooth before the release.

2. Art. I have an artist willing to work if I pay him. At the moment the commission is for a bare minimum of art for the game (environment and character archetypes). These funds will pay for those, and if there's enough money, for more art work.

3. Website initial costs


What We Need & What You Get

Whether the goal is reached or not, the game will be published. However, it will be much better if there will be money to pay for professional editing and art work.

All funders will get access to the beta version of the game, to tide you over until the final version is available. Your donations will be rewarded. There is a set of various rewards for you depending on how much you donate!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate money you can still help. Word of mouth is a very powerful tool. You can spread the word about the campaign. Tell your gamer friends by sharing the project on Facebook, tweet and post the link to forums if are a blogger. The more people see the campaign, there is better chance to make this project reality.

story:
What is Coraabia?

 Coraabia RPCG is a revolutionary free online collectible card game with role-playing features. The project has been already developing for three years in completely independent environment led by Czech game developers, supported by a huge amount of talented artists from many countries , who enriched Coraabia with its unforgettable visual style. Thanks to this broad international support from experienced professionals, the game has ambitions to address global internet community and enter the still underdeveloped market of honest browser games with strong stories which provide players with all comfort and background without any need of installation or monthly fees. 


Search the multiverse!

Player gets a possibility to become a Coraabian, an inhabitant of the distinctive planet Coraab. He can discover exotic universe around and compete other players with help of his cards and abilities.

The unique game mechanism begins as a simple overcharging but it would soon get a strong strategic feature thanks to the strengthening cards and player's abilities. The real mastery would be measured by sophisticated league system, which is an inseparable part of players' mutual rivalry.

Coraabia Preview: The Characters

       

                                                                                 Game screenshot (closed beta)

As the game continues, a strong story is awaken which was hidden behind hundreds of character cards which are gradually to be found in Coraabia. There exist various worlds with unique environment, where players can measure their powers, and also a number of quests which can be run for. Coraabian time goes in parallel with the real time and it determines when new cards and editions are launched and also measures Coraabian inhabitants' lifetime. Players' actions actually shape Coraabian history which continues thanks to their struggle. This game feature is completely unique among online games.



                

Coraabia - Factions


Team

The game has been created by the independent game studio ARK8. The core team is represented by ten people who have been working on the project for several years in perfectly noncommercial conditions. 

  

         

                

ARK8


ARK8 is just enthusiastic about creating games. We have been friends for many years and we are all keen players and creators ï¿½ our very first card game was developed in 1997. The team works great. Despite the complexity and implementation demands, we just love the developing and completion of the project is our greatest priority. Coraabia is being created since 2008 and its final world release should appear in May 2012 (about 1|4264 of Coraabian time). We have done a lot of work but the next project phase would be very demanding.

The private Czech Beta version has been released and about 500 players have already played it. Testers played already about 50 000 games and responded really positively. Local media, game magazines and TV report about the project in the very superlatives. However, further expansion or improvements are on the way ...


     

Support us!

Coraabia is unique in the world thanks to the huge visual content, which was created by nearly 250 artists from 55 countries. Thanks to our contagious enthusiasm, we have managed to get their artworks completely for free! Well-known names can be found among artist, for example Johann Bodin, Pascal Blanchï¿½, AndreeWallin, Robotpencil, Tarrzan, OmeN, Pierre Bourgeot, David Munoz Velazquez, Falk, Morgan Vilette, Anton Kokarev, Carlos Villa, David Lecossu, Goran Delic, Markus Lovadina, Riyahd Cassiem, Arturo Aguirre, David Melvin, Horia Dociu, Xue Duan, Paul Chadeisson, Mihai Liviu, Blaz Porenta, Ramï¿½n Miranda, Emma Weakly, Carlos Villa, Xia Taptara, Wanbao, Julio Iglesias, Maxim Verehin, Ivan Kashubo, Valerij Maksimov, Oliver Wetter, Nekro, Embryo and many others. Not even illustrators of Magic:The Gathering or willing people from big game companies as Blizzard or UbiSoft should be forgotten. Thanks to Coraabia artists coming from the whole world, our multiverse has an unforgettable visual character and we are really thankful for their present support!


Now, you can support the Coraabia project too! Received money will be invested into the development of the application final version, which should contain both PC and tablet versions. Resources will be used for setting up server facilities able to cover up the international release and also for a ARK8 members' symbolic salary, which would allow them finally leave their jobs and create the game as a real full-time job. This dream project totally fills our lives and our goal is really close to reach.

For your contribution, you will get a number of bonuses in the day of the full version release. Firstly, it will be a certain amount of the game currency Xot which allows you in the full version to buy so-called booster packs, it means packs with random cards. Each booster costs 25-30 Xots and contains four character cards or trick cards.



 
       Rare Collectors (Coraabian Pack)


The donate version ï¿½Coraabianï¿½ contains also the exclusive rare collector cards and a special set of players'avatars.




        Guru Collectors (Iblort Pack)


The highest version ï¿½Iblortï¿½ contains especially five powerful Guru cards which will by right become real legends of the game. Their price in Coraabia will become astronomical, as it is a limited collector edition.

We highly appreciate your possible support and hope that you would love playing Coraabia after its release!

Any further questions or request send to team@coraabia.com.

Greetings from

ARK8 
Czech Republic





             

Videos

Game Teaser

Coraabia Preview: The Characters

Skeletons short film trailer


Links

Facebook page

Official page

Coraabia RPCG YouTube channel

Coraabia RPCG prerelease report in "Indian" (CZ only)

story:
TRY THE ALPHA VERSION FOR FREE :)

What the hell is Avillum?

Avillum is a brand new Online Trading Card Game that is currently in Alpha phase. Our goal is to make the best and more enjoyable TCG on the web. Here is a few things we think distinguish us from the others.

  • Our game is pure HTML. Players will never have to download anything to play the game. Also, we will be able to push fixes and releases very fast because people won't have to go through the painful process of updating an app.

  • We want to make trading cards cool again. A lot of trading card games out there don't even allow you to trade cards, and if they do, it's through some kind of weird marketplace. We want to make it really simple to trade cards with your friends.

So you already have an Alpha version out there?

Yes! In fact, you can try it right now through this link.

NOTE : 
If there's nobody online to try it with you and you can't wait, you can simulate a game by using 2 browsers and creating 2 accounts.

Nice! What do you want to add in the Beta Version?

We have A LOT of ideas for this game. But like every other indie game, we gotta start somewhere. Here's what we planned to do for the Beta release : 

  • New Main Character and Starter Deck (1 hero and 16 unique cards)
  • First card collection of 75 unique cards
  • Custom Deck Builder interface
  • Friend list
  • Private Duels
  • Private Messages

Sounds good, what are some of your other ideas? 

No matter how much money we get from this campaign, we will continue to work hard to make the game better. Here's a few things we'd like to add afterwards :

  • Forums
  • Possibility to create special auction threads on the forum to sell cards
  • Revolutionary card trading system
  • Organized tournament play and rankings
  • Tens of unique Heroes
  • Hundreds of unique Cards
  • So much more…

Awesome! But why do you need money?

We need the money to pay for various things, here are few : 

  • Servers! Servers! Servers!
  • Nice illustrations for the cards and promotional stuff.
  • Marketing, because if nobody hears of the game, you won't be able to play.
  • Security funds in case we have to scale quickly and do not have the expertise.
  • Food. That's always nice.

How do I know you'll succeed?

Well, there's already a working Alpha version online and we attracted 250 players in a week. Without any funding. Sure it took some time, but we're really motivated!

Wow, that was a long pitch! Now what?

If you're not sure about getting one of our nice perks, we invite you to try the Alpha Version and give us your feedback! That'll help us make the game even better :)

Thanks <3

Alexandre, Founder
story_txt:
TRY THE ALPHA VERSION FOR FREE :)
What the hell is Avillum?
Avillum is a brand new Online Trading Card Game that is currently in Alpha phase. Our goal is to make the best and more enjoyable TCG on the web. Here is a few things we think distinguish us from the others.

Our game is pure HTML. Players will never have to download anything to play the game. Also, we will be able to push fixes and releases very fast because people won't have to go through the painful process of updating an app.

We want to make trading cards cool again. A lot of trading card games out there don't even allow you to trade cards, and if they do, it's through some kind of weird marketplace. We want to make it really simple to trade cards with your friends.



So you already have an Alpha version out there?
Yes! In fact, you can try it right now through this link.NOTE : If there's nobody online to try it with you and you can't wait, you can simulate a game by using 2 browsers and creating 2 accounts.



Nice! What do you want to add in the Beta Version?
We have A LOT of ideas for this game. But like every other indie game, we gotta start somewhere. Here's what we planned to do for the Beta release : 

New Main Character and Starter Deck (1 hero and 16 unique cards)
First card collection of 75 unique cards
Custom Deck Builder interface
Friend list
Private Duels
Private Messages

No matter how much money we get from this campaign, we will continue to work hard to make the game better. Here's a few things we'd like to add afterwards :

So much more…

Servers! Servers! Servers!

Security funds in case we have to scale quickly and do not have the expertise.
Food. That's always nice.

Well, there's already a working Alpha version online and we attracted 250 players in a week. Without any funding. Sure it took some time, but we're really motivated!
Wow, that was a long pitch! Now what?
If you're not sure about getting one of our nice perks, we invite you to try the Alpha Version and give us your feedback! That'll help us make the game even better :)
Thanks <3
Alexandre, Founder

story:
The Last Ask: We're Upping the Ante!

We’ve got just over 24 hours left before the end of the Indiegogo campaign, and we’re still $600 dollars short of our stretch goal.  We really want to see Clyde Rhoer at Gen Con, so we’re sweetening the deal!

You know those two mind melting monsters James Raggi designed for us? The James Raggi who is so well-known for self-restraint? Who is certainly never prone to excess?

Well, Mr. Raggi’s typing hand must have slipped, because he sent us four monsters. And an essay. It’s about creating and using monsters in your game.

That’s pretty darn cool. But we haven’t even gotten to the part where we sweeten the deal yet! What if we told you those monster entries are going to be professionally laid out, and illustrated by the amazing Chris Schieffer (the guy who drew the totally wicked Githyanki picture you see above)? Because as it turns out, that is what we’re telling you!

So if that sounds awesome to you, please contribute, and tell a few friends about the awesome monsters.  If you’re feeling generous, buy a T-shirt, or a seat at one of the awesome games we’ll be running at Gen Con, or the Galileo games pack, or a custom-designed SRS for the Mecha RPG. Help us get Clyde to Gen Con. He’s an awesome guy, and he’ll make the show better.  We promise.

p.s. Before anybody asks, anyone who already pledged at a level that gets the James Raggi monsters will get all 4 monsters, fully awesomified, as described above.

UPDATE:  Stretch Goal! Help us bring Clyde Rhoer to Gen Con!

Thank you so much to everyone who's given to the campaign so far.  We reached our original goal of $1,500, and during that time we found out that Clyde Rhoer (of the Theory From the Closet and Yellow Menace podcasts, and all-around great guy) was going to miss out on Gen Con this year due to money concerns.  We couldn't let that happen!  

If we're able to get to $2,500, every penny past the original goal will go toward bringing Clyde to Gen Con, where he'll record Theory From the Closet-style interviews and podcast with the This Just In crew.  

If you're able to help, we'd appreciate it so much - and Clyde would too!  

 

Who We Are

Now in its fifth year, This Just In...From Gen Con brings you timely news and interviews straight from Indianapolis. Whether you're an attendee or listening at home, This Just In...From Gen Con captures the excitement of the Best Four Days in Gaming and delivers it right to your ears.
 
Returning host Rich Rogers is currently the host of Canon Puncture and co-host of RPG Crosstalk. This year Rich is bringing three co-hosts on board, Alex and Ed from The Yellow Menace Podcast, and roving reporter Steph!
 
Together they will endeavor to bring you the best This Just In... coverage from Gen Con yet.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to provide daily coverage spanning Thursday - Sunday; two episodes per day on Thursday, Friday, and Saturday, and one episode on Sunday. In addition we will be recording preview episodes before the show and a special This Just In...From Gen Con wrap up episode after the con.
 
This year we plan to expand our coverage to include convention-floor interviews, as well as the 'studio audience' experience and early-bird daily preview episodes from last year. Non-attendees will be able to experience all the fun and excitement of the Gen Con experience as it happens, while attendees will be kept appraised of things they might want to see at the convention.
 
In addition to the podcast content, we will post regular updates to the This Just In...From Gen Con Twitter feed (@TJIGenCon), Google+ page, Facebook page, and Tumblr feed.
 
To make This Just In...From Gen Con happen in 2012 we're investing in new recording equipment to facilitate on-the-spot interviews. In addition to ofsetting the cost of the hardware, your contributions help cover travel expenses and lodging.
 
We've also added a number of Perks as a Thank You to our Supporters, from a $10 Friend contribution level all the way up to full show Sponsorship. To help the campaign we've brought on board some really exciting game industry insiders, including:
  • James Raggi (Lamentations of the Flame Princess)
  • Brennan Taylor (Bulldogs / Galileo Games)
  • Jake Richmond (GxB / Atarashi Games)
  • Chris Perrin (Mecha / Heroic Journey Publications)
  • Erik Frankhouse (Winner of the 2011 Iron GM competition)
See the Perks at right for full details. (Note: For overseas supporters - for any Perk that includes shipping physical objects please add $5 to your total. Thanks!) 
 
Update: Here's a look at the Limited Edition shirt!
 
 
Update #2: Here's a few sample Cthulhu-themed dice cups from Sova Leatherworks to give you an idea of what you'll receive as part of the Patron Perk level. You can choose from either the Elder Sign or Yellow Sign caps; the cup side is inscribed with the Chapter 1 of H.P. Lovecraft's At The Mountains of Madness.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still help! Get the word out about the show and this Indie GoGo campaign. Share the word with all your friends, get the word out via Twitter, Facebook, Google+, email...however you can.
 
Help us make 2012 the best year yet for This Just In...From Gen Con!

story:
Update #1

I added a playable prototype link:
Browser
Windows

If the browser build doesn't work please download the Windows build.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

About Project Raid:

This is a Real time strategy (RTS) game where you control a fleet of ants in a breathtaking wonderful world. There are (currently) four type of ants: soldiers, workers, transporters and medics. They must cooperate with each other to overcome obstacles and enemies. Their goal is to collect food, survive and multiply but it’s not going to be an easy task.

This gameplay video is from a pre-alpha build it's only a proof of concept we will rework everything from scratch.

Gameplay:

The player controls four group of ants in real time. You can select one specific group for example a group of soldiers to attack or even an individual ant 'Solo Mode' for example making a specific ant attacks. The situation gets intense sometimes and the player need to use all groups at the same time for example: the workers are cutting an obstacle while enemy insects attack, soldiers must defend the workers and also medics must heal the injured soldiers. The are a lot is going on in the screen.

Types of Ants:

There are (currently) four type of ants: soldiers, workers, transporters and medics:


Soldiers:


Soldiers fights other types of insects, they must assault enemies and defend the other types.

Workers:

Workers destroy obstacles that face the fleet, like a rock blocking the road, these ants can destroy anything with their sharp teeth.



Transporters:

Transporters job is to deliver any resources to the base, resources help leveling up the queen and that means more ants you can use.


Medics:

Medics help healing the injured ants by releasing a special healing chemicals that cause an accelerate healing for wounds.


Rewarding System:


Level Up:

Ants level up according to performance, for example soldier type ants level up when they kill more enemy insects. When they do, their attack damage goes up.

Collecting Resources:

When Transporter type collect resources into their hole, the queen levels up. When the queen levels up more ants respawn immediately to your fleet, which makes your job more easier.

This Project is My Dream:

I'm a passionate indie video game developer who dreams to make big games. This project is one of the biggest dreams I have. I'm willing to dedicate a lot of time and effort for this project if I have money. It's going to be an amazing breathtaking experience in the amazing world of ants.

What the Project Needs:

I need money to support myself, buy a new laptop, new equipments, engines and licenses, hire a music composer, hire artists and other stuff..

supporters with $10 can get:
1- an exclusive wallpaper of the game.

supporters with $25 can get:
1- an exclusive digital copy of the game soundtrack.
2- an exclusive digital copy of the game artwork.

supporters with $50 can get:
1- an interview with the developer on Skype to answer all your burning questions.

supporters with $100 can choose to be beta testers, beta testers will have the chance to test new builds, a new build will be sent to beta testers every 2-4 weeks.

Bigger Budget Means:

1- More platforms. (initially Windows and Mac, then iOS, Android, Windows Phone and more).
2- Longer gameplay hours.
3- Deeper rewarding system.
4- More type of ants (Fire ants and more).
5- More cutscenes.
6- Better graphics (hiring more artists).
7- Integrated cloud services.
8- More gameplay elements (mechanics).

Other Ways To Help:

If you can't back me up it's fine all I need from you is the word of mouth about my game and about the campaign, please share the youtube video and the campaign URL.

story:
UPDATE 1

Thank you for your kind contributions and comments. We really appreciate you taking the time to visit the campaign page.

As a little treat, we’d like to show you design mock-ups of the T-Shirt, Drawstring Bag and Hoodie so you know exactly what you’re receiving for your contributions.

We’re also excited to announce that donators will be able to choose between three different t-shirts. If you donate enough to earn a T-Shirt, simply message us to tell us your design of choice and we’ll post it out to you.

 

 

Donate £30 and receive a T-Shirt. Donate £50, receive a T-Shirt and a Draw-String Bag. £100? Get both and an Expansive Hoodie!

Big thank you to Mark Newman and Aaron Lapper for these wonderful designs

 

Update 2: The future of Expansive coverage

We want to clarify some things about the future of Expansive coverage should specific stretch goals be met. We’re also excited to make a few additional announcements today.

Welsh Games Coverage

As you can see from our 5K goal, we’re focusing on covering the Welsh Gaming Industry in full. Presently, there is no press for games in Wales. The local media is primarily focused on politics, sport and lifestyle events. This is hugely disappointing as there are so many exciting things happening, such as a South Wales Games Development Show, support from BAFTA Cyrmu and various gaming projects, both announced and unannounced. Welsh Games have no promotion whatsoever, and that desperately needs to change in order for the local industry to thrive.

My aim with Expansive is to become that outlet. We’ll provide interviews, reviews, previews and news from all things Welsh Gaming and branch it out as its own separate sub-site. The Indiegogo Campaign was founded on promoting games journalism in Wales and if successful, I will also seek to recruit some local freelance writers to help produce regular, engaging coverage, drawing on their experiences to source stories. Of course, this will be completely dependent on the closing budget of the campaign.

Browser/Facebook Gaming Coverage

We’re looking to encompass coverage of other, more niche areas in the games industry to expand our end-product. You’ve already seen that we will be actively covering both Xbox One and Playstation 4 news. We also support Wii U, Mobile, PC, and other handheld devices. With successful campaign funding, we also intend to support Browser and Facebook-themed gaming.

One of the most popular types of gaming on the planet, amazingly, there isn’t an outlet out there that looks at coverage in detail. We aim to change that! Considering many of the released games expand narrative and gaming worlds (Plants vs Zombies Adventures, The Sims, The Hobbit) there’s plenty out there for us to cover.

Naturally, freelancers with a specific knowledge set will be called upon to help with this coverage, dependant on budget.

Ouya

A new gaming platform that received backing through crowdfunding, Ouya is already building a lot of momentum in the build up to launch. I’m excited to announce that, with ample funding, we intend to support Ouya on Expansive. We aim to get hold of a console and produce all the coverage you want to see. Several units would likely be sourced so various members of the team can share out the coverage. Our coverage would include standard news, reviews, previews and interviews, as well as occasional opinion pieces.

Oculus Rift

Many dub this the ‘true next-gen of gaming’; Oculus Rift finally brings our Virtual Reality dreams to life. I’m excited to reveal that Oculus Rift is something we’re very keen to cover on Expansive. Old games are already being patched to receive support (such as Mirror’s Edge) and many new games are having it built into their code so they’re playable out of the box. As a true expansion of gaming worlds, we’d offer extensive patch reviews and assess just how much the Oculus Rift contributes to the video games industry. We’d also offer news and interviews, as well as opinion pieces.

MMO

While we already cover MMOs, we recognise that we’re not doing enough. They’re a massive part of the gaming market and for future patch reviews, we need to ensure those who do patch reviews are fully aware of what a game has done before, what it’s doing now and what direction it is heading in/where it needs to be. We’ll offer freelance to people with a specific skill-set and also supply more news, as well as deeper coverage of MMOs we haven’t previously covered and those we’re already covering.

I hope this provides clarity and perspective of our intentions and what we will do with some of the funding received from this campaign. As we’ve previously stated, the site is currently done as a part-time hobby, but if successful, we can become an all-encompassing, full-time outlet that provides cutting-edge coverage for some of the current gaps in the industry.

In the coming days we will offer further clarity on some of the other stretch goals we have planned.

 

UPDATE 3

Just to briefly talk about our Podcast aspirations. We're hoping to have a team of four, myself included for all recordings. Each Individuals will alternate hosting the podcast and each podcast will take on a different theme. Each theme will relate to gaming expansion in some way.

The podcast will also include DLC news, upcoming patches, cool new mods, reader questions, competitions, local gaming news (from all over the country) and more. There is absolutely nothing like the podcast we're working on right now. A huge gap in the market exists for a podcast of this type and we aim to fill it with our own unique style of games reporting.

The money will be used to help set all of our crew up with appropriate audio equipment. This includes equipment which can be taken remotely and used for interviews with local people. We'll also use this money to do greater levels of research into our own local area of gaming and expand that coverage so that we're informing our listeners as much as possible and also do our best to offer some exclusives which makes the Podcast all the more worthwhile in listening to.

If you have any feedback or questions, please feel free to leave them in the comments.

In the coming days, we'll release more details on the Expansive App, as well as the Expansive E-Zine.

Thanks for sticking around :)

  

Expansive? What’s this all about then? 

Please Note: We will be producing videos throughout the campaign.

Expansive has been operating for just under five months. It’s a young, fresh outlet still developing its community and continuing to carve out a niche. The site is unique in that it’s entirely focused on updates, patches, fixes, mods, content updates, DLC and other related areas for console, mobile and PC games. Expansive supports this through news, reviews, previews, overviews and interviews.

The site has got a good thing going and has already built a lot of momentum. In under five months, it's amassed 150,000 Page Views and over 60,000 Unique Hits. The owner of the website is an active part of the video games industry and has already made fantastic, high-profile contacts. As a result, Expansive has received amazing support post-launch. Still, the site isn’t at the standard it could or should be.

To achieve that, Expansive needs your help.

To give you some background, the owner of Expansive, Ray Willmott, is an established, part-time freelance games journalist with over four years of experience. His work can regularly be seen in The Sun Newspaper’s Games Column, but has also been published in/on GamesTM, PLAY magazine, NOWGamer, Sabotage Times, 148Apps and, most recently, VG247. The majority of Ray's work can be seen on This Is My Joystick! where he has contributed for over four years.

Alongside Expansive Overviews, which provide appraisals on the latest games, and a monthly DLC release schedule, Expansive has pioneered the gaming patch review and is focused on consistently giving ever-developing games a fair shout with a score before and after the patch, then giving the game a current rating out of 5. If developers are willing to keep ironing out bugs and adding content, the site is willing to keep reporting on those games. Check out recent patch reviews for Gears Judgment, Crysis 3 and Guild Wars 2 to give you an idea of how these work.

Expansive also apply patch reviews to console firmware and have recently written about Playstation Vita and Wii U patches, assessing their overall impact on each individual system. 

Unfortunately, there are still many challenges. The main problem is that Expansive is a glorified hobby. The site receives very limited money from ads. It is not self-sustaining, so the owners are investing their own money to keep things running, and are forced to work around our full-time jobs. This, coupled with the trials and tribulations of everyday life, means that Expansive cannot be our first priority. We want to be in a position to support writers financially, but we simply can't be. At least, not at the moment.

There’s a lot of work to be done and, as you can see from our stretch goals, we have a lot of ambition. However, we believe we can do it, as well as set the foundations for other exciting projects we’re planning. All we need is an extra boost to get the ball rolling. 

 

Expansive needs £5,000 to get things started. Here's what we'll accomplish with that money. 

Improve regularity, have better attendance at events, create opportunities for exclusives, bolster content output: Expect more detailed reports, up-to-date, current coverage, more exclusives, tighter turn-around times and more content opportunities explored on all covered formats. This funding would enable us to be better placed at gaming events in the UK, covering travelling expenditure and accomodation where necessary. We regularly miss out on major overseas events, such as E3 or GDC, and we would like to be covering those on the site in our own unique way. The funding will ensure we have business cards printed and some access to quality, remote recording equipment. We’ll also increase regularity of our current League of Legends and Guild Wars 2 columns, as well as explore other columns and concepts in the pipe-line. Current ideas include columns based on The Old Republic, World of Warcraft, Defiance and DayZ, as well as unique features and opinion pieces. We will also be offering in-depth coverage of the Welsh Games Industry, giving it a seperate sub-site.. On top of that, we'll also be creating a one-stop hub for mods, investigating Steam Workshop in full and also other sites/people that provide mods for games. This would be a powered database specifically designed to provide key mod information about your chosen game and provide easy stop links, as well as links to mini reviews to help you decide if that mod is for you. Additionally, we will improve our DLC release schedule in a similar way, making it more user friendly, update it more effeciently and offering more content through it. - £5k

Site Redesign, improved hosting, additional domain purchasing, extra site content and forums: We want to keep the heart and soul blog-theme of Expansive alive, but ideally give it something more distinct, identifiable and individual. We have ideas, but need time, resources, and, of course, finances to make them possible. The idea is to create a better interface for navigation, making it easier to find the content you’re looking for and continue to help the site carve out an identity. We will add Facebook and browser game coverage to the site and potentially consider subsites under one Expansive banner if content becomes too excessive. We will purchase additional domains and upgrade our hosting for constant care and attention, ensuring downtime is minimal. We will also set up new, improved Forums. - £10k

Making the site completely ad-free: We currently use ads to help fund the site’s upkeep for hosting, as well as paying for the web-domain, consulting, event attendance, accommodation and postage. This stretch goal will enable us to remove ads completely for 2 years, making the site un-intrusive, seamless and completely self-sustaining. Several sub-sites will be created under one Expansive banner for even greater ease of navigation. The money will also let us hire occasional freelance writers to contribute to Expansive and provide varied content from different walks of life. While the first 2 goals would cover some of this, it wouldn't cover all costs for this period of time. We will also offer Ouya coverage, giving it a seperate sub-site. - £20k

Audio setups: We have a team of four ready to get involved and also lined up a few guests, but whenever we've started a podcast, the recording has been deleted or corrupted. Many of you will know these frustrations, I'm sure. So, we want proper equipment for four people. We want to provide the best possible opportunities to get the best quality equipment. When setting up a Podcast, we’d currently be using a computer mic, skype and audacity. Ideally, we want to use a better recording programme with better recording software, equipment and someone designated to edit the podcasts to make them structured, creating a tight format and making them much easier on the ear. This goal would allow us to purchase equipment for several people, enabling us to have a full-time, podcasting team. This would also mean quickly edited, timely podcasts on significant issues, and even allow us to approach special guests and have them feature on the show. This money would be put to use to create the best possible audio experience for any Expansive projects using audio. Our first Podcast project will look at the current DLC scene in gaming and how it is changing the industry as we move closer to next-gen. We will also provide Oculus Rift coverage as well as improved MMO coverage, giving them both seperate sub-sites.  - £30k

Video content: We have ambitious video content goals. This goal will allow several of us to buy better recording equipment and appropriate software for picture quality. This will help us produce better video content for patch reviews, overviews, previews, interviews and more. We would also use this equipment for filming at events and providing an Expansive perspective on all upcoming games. This funding will ensure several staffers are equipped properly for this purpose. - £40k

Fund full-time staffer and provide freelance: We’re currently an ndependent outlet. As a result, the site is worked on as and when people can. We want to be offering more, and to do that we recognise the need to employ at least one member of staff working on Expansive full-time. This will enable us to post more often, offer up-to-date, breaking news stories and timely review coverage. We will also play through older games, looking at their patches, updates and DLC, reporting on them as we go. In addition, we will produce reviews of older content to give the site a legacy library and deeper database of content for those interested in historic coverage. This may mean purchasing titles, as well as doing research and potentially hiring specialists that are historically familiar with the intellectual property in question. This funding will also allow the site to have a more professional front, making sure somebody is available to go to more events and PR functions, which will improve our relationships within the industry. In addition, we will be able to offer freelance work and improve our overall coverage, recruiting people with specific knowledge sets. - £55k

The Expansive App: For iOS, Blackberry and Android (potentially other OS'), we have some great ideas to make an accompanying app for the Expansive website. Its introduction presents some exciting possibilities, making the site more accessible and potentially broadening the site’s audience. The app would be easy to refresh and navigate, keeping readers up to date with news and features. It would likely have push notifications, and interchangeable backgrounds for ease of reading. It would be mobile and tablet-friendly, made free to download and offer various unique touches to compliment the Expansive experience. To donaters, early access would be given, as well as the ability to provide feedback and help develop the app in early stages. -  £100k

Vidcasts: Vidcasts would feature Geoff the Cat sat alongside the team; all fully voiced, animated, and even interactive and subtitled where applicable. In episodes, Geoff will offer his gaming input, as well as provide some hints, tips and previews on the latest games. However, it’ll also be down to the team to make sure he doesn’t get himself into mischief. The vidcast will offer live streams, reviews, previews, interviews, game footage, and other unique content. This would be fully supported by the Expansive App detailed above. - £125k

The Expansive E-Zine: We want to produce a regular E-Zine for Expansive that introduces content to a broader audience. This would be filled with unique content, such as comic strips, columns and interviews, as well as previews and reviews. The E-zine will be interactive and have content tailored specifically for this audience. The aim would be to make it available via the app, as well as selling it on the Kindle Store and through other e-reader marketplaces. Audio reviews will also be considered, as well as other opportunities to make content accessible to others. - £150k 

 

 Why Indiegogo?

We’ve thought long and hard about putting Expansive on Indiegogo and it’s fair to say that the project has divided opinion. We’re all unified on one thing, though: we want Expansive to succeed. We want people to have the site they deserve, and hope that the ideas being presented to you are also in-line with the things you’d like to see from a gaming site of this nature. The aim is to create something that fully considers and benefits our audience no matter how they like to digest their gaming information.

Indiegogo has been designed so people can bring their creative aspirations to life. Right now, the site is wholly independent. We manage to accomplish a lot with an amazing group of part-time volunteers, and have attracted viewers from all over the world, but we could be doing a lot more.

If this isn’t something you’d like to see, no problem. Thanks for stopping by and we appreciate the time you've taken to consider our pitch.  

If it is, then please consider helping us fund this campaign. Share. Spread the word. Who knows where things could lead?

 

What happens if we don’t get funded?

To coin a popular phrase, we’ll “Keep Calm and Carry On.” The site will still be online after the closure of the Indiegogo campaign, and it’ll still be doing what it does right now. We still aim to achieve as many of these goals as possible, however funding will ensure they are of the standard they could and should be. These features will also become part of the Expansive experience much quicker.
story_txt:
UPDATE 1Thank you for your kind contributions and comments. We really appreciate you taking the time to visit the campaign page.
As a little treat, we’d like to show you design mock-ups of the T-Shirt, Drawstring Bag and Hoodie so you know exactly what you’re receiving for your contributions.

We’re also excited to announce that donators will be able to choose between three different t-shirts. If you donate enough to earn a T-Shirt, simply message us to tell us your design of choice and we’ll post it out to you.
 

 
Donate £30 and receive a T-Shirt. Donate £50, receive a T-Shirt and a Draw-String Bag. £100? Get both and an Expansive Hoodie! Big thank you to Mark Newman and Aaron Lapper for these wonderful designs
 
Update 2: The future of Expansive coverage 
We want to clarify some things about the future of Expansive coverage should specific stretch goals be met. We’re also excited to make a few additional announcements today.
Welsh Games Coverage
As you can see from our 5K goal, we’re focusing on covering the Welsh Gaming Industry in full. Presently, there is no press for games in Wales. The local media is primarily focused on politics, sport and lifestyle events. This is hugely disappointing as there are so many exciting things happening, such as a South Wales Games Development Show, support from BAFTA Cyrmu and various gaming projects, both announced and unannounced. Welsh Games have no promotion whatsoever, and that desperately needs to change in order for the local industry to thrive.
My aim with Expansive is to become that outlet. We’ll provide interviews, reviews, previews and news from all things Welsh Gaming and branch it out as its own separate sub-site. The Indiegogo Campaign was founded on promoting games journalism in Wales and if successful, I will also seek to recruit some local freelance writers to help produce regular, engaging coverage, drawing on their experiences to source stories. Of course, this will be completely dependent on the closing budget of the campaign.
Browser/Facebook Gaming Coverage
We’re looking to encompass coverage of other, more niche areas in the games industry to expand our end-product. You’ve already seen that we will be actively covering both Xbox One and Playstation 4 news. We also support Wii U, Mobile, PC, and other handheld devices. With successful campaign funding, we also intend to support Browser and Facebook-themed gaming.
One of the most popular types of gaming on the planet, amazingly, there isn’t an outlet out there that looks at coverage in detail. We aim to change that! Considering many of the released games expand narrative and gaming worlds (Plants vs Zombies Adventures, The Sims, The Hobbit) there’s plenty out there for us to cover.
Naturally, freelancers with a specific knowledge set will be called upon to help with this coverage, dependant on budget.
Ouya
A new gaming platform that received backing through crowdfunding, Ouya is already building a lot of momentum in the build up to launch. I’m excited to announce that, with ample funding, we intend to support Ouya on Expansive. We aim to get hold of a console and produce all the coverage you want to see. Several units would likely be sourced so various members of the team can share out the coverage. Our coverage would include standard news, reviews, previews and interviews, as well as occasional opinion pieces.
Oculus Rift
Many dub this the ‘true next-gen of gaming’; Oculus Rift finally brings our Virtual Reality dreams to life. I’m excited to reveal that Oculus Rift is something we’re very keen to cover on Expansive. Old games are already being patched to receive support (such as Mirror’s Edge) and many new games are having it built into their code so they’re playable out of the box. As a true expansion of gaming worlds, we’d offer extensive patch reviews and assess just how much the Oculus Rift contributes to the video games industry. We’d also offer news and interviews, as well as opinion pieces.
MMO
While we already cover MMOs, we recognise that we’re not doing enough. They’re a massive part of the gaming market and for future patch reviews, we need to ensure those who do patch reviews are fully aware of what a game has done before, what it’s doing now and what direction it is heading in/where it needs to be. We’ll offer freelance to people with a specific skill-set and also supply more news, as well as deeper coverage of MMOs we haven’t previously covered and those we’re already covering.
I hope this provides clarity and perspective of our intentions and what we will do with some of the funding received from this campaign. As we’ve previously stated, the site is currently done as a part-time hobby, but if successful, we can become an all-encompassing, full-time outlet that provides cutting-edge coverage for some of the current gaps in the industry.
In the coming days we will offer further clarity on some of the other stretch goals we have planned.
 
UPDATE 3
Just to briefly talk about our Podcast aspirations. We're hoping to have a team of four, myself included for all recordings. Each Individuals will alternate hosting the podcast and each podcast will take on a different theme. Each theme will relate to gaming expansion in some way.
The podcast will also include DLC news, upcoming patches, cool new mods, reader questions, competitions, local gaming news (from all over the country) and more. There is absolutely nothing like the podcast we're working on right now. A huge gap in the market exists for a podcast of this type and we aim to fill it with our own unique style of games reporting.
The money will be used to help set all of our crew up with appropriate audio equipment. This includes equipment which can be taken remotely and used for interviews with local people. We'll also use this money to do greater levels of research into our own local area of gaming and expand that coverage so that we're informing our listeners as much as possible and also do our best to offer some exclusives which makes the Podcast all the more worthwhile in listening to.
If you have any feedback or questions, please feel free to leave them in the comments.
In the coming days, we'll release more details on the Expansive App, as well as the Expansive E-Zine.
Thanks for sticking around :)
  
Expansive? What’s this all about then? 
Please Note: We will be producing videos throughout the campaign.
Expansive has been operating for just under five months. It’s a young, fresh outlet still developing its community and continuing to carve out a niche. The site is unique in that it’s entirely focused on updates, patches, fixes, mods, content updates, DLC and other related areas for console, mobile and PC games. Expansive supports this through news, reviews, previews, overviews and interviews.
The site has got a good thing going and has already built a lot of momentum. In under five months, it's amassed 150,000 Page Views and over 60,000 Unique Hits. The owner of the website is an active part of the video games industry and has already made fantastic, high-profile contacts. As a result, Expansive has received amazing support post-launch. Still, the site isn’t at the standard it could or should be.
To achieve that, Expansive needs your help.
To give you some background, the owner of Expansive, Ray Willmott, is an established, part-time freelance games journalist with over four years of experience. His work can regularly be seen in The Sun Newspaper’s Games Column, but has also been published in/on GamesTM, PLAY magazine, NOWGamer, Sabotage Times, 148Apps and, most recently, VG247. The majority of Ray's work can be seen on This Is My Joystick! where he has contributed for over four years.
Alongside Expansive Overviews, which provide appraisals on the latest games, and a monthly DLC release schedule, Expansive has pioneered the gaming patch review and is focused on consistently giving ever-developing games a fair shout with a score before and after the patch, then giving the game a current rating out of 5. If developers are willing to keep ironing out bugs and adding content, the site is willing to keep reporting on those games. Check out recent patch reviews for Gears Judgment, Crysis 3 and Guild Wars 2 to give you an idea of how these work.
Expansive also apply patch reviews to console firmware and have recently written about Playstation Vita and Wii U patches, assessing their overall impact on each individual system. 
Unfortunately, there are still many challenges. The main problem is that Expansive is a glorified hobby. The site receives very limited money from ads. It is not self-sustaining, so the owners are investing their own money to keep things running, and are forced to work around our full-time jobs. This, coupled with the trials and tribulations of everyday life, means that Expansive cannot be our first priority. We want to be in a position to support writers financially, but we simply can't be. At least, not at the moment.
There’s a lot of work to be done and, as you can see from our stretch goals, we have a lot of ambition. However, we believe we can do it, as well as set the foundations for other exciting projects we’re planning. All we need is an extra boost to get the ball rolling. 
 
Expansive needs £5,000 to get things started. Here's what we'll accomplish with that money. 
Improve regularity, have better attendance at events, create opportunities for exclusives, bolster content output: Expect more detailed reports, up-to-date, current coverage, more exclusives, tighter turn-around times and more content opportunities explored on all covered formats. This funding would enable us to be better placed at gaming events in the UK, covering travelling expenditure and accomodation where necessary. We regularly miss out on major overseas events, such as E3 or GDC, and we would like to be covering those on the site in our own unique way. The funding will ensure we have business cards printed and some access to quality, remote recording equipment. We’ll also increase regularity of our current League of Legends and Guild Wars 2 columns, as well as explore other columns and concepts in the pipe-line. Current ideas include columns based on The Old Republic, World of Warcraft, Defiance and DayZ, as well as unique features and opinion pieces. We will also be offering in-depth coverage of the Welsh Games Industry, giving it a seperate sub-site.. On top of that, we'll also be creating a one-stop hub for mods, investigating Steam Workshop in full and also other sites/people that provide mods for games. This would be a powered database specifically designed to provide key mod information about your chosen game and provide easy stop links, as well as links to mini reviews to help you decide if that mod is for you. Additionally, we will improve our DLC release schedule in a similar way, making it more user friendly, update it more effeciently and offering more content through it. - £5k
Site Redesign, improved hosting, additional domain purchasing, extra site content and forums: We want to keep the heart and soul blog-theme of Expansive alive, but ideally give it something more distinct, identifiable and individual. We have ideas, but need time, resources, and, of course, finances to make them possible. The idea is to create a better interface for navigation, making it easier to find the content you’re looking for and continue to help the site carve out an identity. story:
Sam John is a courageous 16 year old from Fareham, UK who urgently needs a specific Proton Therapy (not available in the UK until 2017) to treat his inoperable brain tumour...This is a story which will touch your heart.

 

In 2006, Sam John’s world was turned upside down, when aged 9, he was diagnosed with an inoperable brain tumour…life would never be the same:

For the past 7 years, Sam (who lives with his Mum Vicki, Dad Steve and younger brother Matthew, in Fareham, Hampshire) has fought infections, undergone surgical procedures and endured countless blood transfusions – yet never losing sight of hope, and showing incredible strength and courage.

A scan on the 11th March 2013 showed that Sam’s tumour has grown, and become more active – Sam readily needs Proton Therapy which will not be available in the UK until 2017. This will be too late for Sam.

 Having turned 16 just two months ago, Sam does not qualify for the specific NHS funding towards this particular type of Proton Treatment so we need YOUR help to get him to the USA!!

 

I don’t know Sam, but when reading his Facebook page I couldn’t help but want to get involved and do what I can.

 

I never run the marathon, and I doubt I could. I can’t shave my head as Jessie J just made that cool. So I am doing something that scares the shite out of me in the hope that you are donate what you can. Its not like I do this every year, so I would really appreciate me falling from a friggin plane make an actual difference to this boys life.

 

Please give what you can. To put things in perspective, you probably spend over £20 in Stabucks each week.

The date of my sky dive is being set at the end of the month, but we don’t  have long to raise money, so I will be doing this in May or June.

 

On another note, you only get the dive free with a registered charity, which Sam’s family are trying to set up. So I will personally be covering the cost of my dive, all I am asking for you lot, is that you donate to Sam.

 

Thank you all SO much

 

Lots of love

Gina x
