story:
Hi, I'm Zoe Quinn and I'm incredibly broke (and embarassed about it). 

I'm an independent game developer who makes odd games. I've been involved with Super Street Fire (a game with literal flamethrowers) as a game designer, They Bleed Pixels as a lead tester, and I've made a few smaller games that I've released for free otherwise like Jeff Goldblum Staring Contest and On A Scale from Zero to Space, This Game is Space (like I said, weird games). I've also founded a nonprofit called Dames Making Games, and done other community outreach talks and programs about getting more people involved in making games. Right now my big project is called It's Not Okay, Cupid, and is a satirical game about online dating and trying to connect with people in the digital age. I'm also about to release a smaller project called Depression Quest, which expresses what it's like to try and live with depression. We'll probably change the name though once we think of a better one.

I work a day job to pay the bills while I do all this, and have been getting by ok despite recently moving cross country and having to deal with some nasty medical issues. But now that my savings are tapped, my computer has decided that this is, indeed, A Good Day To Die. I've looked at my finances and with dealing with bills and day to day maintenance, I'm not quite sure what I'm going to do to replace it. This makes me incredibly nervous and sad because it's getting harder and harder to try to finish Depression Quest while my laptop periodically dies and makes horrible grinding noises as it does so. 

Ironically, this is incredibly depressing. So I guess it's helpful in one way.

But, several people much smarter than I and less hung up on appearing strong and capable suggested I turn to the community for help. So here I am, although I am pretty embarassed about it. But the advice I keep getting is "you wouldn't think less of someone else in your position doing this so why should you think less of yourself?" I'm trying to actually listen to that advice instead of just ignoring it like I usually do.

What is the money for?

I am looking for $700 so that I can cover the indiegogo fees, shipping costs, taxes, and replace my laptop. I will be buying this one if the funds get raised. Nothing fancy, just what I need to get the job done. It's actually almost exactly what I'm working with right now, and I've found it to be at the level that I need it to be functioning at (except for the current one being... well, almost dead). I'm not looking for an alienware with a rainbowy keyboard (though holy shit those are cool), I just want to be able to keep making games. 

I've also looked in to replacing all the parts that have gone bad, and it's basically this much. Considering this laptop has been through a lot (including moves to other countries), I think it makes the most sense to put it out to pasture.

If the indiegogo goes over at all (ha ha yeah right), I'll just be taking the money and getting something better, or replacing my busted drawing tablet that literally has chunks of it missing. Literally. 

What if this gets funded?

I can keep making games without hitting a major speed bump! Holy shit, you would be the greatest. I couldn't thank you enough - I am in love with what I do and I only want to keep doing it and getting better at it. I will owe you so much more than what I can supply through my limited means and through indiegogo rewards. You'll be buying the ability for a wannabe artist to keep doing what she loves.

If the goal itself gets hit, it also means I won't have to take a handicap in terms of the tools I use to make games - I will likely eventually find some way to replace it after missing a few weeks of work, but it will almost certainly be a step down. Meeting this means being able to keep working with the level of tech that I'm used to, which would be a huge advantage.

Thank you already!

Thanks so much for reading this in the first place! I appreciate your time, even if you don't donate!
story_txt:
Hi, I'm Zoe Quinn and I'm incredibly broke (and embarassed about it). 
I'm an independent game developer who makes odd games. I've been involved with Super Street Fire (a game with literal flamethrowers) as a game designer, They Bleed Pixels as a lead tester, and I've made a few smaller games that I've released for free otherwise like Jeff Goldblum Staring Contest and On A Scale from Zero to Space, This Game is Space (like I said, weird games). I've also founded a nonprofit called Dames Making Games, and done other community outreach talks and programs about getting more people involved in making games. Right now my big project is called It's Not Okay, Cupid, and is a satirical game about online dating and trying to connect with people in the digital age. I'm also about to release a smaller project called Depression Quest, which expresses what it's like to try and live with depression. We'll probably change the name though once we think of a better one.
I work a day job to pay the bills while I do all this, and have been getting by ok despite recently moving cross country and having to deal with some nasty medical issues. But now that my savings are tapped, my computer has decided that this is, indeed, A Good Day To Die. I've looked at my finances and with dealing with bills and day to day maintenance, I'm not quite sure what I'm going to do to replace it. This makes me incredibly nervous and sad because it's getting harder and harder to try to finish Depression Quest while my laptop periodically dies and makes horrible grinding noises as it does so. 
Ironically, this is incredibly depressing. So I guess it's helpful in one way.
But, several people much smarter than I and less hung up on appearing strong and capable suggested I turn to the community for help. So here I am, although I am pretty embarassed about it. But the advice I keep getting is "you wouldn't think less of someone else in your position doing this so why should you think less of yourself?" I'm trying to actually listen to that advice instead of just ignoring it like I usually do.


What is the money for?
I am looking for $700 so that I can cover the indiegogo fees, shipping costs, taxes, and replace my laptop. I will be buying this one if the funds get raised. Nothing fancy, just what I need to get the job done. It's actually almost exactly what I'm working with right now, and I've found it to be at the level that I need it to be functioning at (except for the current one being... well, almost dead). I'm not looking for an alienware with a rainbowy keyboard (though holy shit those are cool), I just want to be able to keep making games. 
I've also looked in to replacing all the parts that have gone bad, and it's basically this much. Considering this laptop has been through a lot (including moves to other countries), I think it makes the most sense to put it out to pasture.
If the indiegogo goes over at all (ha ha yeah right), I'll just be taking the money and getting something better, or replacing my busted drawing tablet that literally has chunks of it missing. Literally. 


What if this gets funded?
I can keep making games without hitting a major speed bump! Holy shit, you would be the greatest. I couldn't thank you enough - I am in love with what I do and I only want to keep doing it and getting better at it. I will owe you so much more than what I can supply through my limited means and through indiegogo rewards. You'll be buying the ability for a wannabe artist to keep doing what she loves.
If the goal itself gets hit, it also means I won't have to take a handicap in terms of the tools I use to make games - I will likely eventually find some way to replace it after missing a few weeks of work, but it will almost certainly be a step down. Meeting this means being able to keep working with the level of tech that I'm used to, which would be a huge advantage.
Thank you already!
Thanks so much for reading this in the first place! I appreciate your time, even if you don't donate!

story:
Overview  

The Cool Biker Game With a Temporary Name* is a biker racing game in which you ride a chopper on wild roads. It’s all about speed, fun and rock and roll.

The game takes place in the wild biker’s world with a light and fun atmosphere due to a cartoonish graphical style, and an arcade oriented gameplay.

*there is a perk to give your name to the game. If that perk is not claimed then players will be able to vote to choose the final name

Current status

The game is currently in Alpha version, which means it is playable in a PC and Linux version (available here), but the content and the quality are not final, and that's what we need your help for.


The team

The core team based in France and in the UK and is composed of

Benjamin Levy

Software engineer with 10 years of experience

6 years of experience in racing games such as Moto Racer DS, Garfield Kart,  Truck racer and some other confidential projects on PC, PS3, I-Pad, Androïd, PSN and XBLA.

1 solo project in 2002 : Fantasy Battlefields (40 000 downloads)


Hugo Leo Chaves

Professionnal musician and 3D artist


Colin Merrick

Senior Game Artist with 4 and a half years of experience on XBox 360, PC,Wii,PS2,PSP games

worked on Kinectimals, Outsider, Off the rails, Football superstars 



Key features

Infinite number of tracks

The tracks are procedural, that means that your experience is different every time you play because roads are randomly generated by your computer and there is an infinite number of possible combinations. In this way one will not have to learn by heart a track to be able to compete with hard core players.

High Speed and fun

The gameplay is foremost arcade to focus on the fun and the speed sensations. The controls are simple and the handiness is high. However there are little subtilities such as boost and position managment so that hardcore players will find a real challenge to master the game.

You can also kick and punch your opponents, and you have to avoid crates, barrels and wild animals on the roads.


Being a bad ass

This game with its many possibilities of character and bikes customization allows the player to embody the bad ass he has always wanted to be.

Bike customizations: pipes, handle bars, fuel tank picture, wheels

Character customizations: jackets, headgears, tattoos


Metal up your ears

The soundtrack will be composed and recorded by Deïmos a local Trash band. You do not know what trash is? Well you know Metallica don’t you?

Game modes

There are classical racing game modes like single race against AIs, and online race and championships, but with fewer formalities:  just start from the bar and try to end at the bar in first position.

There will be also more original game modes like:

Moustache race : pick up power-ups along the road to get advantage over your opponents or to anninilate them (hell gate appearing in the ground, satanic sheeps tribe crossing the road, puddle of oil, portal, flat tires, homing boot, ghost rider, angel wings, puddle of glue, nitro pack …)

Crab hunt: crush as many giant evil crabs as you can along the road in a limited time.

The long jump: get the longest jumps along the track and end up with a nice long jump in a lake (no water wings provided)

The off-road tree slalom: no road this time, just ride as fast as you can through the forest and try to avoid trees. You may get an artistic bonus anyway if you make a nice crash

Planning and platforms

The game will first be released in a free to play version for PC/Mac/Linux. Free to play and free to win. You will not be disadvantaged in the game if you do not buy it. (We are gamers too, and we hate pay to win games).

An alpha version is already downloadable and playable on the game site

Gold accounts will be available for 5 euros which will give acces to a lot all the customization elements for the bikes and characters.

The full version will be achieved within 3 months – 1 year according to funding goal reached and number of employees

According to the funds raised there may also be an Android (Ouya), an IOS, and possibly on XBLA, PSN and WII-U (e-shop) versions

 Gold accounts will be valid for all platforms (You won't have to pay another 5 euros if you want to play on another paltform)

Be part of the decision process

 Gold accounts will also allow you to vote for the next developped features during the game development


Follow the development live

And learn how video games are made.

We will allow you to follow the game development closely giving you access to development versions, planning, tasks lists, and explain to you many of the secrets of the game development through videos and web pages dedicated to the “making of” of the game.

For the cause


Making games is our passion. Nowadays the game industry is splitting into 2  types of developers:

Blockbuster companies with hundreds of employees, tens of millions $ budgets, making sequels of successfull titles, but taking few risks to be original.

And indie developpers with no money but a lot of passion.

The first year of this project was made with no budget at all, just on our free time with free softwares. But to improve the quality and the content of this game we need a little money now. We do not want and do not expect to be billionaires with this game. We just want to make a good game, and we swear we will not sell it to Facebook once it is finished.

If this game makes any profits, we will give 50% to research against cancer because it is a stupid disease that should not exists, and use the rest to develop new cool games.


Goals

The final content of the game will be determined according to the funds raised. But funders will have the right to vote the features they want to be developped

 The minimum content will be for each goal. But we will do our best to add the maximum content at each goal.

10 000 euros

3 characters 3 bikes 5 headgears 1 environment 1 song

40 000 euros

5 characters 5 bikes 10 helmets 2 environments 2 songs

60 000 euros

IOS and Android versions

8 characters 8 bikes 20 helmets 3 environments 3 songs

100 000 euros

10 characters 10 bikes 30 helmets 20 customizable parts 5 environments 5 songs + crab hunt + long jump + tree slalom

200 000 euros

Playable trikes (3 wheels)

300 000 euros

Playable roadster (4 wheels)

400 000 euros

Add traffic cars on the roads

500 000 euros

XBLA, PSN, WII-U versions

600 000 euros

Build and share your tracks with a Map editor

750 000 euros

Power ups game mode (M... Kart  mode!)

 

How your money will be spent

 

$1000->$10000 Manufacturing and shipping funder’s rewards

$1500 Unity pro software License

$1500 Unity IOS Pro License

$1500 Unity Android Pro License

$35000 Unity XBLA License

$35000 Unity PSN License

$3000 X-Box 360 development kit

$3000 Playstation 3 development kit

$3000 Wii-U development kit

$1000 Macintosh development computer

$1000 IPhone and Android test devices

$3900 3ds max software license

$1000 Music softwares and plugins.

$1000 Sound data bases

$200 Sound recording material

$100 Steam green light submission fee

 

20% Taxes (French VAT)

4% Indiegogo

3% Payment processing fees (credit card + dollar -> euro change)

 

2000$ Administration and accounting

50$/month Servers for lobby leaderboard and maps

 

Net Salaries 2000$ (Salary cost=4000$).

 

How your money will not be spent

 

PC Computers (we already have)

Editor (22% of a classic game)

Retailer (23.4% of a classic game)

Wholesaler (12% of a classic game)

Manufacturing (3% of a classic game)

Endless (useless) hierarchy

Studio recording

Local rental (we work at home)

 

How you can help us without money

Test the demo, give us your feedback. Talk about the project to your friends, link it, share it, tweet it, facebook it, greenlight it with only 4 clicks.

story:
An authoritative source for game content

We all know iMDB when it comes down to movies. A lot of people, including us, have wondered why an authoritative database like this does not exist for games. It's 2013 now, and we think it's time for a database that contains every single bit of information about every game that will or has been released.

Let us introduce ourselves: we are Vaai, a Dutch internet company founded in 2007. We love creating fluid and beautiful web experiences. Besides that, our passion is gaming. We think it's the second best way to blow off some steam. ;)

With your help we can create the ultimate game database with information about released and upcoming games. Gamebase will be the iMDB for games. 

 

Features

We have planned the following features:

  • Users can add and edit games and game details
  • Users can add and edit people and company pages
  • Users can rate and review games
  • Users can personalize the homepage
  • Users can post on the forums (per game)
  • Users can create and maintain a watch list, have list and completed list
  • The database can be searched in many, many ways:
    • by name, platform, genre, company, characters and persons
    • by popularity, anticipation, rating, most completed, etc.
  • Users can earn badges (gamification)
  • Users can sync their game list with Steam, Xbox Live and PSN
  • And many, many more...

That's nice and all, but come on, do you need a whopping $100,000 for that?

Yes and no. As developing a website like this has been our dream for years, we will definitely make it come true. But we know it's a lot of work. The more money you pledge, the more features we can add and the faster we can make it happen. So, what do we do when you contribute?

$ 0
We cry.

$ 15,000 - 29,999
We will work full time on a basic version of the website with two developers and two designers. This basic version includes the database and the editing possibilities.

$ 29,999 - 39,999
We will expand the team and add support for videos, reviews, forums and moderators.

$ 40,000 - 49,999
We will expand the team and add support for synchronization and gamification.

$ 50,000 - 50,099
We will celebrate with sushi and Japanese beers.

$ 50,100 - 99,999
We will expand the team and create an Android, iPhone, iPad and Windows Phone app and we will work on features requested by the community.

$ 100,000+
We faint. And we will make sure that the site and the apps will be completely ad free, forever.

Let's go! :)

We're excited to get started on this ambitious project! And we're one hundred percent sure that with your help we can make this happen. We hope you like our perks, but of course you can also contribute by spreading the word!

story:
Serenity Online is a text-based fantasy game that takes place in a mystical Kingdom known as Zuelia. The kingdom of Zuelia has known peace for as long as its history has been recorded; however, recently there has been a dispute from within the rankings. From this quarrel grew two separate clans; those who still follow loyally under the King’s name – the Shams, and those who have torn apart from the ways of peace and choose to follow the rebellion – the Qamar.

These two factions are now engaged in a growing war within the Goddess Serene’s land and the weight of this war might very well depend on you- the people of her land! Hone your skills in weaponry, crafting, and even magic! Join the world of Serenity and fight for the cause you believe in!

Players can expect:

  • An epic storyline following the war of Zuelia and the Gods/Goddesses of Serenity
  • Unique weapons and armor
  • Multiple crafting systems and professions
  • Side quests to collect crystals and improve your skills
  • A marriage system
  • Dungeons
  • Server wide boss-fights
  • Buying your own house
  • Personal shops
  • Pet system
  • Team up with others to take down stronger opponents
  • And so much more in the making!

Serenity will be a browser-based game that requires no download! You will be able to party up with friends and engage in this wondrous journey together in this textual fantasy right after registering your account! The game will be able to be played under two different themes – Sun or Moon!! Choose or change your theme at any time to fit your mood or personality of your character!

You may see the current page here to sign up for updates - http://www.serenitygame.zzl.org/


My name is Katya, but I prefer to be called Kat. I am 18 years old and I have had the dream of making a video game for 5 years now. My background in computer is limited to Java, PHP, MySql, and basic HTML and CSS.

I hope to expand my knowledge through this game and future games to come and start my own gaming company.

 

My knowledge in art and web design is limited, so I am looking to hire the following people with this budget:

  • $1000+ = Character Art (characters, monsters, dungeons, icons, all and any art for the website.
  • $2000 = Website Logo and template (three different website templates)
  • $500 = Storyline and quest-line content. I plan to pay hourly, less than ten hours a week for someone that's $10-20 /hour.

My future goals include the following:

  • Including more features based on the wants and suggestions of the user
  • Coding an iphone & android app for mobile game play
  • Possibly implementing 3D elements, still with no download!
  • Creating a facebook game app with 3D elements

Please help me reach the $2000 mark so I can pay my workers! Any amount is extremely appreciated <3 Also, please share this with your friends on facebook, twitter, tumblr, instagram, myspace, anything possible! You can also use the Indiegogo share tools :)

Come join our Facebook Page! https://www.facebook.com/SerenityGame

Thank you so much!

You can check the gallery and updates for images of current progress.
Current Progress: Sorting through job applications for artists.

story:
AVAILABLE NOW AT JOURNAL29.COM
 

Journal 29 is a unique book game where you can solve riddles and submit your answers online to get the keys and move forward in the story. To solve the riddles, you need to think out of the box.

You can write, draw, search, tear paper, fold pages, combine different methods and try to get those riddles right. Journal 29 is a 140 pages book providing over 60 riddles you can solve.

A top secret excavation did not bring any result for 28 weeks.
It was on the 29th week that something unexpected happened.
The team disappeared and the only thing that was left behind was their Journal.
You must solve the riddles in order to solve the mystery.

Journal 29 is a book game of riddles.
In order to play, you will need:
A copy of Journal 29
A pencil
An internet connected device ( preferably a smartphone)

Every two pages of Journal 29 have two elements: The riddle page and the key page.

Step1:  You solve the riddle on the riddle page.
Step2:  Visit the URL from the key page (you can type the URL on your browser or scan the unique QR code available on the page).
Step3:  Submit the answer of the riddle. If you answer correctly, you will get a key that is usually a word or a number.
Step4:  Write down the key. These keys will be needed to solve the next riddles.

To solve the riddles you will need to think out of the box.
Use proper apparatus to write, draw, search, tear paper, fold pages, combine and more.
You don't need any special app to play the game. Just a browser will do (preferably on your smartphone).

The idea behind Journal 29 is to create a game of riddles that you can play by using your imagination and enjoy the experience of interacting with a real book at the same time.

You can write, draw, fold and use different techniques to make the Journal29 a unique experience.

By submitting your answer online and collecting keys, we wish to solve 2 basic issues that often come up with an interactive book. First, we make sure that your answer is correct before you continue in the game.
Second, the player cannot skip pages of the game due to the requirement of the online keys in order to solve the next riddles.

Solve the riddle on the right page (check the hints).
Visit Journal29/t/ to submit your answer.

 Dimitris Chassapakis - Game designer

Dimitris is the creator of several riddle games as well as the creator of the none* game  ( whatisnone.com ) that is a very successful game with riddles for iOS and Android.



 

Journal 29 book specs:

Dimensions: 5.5" x 8.5" (13.97 x 21.59 cm)
Pages: 140
Riddles: 60+
Keys: 60+

 

 5$
Thank you
A thank you email from the team and your name on Journal 29 website credits page.

17$
A copy of Journal29 book
A copy of Journal 29 book + your name on Journal 29 website credits page.

50$
A copy of Journal 29 book + Silver Credits
A copy of Journal 29 book + your name on Journal29 website credits page + your name on Journal29 book silver credits page.

100$
A copy of Journal 29 book +Golden Credits
A copy of Journal book + your name on Journal 29 website credits page + your name on Journal 29 book golden credits page.

January 2016
Launch Journal 29 website (journal29.com )

February 2017
Shipping the Indiegogo perks Journal 29 books

February 2017 (end)
Launch Journal 29 Forum

April 2017
Public launch of Journal 29

 

 

FAQ

 

Is Journal29 a real book?

Yes. Journal29 is a real, physical book.

 

Do I need a special app to play?

No, You will only need a device connected to the internet and a web browser

 

What can I do if I cannot solve a riddle?

There will be an extended online hint system and also a riddle discussion on Journal29 forum.

 

Will there be an ebook version?

No. Many of the riddles of Journal29 need a physical paper in order to be solved.

 

Can I skip a riddle page? Play, for example, the last riddle first?

No. The keys you receive online from solving the riddles are essential to play the next riddles.

 

Do I need to buy anything else to play?

No. You will only need a copy of Journal29.

 

In what language is the Journal29 written?

English.

story:
Overview

The Antigony game will be a pay to play platform where players' funds will go into a combined pool. At the end of the day, the funds in the pool are redistributed to the players based on their score and ranking in completing the day's puzzles. This means they can win up to 5 times the playing fee of €1. In addition, there will be a daily grand prize winner taking 0.5% of the pool which can be thousands. Winners will then be eligible to a potential TV version of the game currently in development with Dutch television networks.

We have developed the concept and the platform, and we're now looking to raise 50,000 Euro to cover launch and marketing costs and offering very favourable revenue sharing opportunities for our initial investors (See Perks).


Our Technological and Intellectual Property Assets

Antigony is a simple yet innovative word game based on riddles and antonyms, but it allows something unique: Skill-based competition with cash winnings. Not fixed winnings, but winnings paid out according to performance relative to other players, even in a single player game.

This is made possible by Creative Minds’ DPS (Dynamic Pool System) platform which tightly integrates the game’s scoring elements, funding, and payouts resulting in a powerful framework capable of dynamically assigning and shifting payouts based on scores, odds, rankings and even relational parameters. All this while respecting the boundaries of the funding pool and the company’s earning requirements.

We developed this system to allow the automatic creation of a pool of funds by grouping together all the individual players’ participation fees, and dynamically ranking the players, with no possibility of duplicate positions, and then allocating exponential payouts based on each player’s ranking that will total out to the exact amount of the pool, minus the company’s take. This no matter the scores, no matter the funds, and no matter the number of players.


So while the innovative and addictive gameplay of our initial game, Antigony, is the key to our immediate success, its underlaying platform is what ensures we can continue to provide unique skill- and chance-based games in the future. We will also be licensing the technology and even create an API so that other developers can host their games on our platform in a modular fashion.


Miscellaneous

Project Timeline

Our current target is to set up a Beta test launch on March 1st 2015 with a formal soft launch on March 15th. A marketing blitz will coincide with the hard launch of the game site on April 1st.

Marketing

To maximize demographic targeting, we will focus our initial marketing on print word game publications, challenging traditional word game players to compete with each other. This media has the added benefit of being highly cost effective with very low advertising fees and long exposure times.

A planned future development is the creation of an Antigony TV programme (discussions with networks are already underway) that would obtain its participants from the top performers of the online game. This would obviously represent enormous and highly effective publicity and further incentivise the playing of the online game.

Earning Projections

Our current initial forecast is to sign up about 45,000 users (in a market of over 8 million word game players) in the first month of operation - April 2015 - through an initial advertising and marketing blitz to be paid by this campaign. Subsequent income will be reinvested towards additional marketing through which we believe we can sign up an additional 250,000 users by the end of the year with a 50% daily play rate. This would represent gross income of approximately €500k by December 2015. 

We will continue to co-develop the television concept for Antigony which will be offered free of charge to TV networks but should push Antigony online play to well over 1,000,000 players as TV contestants will be selected from the online game's winners.



For more information visit our launch sites antigonygame.com (English) or antigony.nl (Dutch) where you will find more details as well as the possibility to contact us for more in-depth details (NDA required). Alternatively, write us at invest@antigony.nl.

story:
A full motion video space adventure

Hello reader, we are Studio Spektar, creators of Viktor, a Steampunk Adventure. We are a very small indie game development team comprised of artists and enthusiasts, bringing you a live action video game. It’s a space adventure! It’s a resource management survival sim! It’s the biggest technological breakthrough that the 1990s had to offer! It’s like Oregon Trail, but like a SF film! It’s a movie, but also a video game! Play it while watching and watch while playing! Just don’t watch while watching, or play while playing, so you don’t hurt your eyes.

 

General Horse is the last surviving military postman in the galaxy. After the great war with the Chaotics™, pretty much everyone else was dead. There was nothing left for him, but to take the highest position left in the military.

On his journey to deliver the mail, he meets scavengers who try to steal his package. His duty, as a Postmaster General, is to protect what he considers to be sacred; and that is a package with an official post stamp. It needs to be delivered wherever it needs to be delivered!

Join him on a dangerous voyage throughout his home solar system. He will fight, explore, barter, scavenge, and beg, just to deliver a package he knows nothing about!

Be General Horse and deliver the Package of Doom!

 

The experience we intend to bring you requires a huge number of recorded and edited movie scenes, so here is where you come in. If you pledge your support to us, you won’t just get cool presents; you will also help us deliver a heckton of encounters for a diverse gaming experience and great replayability!

Gameplay demonstration!

For everyone who isn't sure how this thing is supposed to be played :)

 

What We Need & What You Get

The money will go towards being able to invest the next 6 months needed to create this project, music, software licenses and covering all the costs involved with creating and publishing a video game and movie.

 

And for you, dear contributor, we have some wonderful and very limited merch or behind-the-scenes secret information, and if that is not enough, you will have an opportunity to name something like a planet or a spaceship from the game, or even become one of the characters!!! Previous knowledge of the English language or acting skills could come in handy, but are far from mandatory.

So don’t delay, pledge now, and be one of the first people to reap the benefits of our exciting new project.

 

Risks & Challenges

No game development is without its risks and challenges. Honestly, one of us could die, which would definitely set the project back for some time. Other than that, this ain’t our first rodeo. We’ve already made a successful commercial video game, Viktor, a Steampunk Adventure. Go ahead, buy it and try it out, we’ll wait… Did you like it? Good. Now feel free to pledge your support for General Horse and the Package of Doom.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If financial support is not possible, you can always tell your friends about General Horse and the Package of Doom. You can share this campaign on your favorite social network. You can also tell people about us at gaming sessions, in the pub, at mass, the usual. Show the trailer to people you think might like it!

 

And, as always, follow us on Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram :)

 

See you in space, cowfolk!

PaintballGame.com and SocialPaintball are creating a NEW paintball game for the PC/MAC + iPad/iPhone!

 

DONATE AND GET 1 TIME ONLY DOUBLE CREDITS !!

IF YOU DONATE, we will post YOUR NAME on our FACEBOOK ACCOUNT !

 

You can make this happen !

Play our BETA: http://paintballgame.com/webplayer


We need an extra 10.000 dollar to release it on the iPad/iPhone and remove bugs.

 

Money use:

$ 1000 Engine Mobile Gaming license iOS.

$ 3000 Building the game from PC to iOS (including modeling, scripting etc).

$ 2500 Development to finish-up the game (Bugs, testing, recoding).

$ 800 Webplayer version on Mac/PC loading time within seconds !

$ 500 Servers in USA/Europe/ASIA for the next months.

$ 750 Add military levels (Day Sunset Night)

$ 1100 Create SUP'AIR paintball levels and playing modes (PSP, Capture the FLAG).

$ 350 Music licenses for all platforms.

story:
Working Demo :

ANDROID:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.ronggowisnu.tcoh1

WINDOWS :
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/18092757/hokamlo/APPS/HokamloBeta004.zip

MAC :
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/18092757/hokamlo/APPS/HokamloMACBeta004.app.zip

IOS : will never accept demo version for public (only development)

Update :

App has been tested successfully on both Android and iOS 8(iPhone 6) - special thanks to Dan Grubbs.

Short Summary

I'm Ronggowisnu from Indonesia, and this campaign is about a game app that I am making for mobile devices (currently available for android on google playstore but not yet on iOS).

The story of the game takes place in a fictional universe, visitors from other planets who came to the planet of Arcapada. The visitors mainly poses them selves as gods due to the advance technology they have, some does not come physically, only their soul went down to Arcapada and become one with Arcapadians. Mostly these visitors are there to help and build to direct the Arcapadians not to destroy each other as they done so in the past.

The game is basically a "point & tap" where you have to solve the puzzle inside a room and move on to the next. All graphics, animations, story, concept and music are created by me. For this demo I spent about more than a month to create, 2D animation is not so easy, and doing everything by your self is also not so easy, specially when I have other work to be done.

This game may also be my "jump start" to create a small indie game development team. This campaign is for completing the "Episode Zero", the 1st chapter of the HoKamLo saga that I have created. If successful, I may not need to have another campaign like this one.

The good news? A demo version is available on Google Play Store :)
You can download and try it out, if you feel this game should be completed please help me out.
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.ronggowisnu.tcoh1

iOS version can happen as well, because I developed this using Unity3D which can export to multiple platforms. Unfortunately I do not have an iOS device, but if funded, I will get one and make it as the development test device.

What I Need & What You Get

I need $10.000, yes that much. That amount can really make me concentrate on this project without worrying other things, test devices (iOS), bills, or hire a helping hand since I have the demo on my own (quite a headache), and might lead to my own small indie game company.

I don't have much in return of your help, I am a musician, arranger and a guitarist. In 2012 I created an instrumental rock guitar album with my friends which leads me to this game (with the same name:HoKamLo), I can only offer you this album as a digital download for donators. The story of the album inspires me a lot to do this game.

The Impact

With the $10.000, a lot of things may happen, for sure, this game will be completed a lot sooner (Estimated 3 Months, more or less), with great quality, graphics, game play, interactivity and music. More playable characters and animations, scenery, this game started on a "scifi" style but HoKamLo will walk on an ancient land of Arcapada.

This Episode Zero, however, will consist the minimum of 10 parts (demo is only 1 part). All in the space ship, the main characters must solve all the puzzles and mysteries.

The game it self is a "free" game, perhaps when it is completed or I can manage a new Episode app, it will not be free.

Risks & Challenges

I don't consider my self to be the best marketer or campaigner, so there is a chance that the $10.000 might not goal, I have very little help in this matter. Either way, I will keep updating the game even the goal is not reached, completion may take longer. I will use what I have and what you have donated to the development of this game even if goal is not reached.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can share this game on your social networks :) give ratings on Playstore or appstore(once I am able to develop for iOS).
Here is the facebook page :
https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Chronicles-of-Hokamlo/776790485719684?ref=hl

story:
Short Summary

The focus of this campaign:

  • Hire an artist to convert my initial sketches into higher quality that matches the style used in the programming elements

What We Need & What You Get

Producing a book that covers so much is not an easy feat. It's very time consuming, and requires many skills, such as: project management, programming, formatting, web design, etc.

The Impact

Releasing a book on the process of making an RPG will benefit a lot of people, and hopefully encourage more people to enter the world of indie game making.

Risks & Challenges

I currently have 6 books out on the process of making games in GameMaker: Studio.

I certainly have the skills to attempt, and complete a project as large as this.

More Info On The Project

Here is a download in PDF of a draft of the first part of the book.

The project title is the RPG island.

The premise for this one is that a girl whom lives in a windmill goes to the beach on a hot a sunny day, hires a boat, gets caught in a storm. Her boat sinks and she wakes up on an island run by pirates. She then needs to raise enough cash to get passage off of the island.

The book consists of 40 elements, and 20 design notes, being:

Story

- Plot (the plot of the story)

- Character Design (design of characters used by the story)

- Enemy Design (the design of non-character enemies "nameless minions")

- Objectives (the goals upon which the player must complete to advance the story)

- Setting (will include general theme for graphics)

Aesthetics

- Art-Style (what style of art the game is going to be using)

- Character separation (how the player sprite is going to be drawn, using single or multiple layoured sprites)

- Scening (how story progression is going to be implemented in the game (this is usually done by the use of cut-scenes)

- Sound Design (which basic sound effects the game will need, footsteps can be used for a more serious tone and etc.)

- View (from which angle is the player seeing the game world, first person, top down, third person, etc)

Core Game-Play

- Battle (the main provider of challenge in the game, Pac-Man's battle aspect is the avoidance of the ghost creatures)

- Ending (how the player can achieve Game Over. By dying, completing certain objects or finishing the story)

- Exploration (how players will travel the game world, by exploration or level select screens)

- Messaging (how players will receive information from the game, also dialogue)

- Scoring (how the scoring system of the game will work, this is also used to plan for XP in RPG games)

Extended Game-Play

- Collectables (these include secondary objectives that will be used to enhance the game's lifespan)

- Management (this includes inventory, items and power ups that the player can use to increase game depth)

- Mini-Games (such as the lock-picking games that many games now use)

- Quirks (unique or strange game-play mechanics that you want to use to make your game stand out from the others)

- Saving (saving and loading of game files to extend game life by allowing the player to enjoy multiple sit adventures)

It also covers the design & programming of the following elements;

  • Alert Text Effect
  • Battle System
  • Boss Characters
  • Branching Story Line
  • Coin System With Shop
  • Cut-scenes
  • Depth Based Graphics
  • Dialogue Variants
  • Downloading Bonus Levels From Website
  • Drivable Vehicles
  • Enemy Path Finding
  • Foot Steps Sounds
  • Graphical HUD
  • Hint & Tips System
  • HP / XP System
  • Info Speech Bubble Pop Up
  • Interactive / Changing Speech System
  • Interactive Characters
  • Inventory System
  • Invincibility
  • Mini Quests
  • Minions
  • Multiple Game Endings
  • Multiple Locations
  • Procedural Map Generation
  • Positional Audio Effects
  • Puzzle Rooms
  • Quirks
  • Re-spawn Points
  • Room Transition Effects
  • Saving
  • Secret Areas
  • Shader Effects
  • Smoke / Fire Particle Effect
  • Spell Casting
  • Telegraphing
  • Unlock-able Doors
  • Use-able /Interactable Objects
  • Weapon / Clothing Upgrades
  • Zoom In/Out Graphical Effects

For clarity and accessibility, each element has it's own separate chapter and resource files.

Here is some of my original artwork:

 

Below is the style of I'll be replacing it with:

As you can see, better artwork makes all the difference.

Please check out the perks on offer.

Here is a download in PDF of a draft of the first part of the book.
story_txt:
Short Summary
The focus of this campaign:
Hire an artist to convert my initial sketches into higher quality that matches the style used in the programming elements

What We Need & What You Get
Producing a book that covers so much is not an easy feat. It's very time consuming, and requires many skills, such as: project management, programming, formatting, web design, etc.

The Impact
Releasing a book on the process of making an RPG will benefit a lot of people, and hopefully encourage more people to enter the world of indie game making.

Risks & Challenges
I currently have 6 books out on the process of making games in GameMaker: Studio.
I certainly have the skills to attempt, and complete a project as large as this.

story:
My name is Jaimie Peeters. I’m an Amsterdam based photographer with family of Indonesian descent. I have an idea and I would like to ask for your donation in order to help realize this project. “The Innocence of Indonesia Project.”

It is my goal to start a journey in Bali and visit several orphanages, schools, and drug rehabilitation centers on Bali, Java and Lombok. With the assistance of local authorities and agencies I’ll try to go deeper and visit the children on the streets to see where and how they live. I want to learn the cause of their situation and the battles they have to fight on a daily basis. My journey will start on August 1st and I will stay for at least 2 months, but longer if budget allows me to.

Drugs, Poverty, Corruption and Pedophilia are reoccurring themes in Indonesia but it seems that the capitalistic comforts of the western world blind us from acknowledging the consequences of our way of living. I want to be the eyes of our consciousness, to see and capture the truth of the current state of our next generation. A generation that has to pick up where we left off.

The goal is to photograph portraits of these children, to document their lives and their domiciles. These images will be shared with you on this blog along with my personal reports of my visits and the stories of the children I meet.

For this journey I need approximately 3500 euro for a 2 month stay. The budget will be spent on flights, shots, local traveling, accommodation, food, hiring guides and contributions to orphanages for their volunteering programs.

After my journey I will gather the most beautiful images and create a wall-calendar that everybody can buy for just a couple of euros, a book that I would like to see published and an exhibition where art collectors can buy a unique and one of a kind framed print. The proceeds of these sales will be donated to the orphanages, clinics and schools that I have visited.

Please help me realize this project, so we can let these children be heard and seen in our world today.

story:
What Is It?

If you enjoy Love Letter or Coup, you'll love City Of Thieves! It's a fast and furious game for two players, and fits in a neat little travel pouch so you can take it with you and play anywhere! Like, perhaps on your lunch break, or in line to see The Hobbit: There And Back Again (hey, it's never too early to start the line!)

What's it like?

Set in a Robert E. Howard's "Conan"-style fantasy world, and in the spirit of fiction like Robert Asprin's "Thieves' World", City Of Thieves puts you and your friend (or worst enemy, or cat, it's up to you) in the role of rival thieves vying for a single coveted spot in the thieves' guild. You'll roll three dice, and re-roll to match pairs (sorta like Yahtzee but without record books and slide rules) in order to break into the most secure areas of the castle and steal priceless treasure. You can increase your profit by matching items like swords and crowns, and even fetch premium prices by working back alley deals in the black market. Your opponent will never know until it's too late!

Best of all, these actions take place using a relatively small deck of cards and just three dice, so there's no need to setup stacks of cards across a huge board or spend half the game with your nose in the manual. The rules are intuitive and easy to learn, yet complex enough to allow for clever strategy at every turn.

In the end, whoever has made the most profit is officially inducted into the thieves guild!

(The loser... uh, let's just say you might want to avoid drinking out of the east well.)

 

But I have Monopoly, why do I need this game too?

City Of Thieves is designed to be compact, easy to learn and fast to play, but with enough strategic decisions to keep it fun and addictive. It's a game you can throw in your bag, purse or pocket and play in a small area. Each game takes around 45 minutes or less, with special "short game" rules for an even quicker version that skips the dice rolls.

Plus, you'll never get to snag your opponent on a trip wire or peg them with a poison dart in Monopoly. Just sayin'.

 

What do I get, and when?

For $15, you will get the complete 36-card deck with 3 dice, instructions and a carrying pouch, and every copy of the game sold on this campaign will be signed and numbered.

If the campaign makes its goal, I will be working with an indie level manufacturer to produce and deliver the games in bulk to me, and I will promptly mail them out to you. But even if only a few copies are sold, don't worry: you will still get the game! In this case the manufacturing will go through a print-on-demand service, with no noticeable loss in quality. Either way, the process will take a few weeks from the end of the campaign.

This project is designed for quick turn around so, whether the campaign is a success or not, we can all be playing City Of Thieves right away!

 

What about special perks?

Contribute $45 or more and get one of our sweet Board Games - It's How I Roll t-shirts with a modest "City Of Thieves" logo on the back, in any combination of mens' or womens' in three colors! 

Contribute more and you can get your name listed on the instructions sheet in the "Thieves Guild Roster - The Deadly Ten" or, at the top tier, even become one of the characters with your face emblazoned on a "Black Market" card as a merchant!

 

Who are you and why are you doing all this!?

My name is Stacy Davidson and I'm a filmmaker and computer game designer. I've always loved card and board games. When I worked for Origin (I.E. Electronic Arts), I had endless fun playing prototype board games with my coworkers. Since then I've become addicted to shows like On Board Games, Board Games With Scott and The Dice Tower. 

I enjoy all kinds of games, but what I really dig are short, compact travel games I can play during downtime, waiting in line, etc. I also connect best with games featuring deep theme and setting too, so I wouldn't want to sacrifice that. City Of Thieves is my first venture into the card & board game world, and if it's successful and people enjoy it, I plan to release a series of fun little games like this over the next few years, each with a balance of chance and strategy, and a rich and intriguing fantasy or sci-fi theme so you can take fun and adventure wherever you go!

Thanks for your support!

story:
Vielen vielen vielen Dank schon an dieser Stelle für die großartige Unterstützung!


Was passiert, wenn die 500€ erreicht sind?

Die Kampagne geht auf jeden Fall so weiter, wie davor und die Coins gibts auch noch.

Neue Sherlock-Fälle in München

Wenn dir meine bisherigen 2 Fälle gefallen haben, bist du herzlich eingeladen mich bei zukünftigen Projekten zu unterstützen! Aktuell arbeite ich am dritten Fall. Je nachdem wie euer Interesse für weitere Fälle ist, reichen die Mittel auch für mehr als nur einen Fall. 

Was passiert mit meiner Spende?

Das Geld wird natürlich zu 100% für Materialen wie Elektroniken oder Stationen eingesetzt. Das Geocaching-Hobby soll hiermit auf keinen Fall kommerziell werden. Ich will keinen Gewinn aus der Sache ziehen, sondern nur etwas die Kosten decken.

    Bisherige Fälle

    Bisher gibt es 2 Sherlock-Wherigo-Caches von mir:

    http://coord.info/GC4ND9A

    http://coord.info/GC4XY52

    Falls ich bei den bestehenden Fällen etwas erneuern muss, freue ich mich auch über die Unterstützung!

      Was habe ich davon?

      Natürlich bin ich jedem unendlich dankbar für seine Unterstützung! Außerdem wer mehr als 25€ spendet, bekommt von mir am Ende der Kampagne einen Sherlock Geocoin geschenkt, der offiziell über Geocaching.com trackbar ist!


        Ich freue mich über jede Unterstützung!!

        Euer Oberinspektor Rooney

story:
KITU stands for Knowledge, Imagination, Time & Us! We believe imagination is key, values are important and fun content for your kids is a REAL GIFT you can give. We believe that with our stories your kids can be: INSPIRED, HAVE THEIR EYES, EARS & MINDS OPEN to other cultures; and will be encouraged to make their own NEW DISCOVERIES.

THE NEED

We are working on our first bilingual story where one of our characters, Amanda, travels to the Amazons and learns about nature and diversity. It is intended for children ages 4 to 10 with animated chapters and interactive games: puzzles, memory, matching, discover the word, and story comprehension at 3 different levels. 

WE NEED YOUR HELP to finish the digitalization, voiceovers, and the launching of our marketing  campaign. 

If we pass our GOAL we will be able to make MORE stories and games. OUR DREAM would be to release at least one NEW story per month. And in the near future create a forum where parents and children can share what they have learned or imagined. 

PLEASE JOIN & SUPPORT US BY:

1) Pledging 2) Spreading the word on our campaign 3) Posting on Facebook  4) Tweeting (You can find me at @d_arredondo) YOU CAN REALLY HELP US use technology to INSPIRE & EMPOWER children and their families.

OUR TEAM

Kitu Kids is made by a team of believers. Knowing that our stories can help children and parents makes us a determined and a positive bunch that wants to share this content out into the world. 

Daniela Arredondo de Kehoe, founder & CEO is the mother of two boys. Her sister Barbara has been a great partner in dreams. Our illustrator and IT Team are highly experienced and 

Our Board of Advisors: Scott Noppe-Brandon former Director of the Lincoln Center Institute, and one of the leading voices in imagination, author of “Imagination First”, Cameron Sinclair, co-founder & CEO of Architecture for Humanity, peace activist Yuka Saionji, Deputy Chairperson of Byakko Shinko Kai, Cesar Bocanegra COO of DonorsChoose.org, Mayra Hernandez founder Impacto MH, Reggie Kyle, Juan Manuel Trujillo and Cecelia Dempsey. Some other friends have helped us on this journey and to them we say Thank You! We are close to making it!

story:
Useful Links

DustEdge

Sweet Hunter Official Site

Sweet Hunter Trial

 

DustEdge Introduction

DustEdge is an indie game developer who develops html 5 games and hopefully will bring the game to android and ios market. His dream is to become an fantastic game developer not only on the indie side. DustEdge has already created one game called "Please Save Me!" It is a free game which has already been published on chrome web store. Later it will be published on kongregate. ios and Android version will also be released later this year.

Sweet Hunter Introduction

One day, black evil comes to the world. A little guy found he has a special power on the day evil came.. Evil killed lots of people, but for some reason he could not kill this little guy. From that day, this little guy was called Sweet Hunter. He's finding the way to kill the evil and also looking for who he is.


What is the current stage?

We have already finished training level with some basic graphics which tells you how to play that game. The mechanism of this game is fantastic, but there is still lots of further improvements. Right now, Sweet Hunter could jump, move left and right, become bigger, crash the floor, then we will add melee attack in the future.

 

 

 

What’s next?

There will be more levels to be added. At least 4 more levels, more enemies and we will redesign the graphic in training level to make it consistent with the feeling of the game.

 

Why we need funding?Unique Perks

We need fund to purchase the full license of the design tool. Also we probably need to hire someone in charge of graphics. We will buy some royalty music which fits into our game.

Unique Perks

For people suppurts us,a big thank to them. Also we get some more for people who contribute more, the following will be in the perk lists repectively

1. A PC version of Sweet Hunter

2. An html version of "Please Save Me!"

4. Sweet Hunter Digital copy of Art Book

5. An NPC will be named after you

6. Credits your name on our website.

7.a digital copy of 1280X1024 promote image of Sweet Hunter

Release Date 

Our target release date is at the end of September 2012

There will be more levels to be added. At least 4 more levels, more enemies and we will redesign the graphic in training level to make it consistent with the feeling of the game.

 
Why we need funding?Unique Perks
We need fund to purchase the full license of the design tool. Also we probably need to hire someone in charge of graphics. We will buy some royalty music which fits into our game.
Unique Perks
For people suppurts us,a big thank to them. Also we get some more for people who contribute more, the following will be in the perk lists repectively
1. A PC version of Sweet Hunter
2. An html version of "Please Save Me!"
4. Sweet Hunter Digital copy of Art Book
5. An NPC will be named after you
6. Credits your name on our website.
7.a digital copy of 1280X1024 promote image of Sweet Hunter
Release Date 
Our target release date is at the end of September 2012

story:
UPDATE #1: Animation update

This is the level of animation detail that's going to be in the final game if the campaign is successful:

Please contribute! :)

 

Story

Hi, my name is Igor and I'm a graphic artist and animator ;)

Resistance Wars is a game which prototype came to life in a 48-hour game jam here in our town. It was great fun to work with 4 skilled programmers and a 3D artist, without whom I couldn't have made the prototype of the game.



But when I went back to daily life, I felt I still wanted to finish the game. Not only because of all the effort I put into creating the characters and story, but also because this game could be incredibly fun after it was finished. And there's nothing similar in existence that I can go and pretend I am playing Resistance Wars... u_u

The problem is, the programmers are going to be too busy from now on to be working on the project. Since I created the gameplay concept, backstory, music and characters, I decided to move along with the game and try to get it made (with their consent, of course, as long as their name is in the credits, which is more than fair ;).


And where better than IndieGoGo to try to raise funds to hire a programmer who could help me finish this indie game? Everything you see in the video was created in under 48 hours (roughly 36). So if you'd like to play this game in its full glory and have exclusive rewards, become a backer, and tell all your friends about it :)

Gameplay

Resistance Wars is what I call an assymetric multiplayer arcade tetrical shooter. What?? Wait, I'll explain: two players each control one of the two characters and they have to shoot down the tower in the center, which is controlled by a third player, who in turn can rotate the walls that are falling like tetris pieces around the tower to protect itself. (that's why it's called assymmetric, because not all players have the same experience)

To make things more interesting, the tower has a shield around its core that can be toggled red or blue, and each character has a color for his shots, red or blue. If the shield is the same color than the shot that hits it, the tower takes no damage.

If the countdown reaches zero and the tower is still standing, the tower wins. If the tower is destroyed before countdown reaches zero, the players win.

And all three players play on the same keyboard, which is a lot of fun. If the game gets made, I think you and your friends will get a kick out of it!

 

Play the prototype here 

 

Goal

Most of these were in the original plan, but could not be made in the given time. With funds from you backers, we will:

- Improve balancing (with help from our beta testers)

- Implement a death ray for the tower, or chain lightning, that will make it more fun to play as the tower. Another tower feature to improve is the shield.

- Improve character animation

- Increase tower's difficulty and arsenal, "boss-changer"-style (like in games in which the boss has different forms, and each is harder than the previous)

- Reveal the story of the Resistance (in the ending of the game)

- PVP: If the tower is destroyed, players can choose to battle each other or not. This was in the original plan and ties in with the story - their planets are at war but they are also brothers, and in the end the players decide which will prevail.

- Suggestions are more than welcome!

 

Stretch goals

- 3000: Add online support

- 5000: Add more players and characters, thus expanding the storyline and universe.

Thank you

For all those who decide to back this project, a BIG thank you. Your support is not only important to get this project made, but it's also proving that pushing boundaries in a game production, even if really small, is definitely worth trying.

- Igor

_________________________________

 

UPDATE #1: Animation update

This is the level of animation detail that's going to be in the final game if the campaign is successful:

 

UPDATE #2: T-shirts

This is the look of the exclusive t-shirt for the backers of this campaign!

___________________

Original team:

Camilla Slot Kristensen
Gustav Dahl
Igor Noronha
Martin Erik Lange
Mathias Søholm
Mads Johansen

story:
WHO  WE  ARE

The Courage Games celebrates the service and sacrifice of the men and women of the U.S. Armed Forces through sports participation and competition. Uniting Veterans, Reservists, Guardsmen, Active Duty, and civilians through sport, the Courage Games develops camaraderie and the chance to dance in the end zone when the game is won; an entertaining way to get or stay fit and learn and affirm some life lessons along the way. 

In conjunction with the Empire State Sports Foundation and the Tulsa and Gainesville Sports Commissions , the Courage Games turns the life altering experience of these men and women into a life affirming experience through team and individual sports.  The Courage Games will start this September in Rochester, NY and in Tulsa, OK and finish in October in Gainesville, FL. The Courage Games will expand to other communities across America following the inaugural year.

WHAT  WE  NEED

We need to raise $180,000 ($60,000 per city) to conduct the event. Expenses include:

  • travel assistance for participants (Veterans, Reservists, Guardsmen, and Active Duty)
  • sports equipment
  • venues
  • officials/referees 
  • medals and trophies 
  • food service
  • participant apparel
  • etc.

IMPACT 

Camaraderie

With all of the technology in use by people today, it becomes quite easy to put oneself into a self imposed “solitary confinement”.  Face-to-face conversations and socialization are replaced by texting, tweeting, and social networking.  This is a huge adjustment for many of America’s war fighters returning home to their families and friends.  They relied on team work to accomplish their mission. Team sports keep the ancient ability of speaking to others alive and is a great way to practice this dying art.  

Individual

The best way to speak to a person’s head is through the heart, which sounds like a worn-out adage, but is so true. The Courage Games provides the service members with LSD (not the hallucinogen), but Long Steady Distance.  Exercise has a whole range of biochemical benefits to an individual’s well-being and behavior. Some of these chemicals can literally rebuild the brain. 

Citizenship

America is the "Land of the Free" because of the brave.  Members of the Armed Forces represent less than 2% of the population and many Americans do not know anyone in uniform.  The Courage Games will provide the opportunity for the 98% to meet and participate alongside that 2%.

Science & Medicine

The Courage Games will also sponsor two symposiums focused on Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) and Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) to provide updates for medical providers. The PTSD/TBI:2012 symposia in Rochester and Gainesville will spotlight the escalating presence, as well as the causes, research, and technological advances that encompass the treatment of PTSD and TBI, both in the military and civilian populations.

OTHER  WAYS  TO  HELP

Times are tough and maybe you just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Sign up to compete
  • Spread the word and make some noise about the Courage Games.
  • Become a fan on the Courage Games Facebook page

story:
The Unlikely Starfighter

 We have over forty years of gaming experience between us. Whether that be playing games or working in the retail environment, selling, educating, maintaining regular customers and managing. As we watched big box stores trend towards neglecting the main demographic for video games in favour of hoping they will sell themselves we saw the opportunity to bring something to the nerd community.

Our campaign is about bringing The Unlikely Starfighter Video Games and Collectibles to life. We want to create a place people can go to play and discuss games without worry. Both of us are extremely passionate about games and really any other piece of nerd culture we can get our hands on. To be able to create the spot where people can make new memories or even new friends over their favorite games would mean the world to both of us.

By donating to our campaign you will help us make this place a reality and bring it to you. The goal is to open The Unlikely Starfighter Video Games and Collectibles and have it become your game store. A no prejudice center of nerdom where you can hang out, play in a tournament (card games, board games, video games and other) buy, sell and trade or discuss even the oldest of rivalries (looking at you Star Wars vs Star Trek). We want to make a place that will become rooted within the community and with the gamer in all of us.

What We Need & What You Get

We are here to raise $25,000 for our start up. This will go towards such things as 

  1. Inventory.
  2. Cabinets and cases.
  3. Store use items (TV, cash register, computer etc.)
  4. Location expenses and government fees.

As for perks anyone who donates $1.00 - $24.99 will receive a founders membership with the store which means they will have an account with us from day one, free admission to the first tournament of their choosing, and personal thanks by email from the both of us.

Donations of $25.00 - $44.99 will receive a founders membership and account with the store, free admission to the tournament of their choosing, a personal thanks by email plus 100 points will be added to their account to be used as a 5% discount.

Donations of $45.00 - $79.99 will receive a founders membership and account with the store, free admission to the first tournament of their choosing, a personal thanks by email plus 250 points will be added to their account for a 10% discount.

Donations of $80.00 and up will receive a founders membership and account with the store, free admission to the first tournament of their choosing, a personal thanks by email plus 500 points will be added to their account for a 15% discount.

Perks will not stack or combine. If at one time you donate a little but later decide to donate more you will receive the perk that covers the amount of your total donation.

If we do not reach our goal, which is always a possibility, we will still be moving forward with the donations we receive to get the store off the ground.

Final Word

We could not be more excited to be at this point in the process and to be including the community along the way. We believe we can create a place people want, not just to purchase video games and collectibles but to appreciate the art, interactivity and culture of gaming. The video game industry is growing, we have the ability to grow with it and create something that can encompass so much more then just taped up glasses and rolling the counter over on asteroids.

Whether you donate or not, if you are a gamer help us spread the word. Like, link, share, tweet and scream while flailing your arms. Our Facebook page is located here ==> The Unlikely Starfighter and is already filling up with local nerds. We will also share information about any events or public outings that will happen during the course of the campaign on the Facebook page so be sure to follow.

story:
“In 2010, Canadians placed nearly 114 million orders while shopping online, averaging about 10 orders per person. Orders totalled $15.3 billion, with an average value of $1,362 per person per year. When paying for purchases, 89% of shoppers used a credit card online, and 31% used an online payment service”

What about the people without a Credit Card?

If even the 11% of online shoppers were missed because they did not have a credit card that is a loss of nearly $465 MILLION to our economy.

CardJive is setting to revolutionize not only how people shop online but also how credit cards work entirely.

I am asking for help to assist with the development of CardJive and the creation of the Iphone and Android Application as well to cover the design and development of the Website and a corporate office location to create a new way to shop, a new way to pay and a way for everyone to be able to easily purchase goods and services online.

Short Summary

CardJive is a completely digital Credit Card solution that can be used by anyone. In conjunction with all major banks and payment gateways CardJive will be the only card people need to shop online.

  • Sign up and order your digital card at CardJive.com
  • You will instantly receive your fully digital credit card number and in a separate email you will receive your unique 4 digit pin (Personal Identification Number)
  • Decide to use your bank, or PayPal or any other payment gateway in the world including Western Union to charge your number for online use
  • Find the items or services you want to purchase and enter your number and pin and you will instantly be charged the appropriate amount from your online account
  • When you no longer need the card, just stop using it or cancel it online. No waste and no worry of lost or stolen cards.
  • You will be the only person with your unique pin number and you have to enter that on our website in your account to authorize the transaction.
  • No Pin = No Charge.
  • No Card = No Loss
  • No Credit Check = Everyone is able to shop online

This is the way it should have been done in the beginning however oftentimes the simplest answer is the one most overlooked.

Everyone, Everywhere, can have a CardJive Account

  • Think of what that means for retailers and service providers online!

The Impact

Starting with the loss of millions of disposed prepaid credit cards from our landfills and trash disposal sites and then on to the fact that anyone can have an account and everyone can now shop online – Safely and with NO impact to the environment.

I am asking for assistance to make this dream a reality and to change the face of online shopping all over the world. All proceeds both now and forever from CardJive will be donated to my charity, The Care About Us Canada Foundation to help end poverty and homelessness in Canada and soon all over the world.
