story:
Thanks to everyone who gave to the campaign. Much of these funds have already been used to pay contractors and to purchase technology, so you will soon see the benefits in the progress of the game. Be sure to follow us on our Facebook page.



" Take the addictive qualities of puzzle games like Bejeweled and Candy Crush, and add in a little more action." Austin Chronicle



This is Matt from indie studio Part Time Evil, LLC with some fun news about our new game for iPhone, iPad, Android, and more!

To sum up why we're excited: it's puzzle gameplay meets American football action meets role playing game elements.

I grew up playing the classic RPGs like Phantasy Star, Final Fantasy, and even older ones I could find used, like Bard's Tale. Some of the coolest parts of football, like improving your players and your team, are very similar to an RPG. In Puzzle Football, there are several key RPG elements:

  • Choose a set of power cards to take into each game, like magic spells in an RPG.
  • Level-up your team to take on stronger teams in cooler stadiums!
  • Level-up your players through strategic gameplay.
  • Earn new Equipment that makes players more powerful. Equip this on players.
  • Before each match, choose the best players, teams, and power cards.

Just like in fantasy football, sometime you want to play football without making a character run around. Puzzle Football is all about the desire to get cool objects and use football strategy.

Help Kids Stay Active

We are donating 5% of this campaign to NFL Play 60 program (specifically, to physical fitness and after-school programs) to help kids stay active. We benefitted from active lifestyles as kids, and we think it's important to give back so all kids have this opportunity.

Hardcore football fans can use football tactics to build the strongest team for a matchup, and to make the right play at the right time.

Puzzle fans who may not know football well are able to enjoy the fast-paced puzzle action.




  • Choose the right players for the game. Get them equipped with the gear that works best. Choose a deck of powercards.
  • Decide your best strategy for the play, and try to collect those tiles. For example, if it's 3rd and 10, you probably want to pass. 
  • Balance the playcalling with the team maintenance. Tiles aren't just for making plays! You need to maintain your line of scrimmage, or you will get dominated! A team with no control over the line of scrimmage loses energy and performs poorly!
  • Call a play after you get the tiles. Touch the right player to make him do what he does best: pass, long pass, or run!
  • Use power cards strategically. Just like a magic spell, these things need to recharge!




As of now, we plan to make 20 players for the launch. Players are made in vivid pixel art!

Your team carries a set amount of players. Depending on the matchup, you need to choose the right players. As you can imagine, this really depends on who you are playing, their roster, and their style of play. This is inspired by our love for battle-type card games.



Power cards boost your powers or allow you to do tricks in the game. They are comparable to magic cards in a tabletop game, or magic spells in an RPG video game. Except here, they will affect football powers!

Up the accuracy of your quarterback, freeze all the opponent's tiles for a turn, turn all run tiles into pass tiles to form a pass play....and many, many more! These cards are collectable and unlockable; the farther you progress, the cooler the cards.


Play against your friends in a turn-based game. Right now, we are planning on single player and network turn-based (for friends that are in different cities). Pass-and-play is in our plan if we receive enough funding (great mode for car trips and hanging out with friends).


Glossy football cards. Stay tuned, as well will preview a new one every few days.


A secret, special player that you will receive a code to unlock. 

This player CANNOT be earned or bought by anyone who does not give to the campaign.  It is exclusive.

We will give you a special code to unlock this team. Imagine how cool it will be to play your friends with a team they can't have!

This team CANNOT be earned or bought by anyone who does not give to the campaign.  It is exclusive.

Includes the SECRET PLAYER reward.

NAME A TEAM! We will put up a private survey of ONLY the people who pick this reward. This select group will each get a nomination for a new team name (and city!) and then the group will vote on it. Do you know of a city that deserves a pro team. Here's your chance!

We only censor it for copyrights and ratings. 

Includes Secret Team Reward and Secret Player Reward.

Play the game before anyone, and give your input to make it what you want.

We want your ideas, since you're a member of the team. Get super early access to the game. Tell us what your wishes for the game are, and we'll consider all of them and use them to make the best game! Limited availability!

You and ONLY you, get to name a character! Name it after yourself, your dog, or your best friend! Of course, we will approve it, so don't get any crazy ideas!

And More!

There's a complete list of rewards to the right. ->

Stay tuned for frequent updates on rewards!


Core Goals

RPG RPG RPG! We have the swiping gameplay and the play logic working well at a prototype level, but what REALLY takes the time is the RPG progression. That's the part we're passionate about, and it's also the most time consuming. 

FOOTBALL TEAMS : We want to make 5-10 of these, with their own personalities and cool pixel art logos!

EQUIPMENT: We plan for about 40-50 awesome items that can be equipped: titanium helmets, leather gloves, unobtanium shoes...you name it! These all need to be balanced in stats.

POWER CARDS: Power cards are my favorite part of the game. They are like casting spells in an RPG, and discovering them is what drives me in this game. We plan to ship with about 15 of these. 

PLAYERS: We not only have the cool pixel art humans, but we are planning on CRAZY players, like pirates, zombies, and robots. We figure, if we're already mixing football with a puzzle game, why not get crazy!

FULL QUEST PROGRESSION:  I grew up with RPGs, and it's always fun to have an end to strive for. You will be able collect new items, discover new players, and "beat" parts of the game.

Hall of Fame Goals

Any money we raise above the core goal will be 100% used to make this game even sweeter. We outline our proposed plan below, so you know what to expect!  


Our team members (some of them are secret so we can't use their names) have worked on hit games like Darksiders, MechAssault 2, Area 51, and UFC Undisputed for major studios and publishers including Midway, THQ, Microsoft, and EA.

Not only do we have the track record in the console game industry, but we finish what we start in indie, too! We successfully funded and delivered our rewards for our first indie title on another crowdfunding site that shall not be named. Now we're happy to be here on Indiegogo for Puzzle Football! And we are happy to offer even better perks this time around!


The game has a playable front end right now, as you can see. However, a game like this gets its magic from having a deep progression, balanced stats, and LOTS of custom characters, teams, and equipment. 

In addition, we still need to program the networked multiplayer aspects. 

If you follow video games, you will notice that the goals of this project are much lower than the cost of making the game. 

Besides the fact that we need to be funded to finish the game, we are doing the campaign to get feedback and ideas from the community. After all, you'll be the ones playing it!

So thanks for your contribution!


Email us team@PartTimeEvil.com, or simply answer this survey.


Share, share, share!  If you can't give right now, post this link on Facebok and Twitter. That will help us stay visible on the site. Here's a quick twitter-sized chunk, ready for posting on either network:

Check out Puzzle Football, a new video game mixing football, RPG, and puzzle gaming! http://igg.me/at/PuzzleFootball #crowdfunding #indiegames
story_txt:
Thanks to everyone who gave to the campaign. Much of these funds have already been used to pay contractors and to purchase technology, so you will soon see the benefits in the progress of the game. Be sure to follow us on our Facebook page.




" Take the addictive qualities of puzzle games like Bejeweled and Candy Crush, and add in a little more action." Austin Chronicle


This is Matt from indie studio Part Time Evil, LLC with some fun news about our new game for iPhone, iPad, Android, and more!








To sum up why we're excited: it's puzzle gameplay meets American football action meets role playing game elements.
I grew up playing the classic RPGs like Phantasy Star, Final Fantasy, and even older ones I could find used, like Bard's Tale. Some of the coolest parts of football, like improving your players and your team, are very similar to an RPG. In Puzzle Football, there are several key RPG elements:

Choose a set of power cards to take into each game, like magic spells in an RPG.

Level-up your team to take on stronger teams in cooler stadiums!

Level-up your players through strategic gameplay.
Earn new Equipment that makes players more powerful. Equip this on players.
Before each match, choose the best players, teams, and power cards.

Just like in fantasy football, sometime you want to play football without making a character run around. Puzzle Football is all about the desire to get cool objects and use football strategy.
Help Kids Stay Active
We are donating 5% of this campaign to NFL Play 60 program (specifically, to physical fitness and after-school programs) to help kids stay active. We benefitted from active lifestyles as kids, and we think it's important to give back so all kids have this opportunity.

Hardcore football fans can use football tactics to build the strongest team for a matchup, and to make the right play at the right time.
Puzzle fans who may not know football well are able to enjoy the fast-paced puzzle action.










Choose the right players for the game. Get them equipped with the gear that works best. Choose a deck of powercards.

Decide your best strategy for the play, and try to collect those tiles. For example, if it's 3rd and 10, you probably want to pass. 

Balance the playcalling with the team maintenance. Tiles aren't just for making plays! You need to maintain your line of scrimmage, or you will get dominated! A team with no control over the line of scrimmage loses energy and performs poorly!

Call a play after you get the tiles. Touch the right player to make him do what he does best: pass, long pass, or run!

Use power cards strategically. Just like a magic spell, these things need to recharge!











As of now, we plan to make 20 players for the launch. Players are made in vivid pixel art!
Your team carries a set amount of players. Depending on the matchup, you need to choose the right players. As you can imagine, this really depends on who you are playing, their roster, and their style of play. This is inspired by our love for battle-type card games.





Power cards boost your powers or allow you to do tricks in the game. They are comparable to magic cards in a tabletop game, or magic spells in an RPG video game. Except here, they will affect football powers!
Up the accuracy of your quarterback, freeze all the opponent's tiles for a turn, turn all run tiles into pass tiles to form a pass play....and many, many more! These cards are collectable and unlockable; the farther you progress, the cooler the cards.

Play against your friends in a turn-based game. Right now, we are planning on single player and network turn-based (for friends that are in different cities). Pass-and-play is in our plan if we receive enough funding (great mode for car trips and hanging out with friends).















Glossy football cards. Stay tuned, as well will preview a new one every few days.









A secret, special player that you will receive a code to unlock. 
This player CANNOT be earned or bought by anyone who does not give to the campaign.  It is exclusive.




We will give you a special code to unlock this team. Imagine how cool it will be to play your friends with a team they can't have!
This team CANNOT be earned or bought by anyone who does not give to the campaign.  It is exclusive.
Includes the SECRET PLAYER reward.



NAME A TEAM! We will put up a private survey of ONLY the people who pick this reward. This select group will each get a nomination for a new team name (and city!) and then the group will vote on it. Do you know of a city that deserves a pro team. Here's your chance!
We only censor it for copyrights and ratings. 
Includes Secret Team Reward and Secret Player Reward.


Play the game before anyone, and give your input to make it what you want.
We want your ideas, since you're a member of the team. Get super early access to the game. Tell us what your wishes for the game are, and we'll consider all of them and use them to make the best game! Limited availability!



You and ONLY you, get to name a character! Name it after yourself, your dog, or your best friend! Of course, we will approve it, so don't get any crazy ideas!
And More!



There's a complete list of rewards to the right. ->
Stay tuned for frequent updates on rewards!

PLAYERS: We not only have the cool pixel art humans, but we are planning on CRAZY players, like pirates, zombies, and robots. We figure, if we're already mixing football with a puzzle game, why not get crazy!

Hall of Fame Goals

Our team members (some of them are secret so we can't use their names) have worked on hit games like Darksiders, MechAssault 2, Area 51, and UFC Undisputed for major studios and publishers including Midway, THQ, Microsoft, and EA.
Not only do we have the track record in the console game industry, but we finish what we start in indie, too! We successfully funded and delivered our rewards for our first indie title on another crowdfunding site that shall not be named. Now we're happy to be here on Indiegogo for Puzzle Football! story:
Update 7/13/14: The Funding Campaign has concluded, with the primary goal and stretch goal successfully funded, a nice boost in advertising power received. WOOT!

Congratulations all! We can't express in words how appreciative we are of all of your support. It is recognition of the community and developer coming together to do what ever it takes to improve and grow WWII Online, and that is simply AWESOME!

Equipped with your backing from this initiative, we will march towards the objective of getting on Steam. There are many goals in between to achieve none the less, such as warm ups with general releases and which will shake the dust off and make our Steam release much more successful.

However, the buck doesn't stop here when it comes to ways you can help improve your game by backing the team. Each of you can make a profound difference in our ability to acquire assets and resources (staffing, hardware, software, etc) by adding just a few more dollars if you're able to per month.

For full details on how you can continue to make a serious difference for WWII Online and receive recognition for doing so, please review the hero program located [ HERE ].
From all of us Rats, thank you for believing in the game as strongly as we do. Remember that an active subscription (every one of them) count tremendously, to learn more about that read [ Life at Rat HQ ] by DOC.
S!
------------------------------------------------------------------------

All NEW funds go into advertising

Advertising Funds Raised: $510.00 or 2,550 players!

All funds collected beyond the stretch goal ($14,500) will directly be added to our marketing and advertising to bring more players into the game.

These funds will become apart of our search engine pay-per-click campaign(s) designed to very effectively reach our target demographic. 

  • $10 generates 100 clicks
  • 50% of those clicks turns into new sign ups
  • Your $10 results into 50 new players

How many new players would you like to bring to the community? YOUR contributions decide. Examples:

  • $10 generates 50 players
  • $25 generates 125 players
  • $50 generates 250 players
  • $100 generates 500 players

The above data is averages derived from our analytics tracking.


STRETCH GOAL: [ 100% Funded ]

Daily Update 7/11/14: Our stretch goal is 100% funded! This stretch goal funds the Community & Hardware Upgrades area shown beneath this writing.

Community & Hardware Upgrades

We want to roll out some new community upgrades that will provide players more recognition for in-game actions, tools to create game reporting mechanisms to your liking and provide a new strategic web map to follow the World at WAR from your browser anywhere.

Ready for improved server performance? Some of our hardware dates back to 2001 and has thousands of hours of active run time. Funding this stretch goal directly goes into making your game more stable and empowering our development team to work more effectively with better, faster equipment.

  • New toolset enabling the community to build game reporting tools
  • New strategic web map
  • New awards and achievements for Combat Stats 2.0
  • New hardware (virtual machines, memory, storage, etc)
  • Enhanced stability and performance of live game server
  • More effective management of systems infrastructure
  • Fixing free play forum access

|  STRETCH GOAL - TOTAL FUND AMOUNT: $14,500 USD  |

What if we go above the stretch goal, what happens next?

All funds obtained beyond the Stretch Goal will be applied to Marketing and Advertising efforts to bring in MORE players to WWII Online.


Fund the next game update! [100% FUNDED]

We're calling on the WWII Online community to help us complete our very first community funded game update. Successful completion of the goal will result into the following:

  • Creation of a new development test server
  • Deploying a new PC game client
  • Deploying a new MAC game client
  • Create new billing tools to help us manage, introduce and promote new offers in preparation for releasing the game on Steam

Ready to get back to game development? WE ARE TOO! Take a look below to see what we have planned.

What's in the new game update?

These new updates will include DATA files which translate into a quicker turn around time and still have a high impact.

  • ART: Improved weapon textures - crisper, higher detail!
  • SOUND: New infantry weapon and environment audio!
  • H.E. REVISIONS: New high explosive audits means more deadly effects!

Art Improvements

Our Lead Artist "VOLCOL" has done a lot of re-working of existing art to present a really stunning new impression on how these weapons look. These are ready for deployment - RIGHT NOW.

  • Completely new Textures
  • Re-worked UV Layouts
  • Overall higher resolution

CLICK BELOW IMAGE TO SEE ALL NEW WEAPON UPDATES

Sound Improvements

Massive improvements when we're talking about sound and immersion. Listen in on the NEW Bren Lightmachine Gun and MG34 audio. These are ready for deployment - RIGHT NOW.

  • Thompson SMG (UK & US)
  • Lebel Rifle (FR)
  • Mortar fire (All)
  • Luger Pistol (DE)
  • MP40 SMG (DE)
  • And many more!

** NEW BREN GUN SOUND & WEAPON ART ** (Actual ingame footage)


** NEW MG34 FIRING SOUND & WEAPON ART ** (Actual ingame footage).


How is my contribution going to improve the game?

Your contribution is going to give new life to the game. This game update is fundamental to retention of existing players, creating a wave of returning users and improving the experience of new players.

When should we expect the update to be released, once funded?

We estimate that within the next 6 months we'll be able to get this client update released for both the PC and MAC. It's important to note that's an estimate. We have to first create a new dev test server, begin adding this new content into two new builds, test them out thoroughly, then proceed with releasing when ready.

NOTE: We will keep the community briefed with our progress. Our goal is to push it out as soon as possible. This is a conservative estimate to manage expectations.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help make more updates like these possible by becoming a Hero Builder. By upgrading your subscription you are adding more opportunity for us to pay for Staff and Advertising.

  • Learn more about the Hero Builder program (HERE)
  • Upgrade your account and become a Hero (HERE)

We send our greatest thanks to all of our Community members. We're really excited to get back on the path of developing the greatest game ever!

- All of us at Cornered Rat Software

story:
Short Summary

Im an unemployed, single father of 2 great kids. In the past I was a Semi-Professional eSports player, back in the days where there wasnt much money in it. After having a family and several failed jobs I am trying to raise funds to get a computer capable of streaming so I can do it and live off that so i can raise my children by being there for the most possible time.

My gaming portfolio is

2x 1st place National Quake TDM League (Team DoD)

1x European UT TDM Champion (Team ZOi)

1x 2nd place National SC 2v2 (Team TBC)

1x MtG Grand Prix Winner

Several MtG Regional wins

Former DCI referee (MtG)

Former WoW, LoL, DoTA2, CS:S, COD MW2 player


What We Need & What You Get

You might be thinking that 1200€ is a bit much but I live in a Portuguese island with high taxes and transport fares and international online stores wont ship here.
EVERYONE that funds will be mentioned in the first stream i make, doesnt matter how much you funded, then there are the perks that will be implemented in the first day aswell, I will stream EVERY DAY for 2 years for AT LEAST 2 hours a day. On Sundays, 100% of stream donations will go to various animal care institutions.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant contribute feel free to spread the word about it. All help is welcomed

story:
Hi everyone. This is our first game called Shade. It is a PC game. Its multiplayer only FPS game. If we reach our extended goal
29k we also thinking to make Zombies mode. You all know survival zombie mode. Check out trailer for one of the maps. There will be
probably 16 maps like this one you've seen on video. Its fast paced CoD style multiplayer experience. Now we can't do it without
you. We need money for 3D models - sound FX - animations basicly assets to make our game.

What we are going to do with money? We are going to buy 3D models for environment. These models are houses - roads - buildings - humans - animals - vehicles - guns... And after that we are going to buy sounds for environment. Like rain - footstep sounds for each unique place [mud-wood-dirt] - wind - snow - door slam - vehicle sounds - sea - gun sounds [reload-shooting-cocking] - player shoutouts - grunt sounds... We also are going to hire people for modelling - sounds. We are also going to buy soundtracks [main menu-multiplayer-zombies menu-in game] from musicians for game. We need money for release. Hire YouTubers - pay game websites to review our game. We are gonna rent servers - buy web domain. Your money will make us complete each development level.

There will be 16-18 weapons as we planned. Hi-poly models.
We are trying to do our best to achieve good visuals. Also we need money mostly to make a good looking game. A game for you all to enjoy both
gameplay - graphics. Estimated release looks like august 2015. I'm very excited to bring you guys this game. I hope you too after you have seen
the very first map. Actually we wanted to make singleplayer as well but some of you may know it is very hard and takes years. That is why only
studios can do that with this graphics. Thank you all for your support. I'll see you in-game. :)

story:
DOWNLOAD DEMO - v. 0.38 PRE-ALPHA DOWNLOAD

                                             NON-RIFT VERSION DOWNLOAD    (v. 0.25 - OLD)      

   

I want to raise money for a game I'm developing - Battle Rollare. It will be a high speed racing game with multiplayer gameplay, power-ups and insane tracks set inside the world of computers - inspired by Tron and other early depictions of VR environments.

I'd like to see how well can current VR HMDs simulate the sense of speed and this game will attempt to test it thoroughly.


About the game

It will be an arcade racing game, developed in Unity,  with the players piloting a sphere rolling at high speeds on crazy tracks with different segments, i.e. magnetic floors, boosts, loops, tunnels, funnels and more.

Players will compete against human or A.I. opponents using their skill, wits and a rich arsenal of power-ups, including boosts, steering disabler, slows etc..

The aesthetic style I'm aiming for is a minimalistic, yet polished and great looking one, inspired by old depictions of VR environments, like the VR training in the MGS series, or TRON. 
The first moment I've heard of the Oculus Rift I imagined myself playing games that would fit into that style, yet to my own surprise, I haven't seen many titles that would look like that yet, even though it seems very fitting for certain types of experience.

My goal

My goal is to create a game with the support for the Oculus Rift, but make it so it is fun to play even for regular monitor users. There are many titles avaible for the Rift already, but not many of them would be fun to play without the Rift, as the experience is based around it.

In short, I want to create a title that you can get a lot of playtime out of, not just play it for 30 minutes and be done with it and I want to accomplish this with great gameplay first and foremost.

By this, I don't mean to offend anyone in any way, all of the demos and games I've tried so far are all amazing experiences, it's just that I found myself looking for something with a more lasting value.

Funding

I have chosen flexible funding because I want to finish this game, atleast a toned down version of it, even if the campaign doesn't get fully funded - for that I need to afford to extend the Unity Pro license for the duration of the development, however long would it take without the full funding.

I need the funding for the aformentioned Unity licensing, for various assets that I would not be able to produce myself, possibly a quality soundtrack, depending on how my attempts will turn out, Steam Greenlight fee and to be able to leave my current job and spend all my time on development
story_txt:
DOWNLOAD DEMO - v. 0.38 PRE-ALPHA DOWNLOAD                                             NON-RIFT VERSION DOWNLOAD    (v. 0.25 - OLD)         I want to raise money for a game I'm developing - Battle Rollare. It will be a high speed racing game with multiplayer gameplay, power-ups and insane tracks set inside the world of computers - inspired by Tron and other early depictions of VR environments.I'd like to see how well can current VR HMDs simulate the sense of speed and this game will attempt to test it thoroughly.
About the gameIt will be an arcade racing game, developed in Unity,  with the players piloting a sphere rolling at high speeds on crazy tracks with different segments, i.e. magnetic floors, boosts, loops, tunnels, funnels and more.Players will compete against human or A.I. opponents using their skill, wits and a rich arsenal of power-ups, including boosts, steering disabler, slows etc..The aesthetic style I'm aiming for is a minimalistic, yet polished and great looking one, inspired by old depictions of VR environments, like the VR training in the MGS series, or TRON. The first moment I've heard of the Oculus Rift I imagined myself playing games that would fit into that style, yet to my own surprise, I haven't seen many titles that would look like that yet, even though it seems very fitting for certain types of experience.My goalMy goal is to create a game with the support for the Oculus Rift, but make it so it is fun to play even for regular monitor users. There are many titles avaible for the Rift already, but not many of them would be fun to play without the Rift, as the experience is based around it.In short, I want to create a title that you can get a lot of playtime out of, not just play it for 30 minutes and be done with it and I want to accomplish this with great gameplay first and foremost.By this, I don't mean to offend anyone in any way, all of the demos and games I've tried so far are all amazing experiences, it's just that I found myself looking for something with a more lasting value.
Funding
I have chosen flexible funding because I want to finish this game, atleast a toned down version of it, even if the campaign doesn't get fully funded - for that I need to afford to extend the Unity Pro license for the duration of the development, however long would it take without the full funding.
I need the funding for the aformentioned Unity licensing, for various assets that I would not be able to produce myself, possibly a quality soundtrack, depending on how my attempts will turn out, Steam Greenlight fee and to be able to leave my current job and spend all my time on development

story:
Unlockable Perks and More Game Secrets:


Tier #1: The Unicorn Islands has been UNLOCKED!

This offers every player access to these islands, which have different offers of their own compared to the regular game exploration. These islands offer a new Marketplace with new items, a Companion's shop, the Wolf's Pride Colosseum and its daily events to let you test your wolf's skills against other players, The Well of Abundance where you can earn interesting items every Friday depending on how much you donate, and much more!

3 New perks have also been revealed: $8 usd, $15 usd, and $50 usd!


Tier #2:  Mutations and Secrets still is LOCKED!
By unlocking this tier you unlock a whole new aspect of the game currently not set in place. Mutations will offer new coats of your wolves and would be achieved randomly. Most mutations will include changes to the eyes, fur type, and pelt coloration. If your wolf is born with a mutation, you can also guarantee a completely different or slightly different pelt color not available in the normal wolves . There will also be breed specific Mutations and even lethal mutations or mutations which could hinder or excell your wolf in gameplay. 

Other secrets within this Tier will include 2 new perks and the Book of Knowledge. This book will be an in-game feature where you can complete achievements to find out information regarding things like prey and predator strengths and weakness, what to avoid or consume in the wild, explore features, wolf features and mutations, and more.


Explore a Beautiful World and Learn the Way of the Wolf:

From the inspirational mind of Hayley DuBay, comes the idea for a game not only beautiful in appearance, but filled with adventure and challenges. Players will be able to create and raise a pack of fantasy wolves, letting them explore new worlds, hunt, fight, protect their den, craft, and learn the ways of survival. 
Hayley DuBay is the main artist for this online pet SIM browser game. She has been working hard to build a plausible idea that goes beyond the average pet/adventure game. Now she needs your help.

This is more than a pet game, this is where your life through the choices you make for your pack. Are you ready to see how strong you can become?

The New Player - Wolf Selections:


   The Standard = 20 variations

 The Mountain = 14 variations

 The Desert = 9 variations

 The Tundra = 6 variations

 The Veil = 3 variations

 The Nomad = 4 variations

EXPLORATION TIME!

Explore various parts of the available map and see what you discover in the beautiful but strange lands of Conseal'Al. 

This mock-up is a great example of how you might see the explore feature being used within the game itself. Each area is set up so you travel in which ever direction is available. Sometimes traveling long enough in one direction made lead you to something new. Areas of importance will listed at the top. The amount you can travel depends on your wolf's energy and what you decide to do when you come to an event within the map. 


What We Need & What You Get:

The money earned from this campaign goes towards the programmers who put the idea together and make it come to life. Along with other expenses from hosting to business and advertising. This game is meant to keep growing over time, increasing in challenges and adventure.

Every new game runs risks and we are no different. We put in many hours, while working our normal day jobs, to see this game to a finish line. The desire to create a game where members experience the unexpected and need to learn in order to survive and find the answers they seek, has been a long and desired dream. The main idea is create a long term game where the longer you play, the more you gain, from new in-game events to new wolves and new places to explore. Many things are expected to keep you within the game so you are always itching to see what we create next.


The Perks
5$ perk = access to the private facebook page which publishes just about everything related to the game, from designs to future concepts and ideas.


10$ perk = facebook group access and 10 fangs, which are rare in-game currency normally requiring real money to purchase. Fangs are used on premium items and offers within the game's Secret Market. 


30$ perk = You get one of these these lovely wolves added to your pack. The Ardent breed is breedable now but it won't be an easy task. The special thing about this breed now is that it offers you Bone Dust every week day and you can use this dust to buy things in a private market only open on Saturdays.

The Ardent Breed
CLOSED: 100$ perk = create your own breed by working with the artist. This breed will show up in the game like a regular wolf. You won't start out with this breed, but you keep the credits of the initial idea and concept of the breed, though the final design work is owned by the game.



Other Ways You Can Help

Help us by spreading the word! 

- You can sign up to be a beta tester for the game via sending your email address to:

TheSheperd03@gmail.com

Beta testing sign-ups end March 31st

story:
Summary

So after running a Facebook page (this one! https://www.facebook.com/8BitMisdreveaus/?ref=hl)  that has over 5,000 likes (a number I can't even fathom), I feel like I've created a community of nice, generous people. So, what better way to show off how awesome we all are by giving to charity? All proceeds of the stream will go directly to Child's Play. $500 is the minimum I can set the goal to, but I'll do something special in the middle areas too, and on top of that. More information soon!

Let's rock and roll!

What We Need & What You Get

So, let's break this down a little bit for ya:

  • All of the funds are going to Child's Play charity. For more information, visit their website here!
    http://www.childsplaycharity.org/
  • Depending on how much you donate, Robin (that's me!) will do something for you! Look over to the right or scroll down to see some perks!
  • Even if the funds don't hit $500, all the proceeds are still going to charity!

The Impact

So here's what your money will do:

  • 100% of the money (that isn't taken by Indiegogo as a gratuity) will go to Child's Play.
  • They will then take your money to provide video games, books, and other toys to children in hospitals. 
  • Every little bit helps!

But I'm Poor/Don't Like Spending Money!

That's fine! Me too! But here's what you can do:

  • Get the word out! Post it on your Facebook pages, personal or otherwise! Tell yer friends!
  • Share it some other way! Put a poster up at your school, I dunno!

And that's all there is to it.

Rewards

Here's a neat little list of the rewards! In my absurdly minimalist style!

$1 - My Undying Thanks

Your name will be added to a big ol' post on the Facebook page where I thank everyone for donating!

$5 - My Sweet, Sexy Voice

I intend to make a video where I talk about how awesome things went. And I will individually thank you, and on top of that, I want you to give me a line. It could be anything. Then I'll take those lines and make a song outta it and post it on the page!

$10 - Geeettttttt Sprited On

You know those adorable little sprite guys I do? Y'know, these? Yeah, them. I'll make one of you, or your original character, or of whoever. I've been told they're pretty adorable. Lookit it. I want a plush of one. Comes with everything above too!

$20 - I'ma Do A Draw For you


I'll draw a thing for you and send it to you and/or post it on the page. Above is kinda how I draw. You'll also get everything above!

$35 - Stickers Of Our Stupid Faces (And Yours!)

In addition to everything above, you'll get sticks of all five 8-bit Misdreavus admins in sprite form, as well as a sticker of your sprite that I already drew you for the $10 perk!

$50 - I Will Call You On The Phone And Yodel For You

Not really. But in addition to all the shit above, I'll call you on the phone and we can shoot the shit for a little bit. You can ask me questions, or we can just talk like buddies for a little bit. Up to you. Again, in addition to EEEEEEEEVERYTHING above.


$70 - "Dance, puppet, dance!"

So I sing and play guitar and such, though I'm better at one than the other. But if you want me to sing something or try and learn it on guitar, you can do this! Or if you want me to try and make some other kind of video, let me know! And again, includes everything before it. I have a life, so I'm limiting this to three.

story:
Overview

Guardians of Lumen is an Turn-based RPG in a spanning, huge, and dark fantasy infested with gigantic monsters and secrets.

Players will navigate beautiful environments, and confront sinister foes with the aid of the Ay and the mysterious powers they grant as they keep the 9 strongholds safe.

 

 

EDIT***

 As of January 1st, 2021. this game is no longer an Action-RPG and has been converted into a turn-based RPG (akin to the style of classic Final Fantasy games).
This choice was made after quite a lot of thought and testing was done.

Combat now entails two sides. The player controls the leader of their side while an AI controls both the supporting character and the foes.


 

 

 

Key Gameplay Features

  • 20-30 Hour Base Story
  • Quests/ Side stories (133 Planned)
  • Tavern Quests (Endless monster hunts)
  • Explorations and Bunker Puzzles (180 Planned Bunkers)
  • Crafting, Enhancing, Cooking, Repairing (Gear and Weapon management at it's finest)
  • MINIGAMES! (Fishing, Board games and helping around shops)

 

 

 

Meet The Characters

Jiri

 

Introducing Jiri Senex, Heir apparent of her Clan in the Tribe of Mist.

Stoic and to the point, Jiri has grown up in the wastelands and has come to prefer it to the busy and loud nature of the strongholds. Her people are strict and militaristic, with kindness being sidelined for tradition numerous times. This gives her a natural longing for intimacy. She has long silver hair and pale skin. As custom to her tribe, she wears an armour embedded, tight suit which enables her to cloak and hide from both wildlife and monsters. Hanging over her shoulders lays a long trench coat that holds a unique place in her heart.

Few know the true Jiri.

 

 

Scythia

 

Introducing Scythia Opifex, Tinkerer of the highest order.

An optimistic genius of a young mechanic born in the Petram Stronghold. Orphaned as a child, she roamed the streets for a few years before being taken in by a mechanic named Brox Opifex and taking his last name at the age of eight (After interrupting a meeting between Master Quaesitor and Brox). She was seen as a prodigy when it came to engineering machinery and tinkering. She’s a lean girl with messy, red hair tied into a long pony-tail. She wears brass gauntlets and boots that are attached to a power supply strapped around her waist. However, she is absolutely powerless whenever she is offered food.

Few can keep up with the mind of Scythia.

 

 

Dorian

 

Introducing Dorian Seco, Captain of Boletus's New Dragoons.

He is a giant of a man, though not as tall as other Giants. He is also of a broad figure, with brass mechanical legs and shaggy hair. Disciplined and brilliant, Dorian was raised by his hero of a father and a brilliant engineering mother. At a young age, (and talked into it by his lover) he stole an Otobai (Motorcycle) meant for a client for his mother. Taking it outside Boletus, he was attacked by a Horror. Dorian managed to escape the creature (losing his legs and his lover’s life in the process). He was saved by his own unfaltering will and returned to the city.

Few can shake the resolve of Dorian.

 

Afa and Nick

 

Introducing the inseparable duo, Afa And Nickolas Laus.

Living most of their lives in the underbelly of the Sinefine Stronghold, these two thieves amassed quite the following in their quest to survive. Where Afa has the smoothest, silver tongue, Nick has the sharpest aim. He tends to be dressed in simple leather armour, a black undershirt and a green cloak while she prefers to add a red scarf to the look.

Few understand trust like that of Nick and Afa.

 

 

 

The World Of Lumen

 

 

The land of Lumen is, in a word, dark. Giant monsters, Daemons and Horrors, roam the black wastelands while many creatures have adapted away their eyes for more useful senses. None know whether more land exists beyond the waters, for those oceans are rotted to the core, eating away at any that dare touch their murky shores. The sky above is filled with dark, never parting clouds while the land sits nearly barren, requiring much effort to grow even the simplest of plants. Over the centuries, those that survived these harsh environments have created nine strongholds, around naturally defensible areas and anything that shines.

 

Exploration

Exploration is key. Materials are scarce in the strongholds. Should you wish to gather materials and craft or strengthen your weapons or gear, exploring every corner of Lumen will become a necessity. 

To aid you in doing so, mounts, Ay, and character abilities will have to become like second nature.

Furthermore, there are 180 Bunkers in the game.

Bunkers are ancient chambers, remnants of the War of Horrors. The Tribe of Shadows had used them to store treasure and secrets, but with traps and puzzles blocking them off, do you have what it takes to reach their depths?

 

 

The Strongholds:

 

Fullgur

“The first Stronghold”

Built upon the largest Cryst deposit in Lumen. Located in the Northernmost edge of the map, the Giants that live here adapted to the cold weather through technological advancements, as well as plain grit. The stronghold is ancient, still holding the oldest records and the physically strongest military personnel. It is said that the leaders of Pius fear the elders of Fullgur.

 

Boletus

“Empire of the Dragoons”

Founded in the plains where giant, glowing mushrooms light the land. A land of warriors that are indifferent to events outside their domain. The City has tried numerous times to expand their territory but with little success. While they do not oppose the Guardians in any way, few in Boletus share the respect or reverence that the rest of Lumen gives them, instead relying on their Dragoons for protection. A few years before this storyline, Sinefine was annexed by Boletus.  

 

Sinefine

“Fortress of the Undying”

Located in the Southern lowland, around a pit that has been burning for thousands of years. It is said that the best vegetables, meat and Ale comes from Sinefine. When it comes to cooking meals, people from all around Lumen risk the trip to Sinefine to learn from the best. Even the poorest of citizens have the skills of master chefs. To capitalize on this, the government made the hunting grounds and farming lands open for citizen use.

 

Petram

"The Fortress of Flames”.

Perched on the Cliffside over a ravine, and carved out by an endless stream of molten rock. A Stronghold of crafters. Due to easily available heat, the people of Petram are master craftsmen and armourers. Citizens here survive by trading goods for food. This, alongside natural defences, has made it nearly impossible for any to attack this stronghold. Petram's good diplomatic relations with near all others, mixed in with their expertise in forging and weaponry keep the people safe and happy.

 

Inunda

“The Electric City”

Firmly seated in the land of eternal rain and lightning. This city was built near tall, naturally occurring lightning rods. Unlike all but the Deciphers, the Inundrian people are scholars. The city uses both the constant rain and constant lightning strikes to power nearly everything. While they are not as advanced as the Deciphers, this endless stream of electricity has transformed Inunda into a haven for research and discovery.

 

Meridi

“The City of Nature”

Nestled in the tree-tops of the largest forest in Lumen. Giant, tree-like structures illuminate the elf-like city. These people have a deep love for nature. The elders grew up with an elitist mindset, and a seeded racism against the Cinis which created a rift between generations. Their leader is an immortal hailed as their “Goddess”. Due to this belief, however, they have become an isolationist society. They’ve had a bitter relationship with Rupe for years.

 

Rupe

“City of Ore”

Placed at the base of a tall cliff. A glowing ore is commonly found around these lands. For decades, the grand city sat safely in the cliffside, overlooking the south eastern lands as they excavated massive amounts of jewels. Rupe was built on the backs of the poor, and indentured slavery. While the middle and upper classes live the most comfortable lives in Lumen, the lower class is hardly ever seen. They’ve had a bitter relationship with Meridi for decades.

 

Occulta

“The Hidden City”

Hidden away, at the bottom of a giant lake. A grand staircase, surrounded by glass over three meters thick, leads into the city. While the religious aspects of the Deciphers’ order are run from Pius, it is Occulta which houses and employs most of the greater minds. Protected by water on all sides, few outside the order have made it into Occulta.

 

Pius

“The Holy City”

Seated under the one part of the sky that clears at night, once every month. Unlike the other settlements, Pius has no natural defence from the Daemons. Instead, the Light from the two celestial bodies above cuts through the darkness when the clouds part. The grand tower of Asan, the first Decipher, was built under the point where the clouds part.

 

The Mindscapes

 

 

Unique Constructs representing the minds of the citizens of Lumen. Normally lost, or inaccessible to the common folk but, with a little help, open to Guardians. 

When a curse or illness of the mind takes root, there may be a necessity to enter the mind and repair the damage. However, caution must be taken, as the mind does not like the touch of an outsider...

 

Races 

Cinis, Persici, Belua, Giants, Polluit, Ay, Ancient Ones, Horror, Daemons

 

The Cinis, the Persici, and the Giants

 

There are three main races on Lumen; The Cinis, the Persici and the Giants.

While the Persici look lean and vibrant, the Cinis are paler, have pointed ears, and tend to have heightened senses. In turn, they are physically weaker. It is said that the Giants are the result of those who survived the War of Horrors, but became trapped beneath the surface. It is said that the higher concentration of oxygen in the catacombs let them evolve to their new size and might.

 

 

The Belua

 

 

The Belua are shorter, and more beastlike than the other three. They tend to exhibit more child-like behaviour, and are slower when it comes to intelligence. Several have fur, tails, claws and whiskers and nearly all stand at half the height of a Cinis or Persici.



 

The Polluits

The Polluit are constructs, repaired and made to serve the Deciphers (though some of the nobles have managed to buy a few of their own). Most were dug up while excavating Pius Tower. Akin to living machines, they were activated using uncovered technologies from the Ancients Ones. They tend to be little more than autonomous Puppets that obey any order, though they show sentience. Many do not believe them to be truly capable or self sufficient. 

 

 

The Ay

Spirits that live inside of the Crysts. They are semi-intangible and extremely powerful beings. Requiring a host to survive, the Ay strengthens its partners and are key to the Guardians’ success. They come in many different forms and are practically immortal, though, should their host fall, they may be forced back to their Cryst.

The Ay come in two types, the normal Ay, found nearly anywhere in Lumen, and the Great (aka the Grand) Ay that seem to have power over the others.

 

Monsters

Horrors

Beasts of nightmares. They take on several, unnatural and grotesque forms. While some range from the size of a small child or water barrel, some tower over houses and have enough strength to crush a giant in an instant. These beasts thrive in the shadows. However, they are not confined to them.

Many a tale exists of Horrors sneaking into strongholds and preying on the citizens, only to be slain by a capable guard or Guardian of course.

 

Daemons

The true foes to all sentient life in Lumen. Even the smallest of Daemons tower over all and can level settlements with ease. On the surface, they appear to be large beings, with incredibly thick hide and an unnatural need to kill any that wander too close. However, closer examination has lead to some truly frightening discoveries.

First, there appears to be no digestive tract in any known Daemon type. In fact, none of the 12 known types of Daemons have functioning mouths. Their need to kill stems from some imbedded instinct, rather than necessity of self-preservation.

Next, they seem to be deathly frightened of direct light. Upon discovering a light source, the Daemon will either attempt to destroy it or flee.  This, and the innate effectiveness of light-based attacks has lead some Guardians to link the Daemons and the ever clouded sky. Little in the way of proof has surfaced to support such ideas.

Lastly, and most curiously of all, is their total disregard for wildlife and the Belua race. Minor situations have been recorded where one may have trampled over a horde of Vupus or the like, but these stem from a carelessness on either the side and never over territory, food or malice. 

All the research can say for certain is that there remains some secret behind these towering monstrosities. 

 

 

Cryst

The term “Cryst” is, in truth, a misnomer. While these stones appear similar to crystals at a glance, under careful examination, the Deciphers discovered that they lack a true crystallite structure and resemble more of a neural network-esk pattern up close.

But nevertheless, they were named before being studied.

While it is not fully understood how, Crysts power a majority of machinery, devices and weaponry and have made it possible to fight back against the looming threat of the Horrors. The need for Crysts has expanded into nearly every aspect of day-to-day life in Lumen; from heating one’s home, to combat, to simply lighting a room.

The purest of Crysts are called “Guardian class”, and nearly always come with an Ay looming within. Those Crysts are refined, and bound to Guardians-hence the name-to aid them in their ever-continuing fight against the Horrors.

It is curious, however, that no matter the grade or function, Crysts are neither compatible nor react to the Belua race. This leads scholars and the Deciphers to believe that there is some biological link between the Giants, Cinis and Persici that the Belua simply do not have. 

 

Factions

 

Order of the Deciphers

The largest research organization in Lumen. For hundreds of years, the Deciphers have worked tirelessly to uncover the secrets of the Ay and the Ancients.

While originally they started as a small group of historians and archeologists, the Order has grown into an almost religious authority, with philosophy and legends taking the focus away from simple research more often than not.

They are based in Pius but have several cathedrals in multiple Strongholds, and tend to be present for many of the festivals and special occasions taking place throughout the year.

Led by the Pontifex and the 6 Cardinals, the order has made it their mission to find a paradise for the citizens of Lumen.

 

The Guardians

 

Originally a branch of the Deciphers, the Guardians are enhanced warriors that defend the strongholds from Horrors, Daemons and those misguided few that lurk in the shadows.

Each, bound with an Ay, is tasked to aid the people with everything from simple message relays to hunting down towering foes. 

Based in Pius but sworn never to uniformly favor one stronghold or group,  many Guardians become drifters, traveling from one settlement to another in search of trouble that needs settling. While several have criticized the Guardians for being too linked to the Deciphers, few would dare wish for a Lumen without them. 

 

 

The Merchant Guilds

Founded after the Boletus-Sinefine War, the Guilds are an organized group of wealthy nobles and merchants ready to defend each other should the need arise. 

They were created to ensure fair trade among the strongholds, and to hold merchants accountable for all they do.

Several Guild Halls can be found throughout Lumen, though the headquarters is currently situated in Rupe. These are places where merchants can request aid, bargain, or bring up concerns with fellow merchants.

While not perfect, the guilds believe themselves a critical first step in keeping the citizens of Lumen unified and comfortable.

 

The Wanderers

 

 

The 7 Tribes of drifting wanderers that explore and live in the shadows of the wastes live apart from the rest of Lumen.

Each tribe contains many clans and thrive in many different areas.

There are the few the roam the shifting Sandlands or the frozen North while others dwell in the southern swamps, fields or woods.

Then there is the tribe that watches over the secrets of Lumen, The Tribe of Mist.

Cold and calculating to outsiders, but willing to step in when needed, these clans slip out of view and can be impossible to find at times.

 

 

 

Combat*

EDIT** 

This game is NO LONGER an Action RPG, check the start of the campaign for more information

 

Basics

Stats

 Mind: The Mental capability of the Character.

 Body: The Physical Strength of the Character.

Soul: The Strength of the Character's Will and Resolve.

 

 

 

These three qualities are the root of every aspect of a person's character in "Guardians of Lumen" and it's from these three that all the other stats in the game are derived.

 

EDIT** 

This game is NO LONGER an Action RPG, check the start of the campaign for more information

Attacks

Each of the main characters have their own weapon(s) of choice.

Looking at Jiri's Dual Swords for a moment, combat may only begin when her weapons are drawn.

Each Character has their own list of attacks and Chained attacks to be mastered

 

For Jiri she has the following:

  • Light
  • Heavy
  • Light -> Light -> Light
  • Light -> Heavy -> Heavy 
  • Heavy -> Heavy -> Heavy

Should another input be given before her attack is completed, her moves will be chained and a 2nd attack will follow the first.

Each Character has their own list of attacks and Chained attacks to be mastered.

The damage is calculated based on character's strength, elemental modifiers, and weapon strength

Should you forge a better weapon or strengthen the character further, the damage will increase.

 

Elements

The World of Lumen is filled with a unique substance called Cryst that can not only greatly strengthen those that use it but also imbued their weapons with unique elements.

Fire <-> Water

Tera <-> Wind

Electricity <-> Electricity

Light<-> Blight

With the elements in the pair being most effective with each other.

In combat, should you have the opposite element to the element, your damage will be doubled.

Furthermore, should you combine elements, the secondary elements created will have the power of both elements that created it.

By Default, the elemental damage you deal is based on the Cryst imbedded into your character's weapon. 

 

 

Abilities 

Each Character has a unique ability all their own that may help in combat, exploration, or in most cases, both.

In Scythia's case, She has the ability to fly freely in the air.

Be careful though, these abilities cost Cryst Power. Should that power deplete, the ability will be unavailable for a time.

The Ay System

 

(A skill tree of an Ay)

 

 

Ay, the sprites that bind to Guardians, are unique little beings.

Each Ay has a Type;

  • Attack
  • Defence 
  • Speed
  • Exploration

As well as an element.

When activated, the character bound to the Ay will gain a boost to some of their stats and have their element overwritten with that of the Ay. Activating an Ay will also increase the body temperature of the character attached. Should you find yourself freezing in the North, an Ay may be able to aid you.

Each Ay also comes with their own skill tree that slowly expands by completing specific tasks in the overworld. The Ay are beings that love to learn and explore and the more they do, the more they develop.

 

Soundtrack

The OST was entirely created by me (Joseph) from scratch and with little to no formal training. All-in-all, I am pretty proud with how it turned out.

 

Roadmap

 

 

 

May, 23, 2019
Work on this project started

 

Sept, 11, 20
Full-time production of this project started

 

Dec. 1, 20
Indiegogo page went up!


Jan. 11, 21
Story Demo Release

 

Mar, 1, 21
Campaign Rewards Delivered
 

June 15, 21
FULL GAME RELEASE

 

Stretch Goals (& What You Get)

 

Breaking it down for folks in more detail:

$5'200 - Game Is funded
At this level, the game is comfortably funded and should release and keep to schedule. Nothing fancy but it's all we can ask for :D

This money will go into securing the studio space, software/hardware costs, and a small "Just incase" fund that, hopefully, will end up just going back into the project.

per the 7 months ($5’200)
- Secure Access Studio Space ($600)
- Software/ Equipment costs ($100)
- “Just in case” (~$100)
- 5% Indiegogo fees

The Game will, at this point, be released on PC

 

 $18'200 - Hire an Animator
With this amount, not only is the game comfortably funded but there should be enough to hire an animator to help with the polish of character animations. 

3 months ($13’000)
- Hire an Animator ($25/h)

 

 $31'000 - Hire a 2D Artist

With this amount, not only is the game comfortably funded but there should be enough to hire an animator and a 2nd 2D artist to aid with UI and Character art and generally speed up production of the game.

3 months ($13’000)
- Hire a 2D Artist ($25/h)

The Game will, at this point, be released on PC and Switch

 

 $44'000 - Hire a 2nd Modeler
With this amount, along with everything else mentioned, a 2nd modeler with aid in adding more to the characters of the world. At this point, there should be enough members on-board to start adding more secrets to the world and really refining the overall world of Lumen

3 months ($13’000)
- Hire a 3D Character Modeler ($25/h)

 

About Me

 

Greetings :D
I'm Joseph Thamir.

I am a Game Developer based in Canada. I've always been a gamer, I guess. I remember more about the pinball game they had on my grade school computers than the subjects they tried to hammer into me. I love coding (be it in C# or Unreal's blueprints system) and, as humbly as I can put it, I believe I'm pretty good at it. I studied at Durham College for three years as well as took several odd jobs and contract work. I have skills in modelling, rendering, rigging, surfacing, as well as particle effects, but my greatest strength would have to come in as time management. Being skilled would mean nothing if you don't have the time to use those skills, right?
         As a gamer, I'm sadly horrid at shooters and beat-em-ups. Strategy and RPGs are where my heart lies and hopefully, there is where I'll make my mark. First and foremost, I am a story teller, and if I could get my stories out to at least one person, I'd consider the work getting there to be worth it. 

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

-This project WILL get completed. What you are helping with by donating is the speed of the timeline development follows. Whether this project gets completed in a year or, say,  3 depends on the support.

-So far, this has been a one man endeavour. I am skilled, but speed and quality will always be at odds.

-Keeping on top of bugs and unforeseen hindrances. No matter how much one preps and plans, there are certain problems that can creep up without warning.

-Models, characters, soundtracks, level layouts, effects and story need to be finished, polished and tested several times before the project is done.

Either way, if you've reached this far into the company, THANK YOU so much for taking your time and reading this.

Check out the Devlogs leading upto and during development at:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLQ9uQDut...

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.

  • Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign!
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube and spread the word,
story_txt:
Overview
Guardians of Lumen is an Turn-based RPG in a spanning, huge, and dark fantasy infested with gigantic monsters and secrets.
Players will navigate beautiful environments, and confront sinister foes with the aid of the Ay and the mysterious powers they grant as they keep the 9 strongholds safe.
 
 
EDIT***
 As of January 1st, 2021. this game is no longer an Action-RPG and has been converted into a turn-based RPG (akin to the style of classic Final Fantasy games).This choice was made after quite a lot of thought and testing was done.
Combat now entails two sides. The player controls the leader of their side while an AI controls both the supporting character and the foes.

 
 
 
Key Gameplay Features

20-30 Hour Base Story
Quests/ Side stories (133 Planned)
Tavern Quests (Endless monster hunts)
Explorations and Bunker Puzzles (180 Planned Bunkers)
Crafting, Enhancing, Cooking, Repairing (Gear and Weapon management at it's finest)
MINIGAMES! (Fishing, Board games and helping around shops)

 
 
 
Meet The Characters
Jiri
 
Introducing Jiri Senex, Heir apparent of her Clan in the Tribe of Mist.

Stoic and to the point, Jiri has grown up in the wastelands and has come to prefer it to the busy and loud nature of the strongholds. Her people are strict and militaristic, with kindness being sidelined for tradition numerous times. This gives her a natural longing for intimacy. She has long silver hair and pale skin. As custom to her tribe, she wears an armour embedded, tight suit which enables her to cloak and hide from both wildlife and monsters. Hanging over her shoulders lays a long trench coat that holds a unique place in her heart.
Few know the true Jiri.
 
 
Scythia
 
Introducing Scythia Opifex, Tinkerer of the highest order.

An optimistic genius of a young mechanic born in the Petram Stronghold. Orphaned as a child, she roamed the streets for a few years before being taken in by a mechanic named Brox Opifex and taking his last name at the age of eight (After interrupting a meeting between Master Quaesitor and Brox). She was seen as a prodigy when it came to engineering machinery and tinkering. She’s a lean girl with messy, red hair tied into a long pony-tail. She wears brass gauntlets and boots that are attached to a power supply strapped around her waist. However, she is absolutely powerless whenever she is offered food.
Few can keep up with the mind of Scythia.
 
 
Dorian
 
Introducing Dorian Seco, Captain of Boletus's New Dragoons.

He is a giant of a man, though not as tall as other Giants. He is also of a broad figure, with brass mechanical legs and shaggy hair. Disciplined and brilliant, Dorian was raised by his hero of a father and a brilliant engineering mother. At a young age, (and talked into it by his lover) he stole an Otobai (Motorcycle) meant for a client for his mother. Taking it outside Boletus, he was attacked by a Horror. Dorian managed to escape the creature (losing his legs and his lover’s life in the process). He was saved by his own unfaltering will and returned to the city.
Few can shake the resolve of Dorian.
 
Afa and Nick
 
Introducing the inseparable duo, Afa And Nickolas Laus.

Living most of their lives in the underbelly of the Sinefine Stronghold, these two thieves amassed quite the following in their quest to survive. Where Afa has the smoothest, silver tongue, Nick has the sharpest aim. He tends to be dressed in simple leather armour, a black undershirt and a green cloak while she prefers to add a red scarf to the look.
Few understand trust like that of Nick and Afa.
 
 
 
The World Of Lumen
 

 
The land of Lumen is, in a word, dark. Giant monsters, Daemons and Horrors, roam the black wastelands while many creatures have adapted away their eyes for more useful senses. None know whether more land exists beyond the waters, for those oceans are rotted to the core, eating away at any that dare touch their murky shores. The sky above is filled with dark, never parting clouds while the land sits nearly barren, requiring much effort to grow even the simplest of plants. Over the centuries, those that survived these harsh environments have created nine strongholds, around naturally defensible areas and anything that shines.
 
Exploration
Exploration is key. Materials are scarce in the strongholds. Should you wish to gather materials and craft or strengthen your weapons or gear, exploring every corner of Lumen will become a necessity. 
To aid you in doing so, mounts, Ay, and character abilities will have to become like second nature.
Furthermore, there are 180 Bunkers in the game.
Bunkers are ancient chambers, remnants of the War of Horrors. The Tribe of Shadows had used them to store treasure and secrets, but with traps and puzzles blocking them off, do you have what it takes to reach their depths?
 
 
The Strongholds:
 
Fullgur
“The first Stronghold”
Built upon the largest Cryst deposit in Lumen. Located in the Northernmost edge of the map, the Giants that live here adapted to the cold weather through technological advancements, as well as plain grit. The stronghold is ancient, still holding the oldest records and the physically strongest military personnel. It is said that the leaders of Pius fear the elders of Fullgur.
 
Boletus
“Empire of the Dragoons”
Founded in the plains where giant, glowing mushrooms light the land. A land of warriors that are indifferent to events outside their domain. The City has tried numerous times to expand their territory but with little success. While they do not oppose the Guardians in any way, few in Boletus share the respect or reverence that the rest of Lumen gives them, instead relying on their Dragoons for protection. A few years before this storyline, Sinefine was annexed by Boletus.  
 
Sinefine
“Fortress of the Undying”
Located in the Southern lowland, around a pit that has been burning for thousands of years. It is said that the best vegetables, meat and Ale comes from Sinefine. When it comes to cooking meals, people from all around Lumen risk the trip to Sinefine to learn from the best. Even the poorest of citizens have the skills of master chefs. To capitalize on this, the government made the hunting grounds and farming lands open for citizen use.
 
Petram
"The Fortress of Flames”.
Perched on the Cliffside over a ravine, and carved out by an endless stream of molten rock. A Stronghold of crafters. Due to easily available heat, the people of Petram are master craftsmen and armourers. Citizens here survive by trading goods for food. This, alongside natural defences, has made it nearly impossible for any to attack this stronghold. Petram's good diplomatic relations with near all others, mixed in with their expertise in forging and weaponry keep the people safe and happy.
 
Inunda
“The Electric City”
Firmly seated in the land of eternal rain and lightning. This city was built near tall, naturally occurring lightning rods. Unlike all but the Deciphers, the Inundrian people are scholars. The city uses both the constant rain and constant lightning strikes to power nearly everything. While they are not as advanced as the Deciphers, this endless stream of electricity has transformed Inunda into a haven for research and discovery.
 
Meridi
“The City of Nature”
Nestled in the tree-tops of the largest forest in Lumen. Giant, tree-like structures illuminate the elf-like city. These people have a deep love for nature. The elders grew up with an elitist mindset, and a seeded racism against the Cinis which created a rift between generations. Their leader is an immortal hailed as their “Goddess”. Due to this belief, however, they have become an isolationist society. They’ve had a bitter relationship with Rupe for years.
 
Rupe
“City of Ore”
Placed at the base of a tall cliff. A glowing ore is commonly found around these lands. For decades, the grand city sat safely in the cliffside, overlooking the south eastern lands as they excavated massive amounts of jewels. Rupe was built on the backs of the poor, and indentured slavery. While the middle and upper classes live the most comfortable lives in Lumen, the lower class is hardly ever seen. They’ve had a bitter relationship with Meridi for decades.
 
Occulta
“The Hidden City”
Hidden away, at the bottom of a giant lake. A grand staircase, surrounded by glass over three meters thick, leads into the city. While the religious aspects of the Deciphers’ order are run from Pius, it is Occulta which houses and employs most of the greater minds. Protected by water on all sides, few outside the order have made it into Occulta.
 
Pius
“The Holy City”
Seated under the one part of the sky that clears at night, once every month. Unlike the other settlements, Pius has no natural defence from the Daemons. Instead, the Light from the two celestial bodies above cuts through the darkness when the clouds part. The grand tower of Asan, the first Decipher, was built under the point where the clouds part.
 
The Mindscapes

 

 
Unique Constructs representing the minds of the citizens of Lumen. Normally lost, or inaccessible to the common folk but, with a little help, open to Guardians. 
When a curse or illness of the mind takes root, there may be a necessity to enter the mind and repair the damage. However, caution must be taken, as the mind does not like the touch of an outsider...
 
Races 
Cinis, Persici, Belua, Giants, Polluit, Ay, Ancient Ones, Horror, Daemons The Cinis, the Persici, and the Giants There are three main races on Lumen; The Cinis, the Persici and the Giants.
While the Persici look lean and vibrant, the Cinis are paler, have pointed ears, and tend to have heightened senses. In turn, they are physically weaker. It is said that the Giants are the result of those who survived the War of Horrors, but became trapped beneath the surface. It is said that the higher concentration of oxygen in the catacombs let them evolve to their new size and might.
 
 
The Belua
 
 The Belua are shorter, and more beastlike than the other three. They tend to exhibit more child-like behaviour, and are slower when it comes to intelligence. Several have fur, tails, claws and whiskers and nearly all stand at half the height of a Cinis or Persici.
 The Polluits

The Polluit are constructs, repaired and made to serve the Deciphers (though some of the nobles have managed to buy a few of their own). Most were dug up while excavating Pius Tower. Akin to living machines, they were activated using uncovered technologies from the Ancients Ones. They tend to be little more than autonomous Puppets that obey any order, though they show sentience. Many do not believe them to be truly capable or self sufficient. 
 
 
The Ay
Spirits that live inside of the Crysts. They are semi-intangible and extremely powerful beings. Requiring a host to survive, the Ay strengthens its partners and are key to the Guardians’ success. They come in many different forms and are practically immortal, though, should their host fall, they may be forced back to their Cryst.
The Ay come in two types, the normal Ay, found nearly anywhere in Lumen, and the Great (aka the Grand) Ay that seem to have power over the others.
 
Monsters
Horrors

Beasts of nightmares. They take on several, unnatural and grotesque forms. While some range from the size of a small child or water barrel, some tower over houses and have enough strength to crush a giant in an instant. These beasts thrive in the shadows. However, they are not confined to them.
Many a tale exists of Horrors sneaking into strongholds and preying on the citizens, only to be slain by a capable guard or Guardian of course.
 
Daemons

The true foes to all sentient life in Lumen. Even the smallest of Daemons tower over all and can level settlements with ease. On the surface, they appear to be large beings, with incredibly thick hide and an unnatural need to kill any that wander too close. However, closer examination has lead to some truly frightening discoveries.
