Each Ay also comes with their own skill tree that slowly expands by completing specific tasks in the overworld. The Ay are beings that love to learn and explore and the more they do, the more they develop.
 
Soundtrack

The OST was entirely created by me (Joseph) from scratch and with little to no formal training. All-in-all, I am pretty proud with how it turned out.
 
Roadmap
 
 

 
May, 23, 2019Work on this project started
 
Sept, 11, 20Full-time production of this project started
 
Dec. 1, 20Indiegogo page went up!
Jan. 11, 21Story Demo Release
 
Mar, 1, 21Campaign Rewards Delivered 
June 15, 21FULL GAME RELEASE
 

Stretch Goals (& What You Get)
 

Breaking it down for folks in more detail:
$5'200 - Game Is fundedAt this level, the game is comfortably funded and should release and keep to schedule. Nothing fancy but it's all we can ask for :D
This money will go into securing the studio space, software/hardware costs, and a small "Just incase" fund that, hopefully, will end up just going back into the project.
per the 7 months ($5’200) - Secure Access Studio Space ($600)- Software/ Equipment costs ($100)- “Just in case” (~$100)- 5% Indiegogo fees
The Game will, at this point, be released on PC
 
 $18'200 - Hire an AnimatorWith this amount, not only is the game comfortably funded but there should be enough to hire an animator to help with the polish of character animations. 
3 months ($13’000) - Hire an Animator ($25/h)
 
 $31'000 - Hire a 2D Artist
With this amount, not only is the game comfortably funded but there should be enough to hire an animator and a 2nd 2D artist to aid with UI and Character art and generally speed up production of the game.
3 months ($13’000) - Hire a 2D Artist ($25/h)
The Game will, at this point, be released on PC and Switch
 
 $44'000 - Hire a 2nd ModelerWith this amount, along with everything else mentioned, a 2nd modeler with aid in adding more to the characters of the world. At this point, there should be enough members on-board to start adding more secrets to the world and really refining the overall world of Lumen
3 months ($13’000) - Hire a 3D Character Modeler ($25/h)
 

About Me
 
Greetings :DI'm Joseph Thamir.
I am a Game Developer based in Canada. I've always been a gamer, I guess. I remember more about the pinball game they had on my grade school computers than the subjects they tried to hammer into me. I love coding (be it in C# or Unreal's blueprints system) and, as humbly as I can put it, I believe I'm pretty good at it. I studied at Durham College for three years as well as took several odd jobs and contract work. I have skills in modelling, rendering, rigging, surfacing, as well as particle effects, but my greatest strength would have to come in as time management. Being skilled would mean nothing if you don't have the time to use those skills, right?         As a gamer, I'm sadly horrid at shooters and beat-em-ups. Strategy and RPGs are where my heart lies and hopefully, there is where I'll make my mark. First and foremost, I am a story teller, and if I could get my stories out to at least one person, I'd consider the work getting there to be worth it. 
 
 
 

Risks & Challenges
-This project WILL get completed. What you are helping with by donating is the speed of the timeline development follows. Whether this project gets completed in a year or, say,  3 depends on the support.
-So far, this has been a one man endeavour. I am skilled, but speed and quality will always be at odds.
-Keeping on top of bugs and unforeseen hindrances. No matter how much one preps and plans, there are certain problems that can creep up without warning.
-Models, characters, soundtracks, level layouts, effects and story need to be finished, polished and tested several times before the project is done.
Either way, if you've reached this far into the company, THANK YOU so much for taking your time and reading this.
Check out the Devlogs leading upto and during development at:https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLQ9uQDut...

Other Ways You Can Help
 
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.

Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign!
Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube and spread the word,

story:
Here's what you need to know about this project!

I have always loved video games, but what I enjoy more is how they bring people together. Over the past 8 years, I have had the privilege of making hundreds of gaming videos and races, with friends, gaining around 100 million views. Now, I am evolving with the knowledge I learned to create a new era for Versus!

My goal for version 2.0 of my Youtube channel, Versus, is to make a channel that features new shows and videos with higher production value, more interesting ideas, and include new, talented people! In order to do this, I started an event called Versus Expo to bring people together to collaborate and do things much larger than what we can do from home alone over Discord.

This project is important to me because gaming saved my life, and the friends and community I made along the way have given me a new life and purpose that I would have never dreamed of. Through this project, I want to be able to provide a community that works with and cares for one another, and have us all come together for a great charitable cause! 

What is the money that's donated going towards?

In order to pursue some of the ideas I have, I'm going to need some financial assistance. The money donated will go towards: 

  • Equipment; Sound Board, Microphones, Cameras, Speakers, and Lights
  • Wages for editors and artists
  • Hotel and event costs for Versus Expo

If we can't reach our goal, I will still be grateful for the help and continue pursuing these new ideas. Financial assistance will allow me to get there more quickly and efficiently! 

Stretch Goals!

Thanks to your generosity, we reached our base goal! We now have two stretch goals for the campaign!

The first stretch goal is for $7500. If we reach this, I will invest that money into hiring a part time editor to help assist with the workload of future versus content as I move into version 2.0!

The second stretch goal is for $10,000! If we reach this goal, I will begin working towards having VSX be biannual with the second location occuring in the Winter on the west coast in the Los Angles area.

 

What can you receive for donating?

We have several tiers you can donate at, every dollar helps in crowd-funding so everything is appreciated! 

$5 - Special Thanks - Special thanks on the website with your name

$10 - Minecraft Server - You can access our Versus Expo Minecraft server where we'll have organized games and events all weekend!

$25 - Thank you card - I will write you a hand-written thank you note for your contribution

$50 - Exclusive VSX2020 T-shirt

$75 - Private Discord Call - After VSX I will have a Discord call with you for 10-15 minutes to talk about whatever you want, answer questions, and give content creation tips! 

The Impact of Versus Expo will be powerful!

Versus Expo will eventually have the ability to help millions around the world! Here's how!

  • The main focus of the VSX Show is to raise money for charity! Our charity sponsor this year is Save the Children, which improves the lives of children through better education, health care, and economic opportunities, as well as providing emergency aid in natural disasters, war, and other conflicts.
  • This event will give the let's players, streamers, and online gamers a location to build up a strong community by coming together to have a ton of fun, make friends, host a cool event, and raise money for a good cause!
  • We'll potentially provide jobs and opportunities to many within this industry as we continue to grow!

Risks & Challenges

There are a lot of risks and challenges that come with running an event and doing something of this size. Here's some reasons why I'm qualified to pursue this dream!

  • I hosted our first event VSX2019 last year with a minimal budget to prove how dedicated I am to making all of this work. I wanted to prove myself before I asked my audience and the internet for an investment
  • I've been an active part of this community for nearly 9 years now and know the ins and outs of a ton of aspects
  • Hosted Versus panels at PAX East and West to test out ideas in front of crowds
  • Assisted and implemented a lot of ideas at TRG Colosseum, another charity event I assist my friends with.
  • Traveled to and volunteered at several conventions to build up experience and knowledge.
  • Received a degree in electronic media entertainment and took several business courses in college

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, it's okay! There's lots of other ways you can help us on our journey! 

  • Tell your friends, both online and in real life about the event and about what we're doing! Spread the word! 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share our campaign on social media such as Twitter and Facebook.
  • Watch our livestream on July 10 - 12 at http://www.youtube.com/versus

We're having several segments this year where attendees will be able to participate in certain events and races. I do have a few open time slots this year though that I wanted to keep open for submissions! Fill out the following form to submit your idea for a race at VSX2020! https://forms.gle/KyfTzsPx862Uws1H7

VOLUNTEER SIGN UP FORM: Yes! We'll need more volunteers online and on-site! If you're interested, fill out the following form. https://forms.gle/adTAyrHbbRckc35a9

I do have a few open time slots this year though that I wanted to keep open for submissions! Fill out the following form to submit your idea for a race at VSX2020! https://forms.gle/KyfTzsPx862Uws1H7

story:
Preface

Hey, everyone, I am Sergey Lipskiy, the author of GLideN64. GLideN64 is advanced multi-platform open-source graphics plugin for N64 emulators. It uses powerful features of modern GPUs to bring you new level of quality and authenticity of hardware-based emulation on desktops and mobile platforms. The project’s first public version was released in 2015. It became possible after successful campaign here, on Indiegogo, in 2014. Since that time the project lives on GitHub. Current public version released at the end of 2016. Development continues, current work-in-progress builds also available for download on GitHub.

Progress

Since the first release GLideN64 became the most advanced graphics plugin for N64 emulators. Project’s progress never stopped, so it evolved greatly since the first release. The plugin reproduces on modern hardware most of features and capabilities of original console, thus adding authenticity to more and more titles. For example, fixed point arithmetics used by N64 hardware can result in interesting color wrapping effects, which never happen on PC hardware. I added special shaders to emulate that effect in GLideN64 and that changed familiar look of games, which used be be known as fully emulated:


This is just one illustration of hundreds of fixes made during project development.

Another direction for project advance is High Level Emulation (HLE) of games, which either use custom RSP microcode or custom modifications of standard microcodes and thus require Low Level Emulation (LLE) to work correctly. Microcode is microprogram running on programmable Reality Signal Processor (RSP) chip, which handles some audio and most video pre-processing of the N64. Reverse engineering of microcode’s code is necessary for HLE implementation. It is hard task, which not everyone can do. Olivieryuyu, main beta tester of GlideN64, and me have taken this task seriously and together achieved several successful results. First, we added HLE support for “64 de Hakken!! Tamagotchi Minna de Tamagotchi World”. Recently new difficulty level was taken: HLE implementation of T3DUX microcode, used for three games: Last Legion UX, Shin Nihon Pro Wrestling Toukon Road - Brave Spirits and Shin Nihon Pro Wrestling Toukon Road 2 - The Next Generation.

Campaign

There are many directions for project’s further progress. Most of problems, which need to be solved, are hard and require many time for completion. Since I work on the project in my spare time, I don’t have time for all tasks. I have to choose, which task to take next. One of the most ambitious tasks is HLE support for one of the best N64 titles: Star Wars - Rogue Squadron. This game uses custom microcode developed by Factor 5, a well known developer to have some of best game programmers of its time. The only known attempt to make HLE implementation for this microcode was taken many years ago by Lemmy, the author of graphics plugin for Nemu emulator. Lemmy’s implementation is very incomplete: terrain geometry is missing, many texture errors and other glitches. Olivieryuyu investigated the microcode and found that it is probably most complex and definitely largest one. It has a large and complex part of its code dedicated to generate terrain polygons on fly. We started microcode implementation and advanced further than Lemmy: texture mapping is correctly implemented, fog is fixed, simplest part of terrain generation code is implemented too. Currently HLE version of the game looks like this:

We want it to look like this:

I need to implement remained part of microcode and fix various issues with frame buffer emulation in this game. It is hard task, and it would require a huge effort to get it done. I need your support and encouragement to complete it. The campaign is short and has minimal allowed goal. It is not price for completion of this task, since I work for free. It is motivation bonus. If campaign will reach the goal, the task will get top priority. I’ll complete it as soon as possible, taken into account my limited time resources.
 

Plan for Project Completion

The plan is simple. I implement microcode step by step. When all code will be ready, I will fix issues with frame buffer emulation and do other required polishing. Source code will go to master branch, binary build will be released for supported desktop platforms. Update of mobile version usually happens soon after master branch update.

Time-line estimation: I started to work on this microcode in top-priority mode and it took circa a month to reach the current state. Remained part of microcode will take another two month, as it is really complex part. Few weeks will take bug-fixing and frame buffer emulation. Thus, project completion requires circa three months of work after reaching the campaign goal.
 

Risks & Challenges

 

The challenge is obvious: this is “mission impossible” kind of tasks. But don’t worry. olivieryuyu and me already decoded many microcode mysteries. Our latest success in implementation of Acclaim custom lighting method is another proof that we can solve impossible problems.

story:
Help us bring Ranger class with combat pets to old-school Midgard Rising 3D MMORPG for iOS, Android, Mac, PC, Linux, OUYA, Game Stick

 

Ranger class will be able to use combat pets and use antique looking Guns, Bows & Crossbows. Ranger class will be able to tame animals & beasts and use them as combat pets.

If you have any question and want to find out more about the game and amazing beta community visit the game forum.

Click here to visit development forum

We will deliver Mithril, Mount & XP Booster, instant ALT Level Up perks every Saturday (for past week) during funding period but only to those who use paypal  to fund perk. Those who use credit card will get perks after funding period ends.

All Perks/Rewards include ALL cumulative previous rewards. 

 

THE OLD SCHOOL MMO RPG RETURNS

Do you remember Ultima Online, early days of Everquest 1 or other games from that era?

Do you remember the days when MMO Role-Playing Games were actually about RPG, deep immersion in the game world and a community of like minded players?

We teamed up to create a new old-school MMO RPG which brings all that back.

Midgard Rising is a multi-platform, old-school 3D MMO RPG core game, the kind you used to enjoy in the past, now about to be brought to your Mac, PC & Linux, mobile devices (Android, iOS), and new consoles OUYA and GameStick.

All players will play on the same servers.

How many times you wished to be able to take your PC or Mac game with you? 

Well now you are about to be able to.

Here you can download EARLY BETA version for different platforms:

Click here to download iOS version from iTunes

Click here to download Android version from Google Play

Click here to download Mac & PC version from our forum

[Linux version needs some work but should be ready soon] 

 

 

 

Read what others have said about World of Midgard

"And you've seen a lot of them offering to let you play on both mobile devices and on your desktop...

Wait, that part is kind of new. And if it appeals to you, you should probably take a look at..."

Original article is here

 

"It's crazy what we're starting to see on mobile devices as the performance gap closes more and more with each iteration of mobile technology."

"Back in the day when I was playing EverQuest, Dark Age of Camelot [...] I never thought I'd be playing something that looked even remotely similar on my phone. Enter World of Midgard..."

Original article is here

 

"There are dungeons as well as raid dungeons, PvP arenas, mounts, gear sets, quests, lot and lots of items and pretty much everything you expect to find in an MMORPG. This one is also cross-platform compatible..."

Original article is here

 

 

Midgard Rising offers rich, amazing, full 3D fantasy world, together with full support for factions conflict, factions battleground, rated arenas, 10-man raiding system, and more.

On plot level, Midgard Rising focuses on a conflict between the two warring faction, the Alliance and the Fury, the struggle between them, and also their fight against a common enemy, the Swarm.

The game has a deeply immersing lore, which tells the story of the past of  Midgard’s heroes, the battles they fought, and the tale of the Schism, the Swarm, Survival & Conquest, and the Treaty of the Fallen Oak. Those who want to find out more about the game lore should check the link that enables the download of the book.

Click here to download Lore Book Sample

During your journey through the game’s world you will immerse yourself in a world inspired by Norse mythology. There are 6 playable character races: Human, Elf, and Dwarf belonging to the Alliance, and Orc, Dark Elf, and Blood Drak belonging to the Fury. In addition to selecting a race, you can choose from 5 different classes, which represent a unique style of the particular player.

The classes are: Confessors, Fighter, Mage, Rogues, and Templar. Ranger Class with Combat Pets will be added if we reach the goal. The game world is already huge, but it will grow even bigger with each content update -meaning  more quests, more zones, more dungeons, more mounts and more kick-ass gear sets.

And, have I mentioned that while the whole leveling game play is fun, and includes hundreds of quests in open world, solo dungeons and 5-man dungeon leveling system, the game really focuses on end of the game experience? It’s true! Therefore reaching the level cap is just the beginning of the real core game experience, which includes a very unique end-game 5-man dungeons, 10-man raids, battlegrounds, and rated arenas.

Click here to check development videos on our youtube channel

Why do we ask for help?

All players are asking us to add Ranger class and how kick-ass it would be for that class to tame beasts and use as combat pets. We agree with those players.

 

Note: Range class will be added only if we reach our goal. If compaign does not reach the goal we will use money collected for developing other game features.

On plot level, Midgard Rising focuses on a conflict between the two warring faction, the Alliance and the Fury, the struggle between them, and also their fight against a common enemy, the Swarm.
The game has a deeply immersing lore, which tells the story of the past of  Midgard’s heroes, the battles they fought, and the tale of the Schism, the Swarm, Survival & Conquest, and the Treaty of the Fallen Oak. Those who want to find out more about the game lore should check the link that enables the download of the book.
Click here to download Lore Book Sample
During your journey through the game’s world you will immerse yourself in a world inspired by Norse mythology. There are 6 playable character races: Human, Elf, and Dwarf belonging to the Alliance, and Orc, Dark Elf, and Blood Drak belonging to the Fury. In addition to selecting a race, you can choose from 5 different classes, which represent a unique style of the particular player.
The classes are: Confessors, Fighter, Mage, Rogues, and Templar. Ranger Class with Combat Pets will be added if we reach the goal. The game world is already huge, but it will grow even bigger with each content update -meaning  more quests, more zones, more dungeons, more mounts and more kick-ass gear sets.
And, have I mentioned that while the whole leveling game play is fun, and includes hundreds of quests in open world, solo dungeons and 5-man dungeon leveling system, the game really focuses on end of the game experience? It’s true! Therefore reaching the level cap is just the beginning of the real core game experience, which includes a very unique end-game 5-man dungeons, 10-man raids, battlegrounds, and rated arenas.
Click here to check development videos on our youtube channel

Why do we ask for help?
All players are asking us to add Ranger class and how kick-ass it would be for that class to tame beasts and use as combat pets. We agree with those players.
 

Note: Range class will be added only if we reach our goal. If compaign does not reach the goal we will use money collected for developing other game features.

story:
Hi, I'm Michele Bulla, InkHazard's games creator and designer. InkHazard is an italian cultural association who have the goal to promove, sustain and develope the artistic and creative project of its associated.
We believe in our works and we try with all our strenght to create works we can be proud of, works that we're sure will be capable of entertain the users and and make them have a lot of fun!

S.A.G.A. is the acronym of "Adaptable System for Advanced Role-Playing Game".
The goal of S.A.G.A. is to give role players an unique and easy-to-learn system that can be used for all kinds of setting. This feature allow the players not have to learn a new game system at the start of every new campaign!
S.A.G.A is a complete, flexible, adaptable tabletop role-playing game who will let the Game Master, with only one system, masters all the rule for every kind of avventure in every setting he can think of.

Actually S.A.G.A. was been tested by our users with following campaign settings:

  • Classic Fantasy
  • Sword & Sorcery Fantasy
  • Oriental Fantasy(with samurai, ninjas and japanese demons)
  • Steampunk
  • Supernatual horror (like Lovecraft's stories)
  • Historical (in Renaissance)
  • Sci-fi (like Matrix)
  • Action (like Metal Gear series)
  • Other (ispired to Magic:the Gathering TCG)

The Core Manual is very versatile, with the core rules we have create also a lots of options and variables to let players and masters personalize the system in all it's parts to fulfill all their needs. 
The system has been created by ten-years experienced Masters who are been very attentive to make the system perfect both for beginners and experienced players.

This system is created for long campaign but it's perfectly calibrated also for one-shot sessions. S.A.G.A. games developers offer help and assistance to every masters or players who ask: do you need to dispel a rule's doubt? Or need an hand to crate your own environment setting, talents or special rules? Ask us!

The manual is printed in b/w with a beautiful full-color hard cover. Take a look at project gallery to see some of the amazing illustrations of the book!

 

A role-playing game (RPG) is a game in which players assume the roles of characters in a fictional setting. Players take responsibility for acting out these roles within a narrative, either through literal acting, or through a process of structured decision-making or character development. Actions taken within many games succeed or fail according to a formal system of rules and guidelines.

A tabletop role-playing game is a form of RPG in which the players describe their characters' actions through speech. Players determine the actions of their characters based on their characterization, and the actions succeed or fail according to a formal system of rules and guidelines. Within the rules, players have the freedom to improvise; their choices shape the direction and outcome of the game.

Unlike other types of role-playing game, tabletop RPGs are often conducted like radio drama: only the spoken component of a role is acted. This acting is not always literal, and players do not always speak exclusively in-character. Instead, players act out their role by deciding and describing what actions their characters will take within the rules of the game. In most games, a specially designated player called the game master (GM) creates a setting in which each player plays the role of a single character. The GM describes the game world and its inhabitants; the other players describe the intended actions of their characters, and the GM describes the outcomes. Some outcomes are determined by the game system, and some are chosen by the GM.

The terms pen-and-paper and tabletop are generally only used to distinguish this format of RPG from other formats, since neither pen and paper nor a table are strictly necessary.

S.A.G.A.'s system is based on the collaudated d100 lower rolls win, in games like WFRP, Stormbringer or Call of Cthulhu. The simplycity, flexibility and immediacy are innate to the system but they aren't the only strenght.

S.A.G.A. has been created by masters for masters and that make as easy as pie to balance its sistem without much thinking for an expert master and easy also for a beginner master who will non be forced to lose hour searching between manuals full of rules and quibbles.

S.A.G.A. is one on the few manuals which system let you personalize completely your character: the character's evolution follow the player's game style allowing a realistic developping for both Characteristic (that can be physic and mental attributes) and Skills.

In S.A.G.A. Characteristics' scores grow proportionally at the kind of tests the character will face: a chatacter who will trow himself often in a combat will make grow faster his combat ability, at the opposite a fine strategist will make grow faster his intelligence score (simply chosing to take different approach to the problem and so facing different tests).

A S.A.G.A. character as well as his/her Characteristic had Skills and Talents: technical skills and specific knowledges that became very useful during the quest and will help the master decide if a character can do or not do a certain action.

In S.A.G.A. doesn't exist the "Classes" we have Archetypes instead. Archetypes are the guidelines fot the character's works (what was his/her work before became an adventurer) but, differently from Classes of other RPG, the Archetypes doesn't bind the player's interpretation on preset stereotype.

Combats in S.A.G.A are throught to be very dynamic so a Master can manage both swords combats between medieval warrrios and shootings between 30's gangster and their Thompson machine guns. The system has been created to be flexible and fluid to let the players manage their resources at best and let them adapt their action to the battle's flow, like in a real fight!

In the Core Manual of S.A.G.A there are also included a lot of variables for combat's rules, so the Game Master can choose which one is more adapt at his/her game style, from those specifics for pure combat - like the Minions' rule (nameless opponents with only one lifepoint, most likely many of them will be present at once) - or more stategy rules - like the possibility to use different kind of armor for the different body zones, which make fondamental the blow's target choise - till the rules about flight fights and the use of miniatures!

Differently from most RPG, S.A.G.A has simple and intuitive rules also for manage transports and their use in combats.To help Masters create their unique adventures S.A.G.A contain also a compelling list of weapons and transports sort by historical period.

One of the most blatant news introduced by S.A.G.A is the Karma, a points resource who let the players influence in a direct way both the game and the dice-rolls. Depending on how many points a players uses, Karma allow to repeat a dice-roll, make an action even if isn't their turn, have an automatic success to a test or save their character life.

When Karma point are finished (at 0) they can still be utilizated to influence story and dice-rolls, but the character will go against a fate retortion... So Karma is a powerful resource for players and Game Masters both!

For horror and psychological adventures' lovers S.A.G.A came with the Mental Sanity's rules set and many mental sickness tuned for be played.

 

S.A.G.A core manual is ready to use, it contain all you need for start to be played right away and it's so easy that a Game Master can be ready to play after the first reading of the manual!

 

Have fun and free your fantasy with S.A.G.A.! ;D

  • 1000 € Print Cost
  • 1000 € Professional English Translation
  •  500 € Developer's Team
  •  250 € Illustration
  •  250 € Indiegogo

  • 3500€ 3 Mini-Campaign Settings + 1 Ready-to-use Adventure
  • 4000€ Printing Merchandise (T-shirt, Mug, Posters)
  • 4500€ 3 Mini-Campaign Settings + 3 Ready-to-use Adventure (12 pages each)
  • 5000€ Start of a New Project for a Campaing Setting's Manual

If we don't reach the goal of 3000€, your moneys will be used for sending yours gifts, finish S.A.G.A. Core Manual and, if we reach 1500€ at least, we use it for the english translation. if not, the gift will be in italian, sorry for that.

Don't be afraid to ask, we're happy to answer!

story:
Avalanche is a 3D first person survival simulator in the development stage  by Xenarch Gaming. 

 You must survive and we all know, only the toughest survive.

To survive in Avalanche not only do you need to eat, drink and keep warm by your fire and shelter; you're faced with storms, torrential downpour of rain and snow, plus the fear of the next avalanche, which could come at any moment. Chopping trees and throwing them in the fire will keep you warm, but in some scenarios it will come down to:

"Do I make a fire or something to protect myself"

"Do I kill this deer or wait for wolves to leave me scraps?"

Starting with a knife made from a rabbits ribcage and vines you have the necessary tools to expand, making axes, bows and arrows, shovels, traps & shelters. All the tools you need to survive in this ever changing survival simulator.

Dynamic Base Structures 

Xenarch Gaming is very proud to announce Avalanches newest feature "Dynamic Base Structures" (or DBS for short) 

DBS is a system where you can craft things such as barriers, shelters, look outs, traps, food storage and many other various items to protect your base against PvP (Player Versus Player) & PvE (Player Versus Environment)

Shelter Example #1

 

Shelter Example #2

Food Storage #1

Dynamic Base Structures will come into great use with both PvE (Player Versus Environment) & PvP (Player Versus Player). Campsites can be as large and obvious or small and discreet as you please. With many more DBS features in the near future you will shortly be able to create campsites for your clan (tribe) and control the server. In PvP you wont be fearing predators, you will be fearing the worlds most destructive creatures; ourselves.

Environment

The Avalanche Map is one of the most crucial parts of the game, we previously had a map made but due to some serious faults we had to start again, our newest image of the environment is shown below.

 

Trapping

Trapping is a major component in Avalanche as it is one of the easiest ways to catch prey, eliminate predators and essentially survive.

Snare - Rabbits / Hares.

 

Spring Trap - Deer & Wolves

 

Deadfall - Bears

 

Meet The Team

Kristofer manages the creative process and direction for Avalanche. Avalanche is his brainchild and he has taken the idea from inception to creation. His background is in multimedia and marketing and has expertise in design and the web services sector.

Kristofer Maclean currently lives in Gold Coast - Australia.

 

Christian Shiel has enjoyed a successful career as a software architect spanning multiple industries. His passion for roots gaming brought him back down to earth with a resounding thump when he signed up for Avalanche with Kristofer. He is responsible for all technical aspects within Avalanche including his pet project "XenarchEye", the AI system for Avalanche.

 

Josh M wishes to learn all that he can on business and the development end of Game Creation; so that he can take of his career in game development. Josh runs his own Game development company called Prion Games.

Josh is currently working on the UI of Avalanche making multiple prototypes and working on Icons and such.

 

Josh Savage.

With a previous background of three years using Unity Editor and two Years experience in computer science it is clear to us that Josh has his feet placed firmly in the Indie Game Developement Scene. Josh S manages the level design.

 

Funding Purpose

Coding - 

Avalanche needs a lot of "realistic" aspects to make the game really hit home, hence we need experienced coders who have been in the industry for years making professional games who basically really know what they are doing. These professional coders live off their wages from game developers such as myself and hence they require a pretty hefty wage.

Art -

Avalanche could do with some pretty great artwork for publicity reasons.

Game Modelers - 

Without money our previous game modelers have been left in the balance, trying to do good by Xenarch Gaming  continuing to tribute to Avalanche but without pay their motivation and hope is dimming. Money for excess modeling would be great.

How we thank our supporters!

Not only will you receive the perks listed for the amount you've donated, If you've donated a minimum of $15 you will receive your name etched into a massive tree in the center of the map.

This tree is a list of "Past Survivors" in the game, you'll be one of them!

story:
A quick reminder:

The latest proof-of-concept demo release, v0.4.1 Alpha, is available for you to try out.

Please remember, this is only a proof-of-concept demo; many, many planned features have not yet been implemented which will be featured in later releases.

Download Here - (43.5 MB)

Microsoft XNA 3.1 Redistributable is required to run the game.

Information on Mouse/Keyboard controls can be found here

----------------

 

About the goal...

 We're perfectly aware that the campaign isn't going to get anywhere close to our original, over-optimistic goal of 25k. This is primarily because we vastly overestimated our own self-marketing abilities: our pageview stats are... underwhelming, to say the least.

But this doesn't mean the end of Species. Far from it: we will build this game, at cost if we have to, and since we're using flexible funding the money our contributors have provided will get to us regardless. It will be put towards maintaining the website and paying our artist.

But I just want to make something very very clear:

Species will still get made.

One way or another, we're going to make this game a reality.

Any last-minute contributions would still of course still be a huge help in making sure we stay out of the black for as long as possible, so please don't let the original goal keep you from contributing.

----------------

 

What is Species: Artificial Life, Real Evolution?

Species is a game about macroscopic-scale evolution using a scientifically accurate simulation that you can explore and interact with, and even perform some science of your own.

 

A randomly generated world in the game. Each map generates a series of biomes and height & fertility maps, which is populated by creatures in the evolution simulation

 

To be more precise, Species is a scientifically-accurate natural-selection simulator which allows you to experience evolution first-hand, simulated from the very first principles of evolutionary science:

  • Variation (every creature is uniquely defined by it’s genes),
  • Mutation (child creatures are randomly modified versions of their parents), and
  • Natural Selection (the environment affects every creature in their struggle to survive).

With these principles as it’s gameplay mechanics, Species recreates the same unguided pressures that drove the development of all life on earth over the last 4 billion years.

Whether you just want to observe, watching and studying as the tree of life constructs itself from a single species, or you want to be an active influence on the development of the species in the game, is up to you.

 

     

A group of creatures in the game, each randomly generated.
Yes, the green one terrifies us too.

There are many good academic evolution simulators across the Internet, evolving colours, numbers, text or even single celled organisms.  There are also many games, claiming to be based on the science of evolution, but which actually implement none of the mechanics behind evolution.

Species is something new: both a game, accessible and entertaining, allowing you to explore a large 3D world filled with hundreds of unique, procedurally-generated creatures... and a evolutionary simulator,  implemented from the ground up with the intention of making a realistic and genuine model of evolution.

 

       
Species simulates the life cycle through birth, adulthood, death, and whatever that pink thing is.

 

With herbivores and carnivores, combat, mating, behavioral and physiological evolution, population dynamics like extinctions and explosions, speciation, and many more features to come, the world of Species is a complex, rich, and adaptive environment, featuring:

 

A detailed, macroscopic 3D world: the first of it's kind in a natural selection simulator, filled with hundreds of unique procedurally-generated creatures all competing for survival.

Genuine natural selection: No fitness function, no predefined goals: just survival. The player can aid and interact with the simulation, but they will never control it.

A scientific approach: Evolution, speciation, extinction: these are not a direct functions of the game, they're natural effects of the game's mechanics.

Procedural gameplay: whether you start from a group of slug-worms or generate a population of random creatures, the game carves out it’s own history full of population explosions, speciations and the extinctions of the uncompetitive or just plain unlucky.

Real-time evolution: Select a species, accelerate time, and watch as it’s shape and stats morph in front of your eyes.

     
That's one suspicious-looking cactus.

When we first learned that this hadn’t been done before, our reaction was surprise. Out of all the time and energy invested in video games and scientific simulations both, how was it possible that a proper evolution game didn’t already exist?  After all, we wanted to play it, so surely others did too?

But we came to realise: this was something that genuinely hadn’t been done before. A variety of vaguely similar things had been done, but nothing quite like this. So we set out to do it.

Sometimes, that’s all the reason you need.

 

So, why Indiegogo?

    
Because this thing has the potential to be really, REALLY freaking awesome.

 

Species has been in the works, in some form or another, for the past 8 years or so. In that time, it's developed a long way, and recently has begun growing in leaps and bounds. A year ago, the first public dev videos were released, and the feedback and support we recieved from everyone was very encouraging, and we're ready to take the next step forward in development.

We've been working hard to bring the game up to a high standard both in the simulation and design aspects alike, but now it has reached the point where our work on Species has hit the harsh reality of the real world, and the commitments real life brings with it.

We chose to go with Indiegogo becuase it is a more accessible funding platform to those outside the US, as we in the Species development team are, in the hope that we would be able to raise enough funding to support ourselves during the game's development.

To that end, funding from Indiegogo will be used for:

Keeping the developers alive: Enough funding to keep our development team fed, sheltered, and clothed for a year while they work full-time on Species.


Web hosting: Funding to keep the site, forums, and download services online, as well as the ability to provide online multiplayer in later releases.

Speaking of Online Multiplayer: Keeping our goals reasonable, there won't be any kind of attempt at making Species into an MMO. But something that can plausibly be added is the ability to physically connect players' maps together, combining their CPU power and creating a potentially limitless online overworld. This is possibly the single most ambitious and difficult-to-implement feature on the list, but if we can do it, it would mean the difference between a self-contained petrie-dish world, and a planet.

 

Sound and Music: Species is going to need a lot of help with audio, which is currently being provided by Brain Sugar. Funding from Indiegogo will keep him on the team, in order to provide a full soundtrack for the game throughout its development.

 

Concept, Art, and Design: In order to become a fully fleshed out world, Species not only needs audio, but striking visuals as well, currently being provided by our graphic designer, Jade Taggart. On top of both environment and creature work, Jade is also developing the UI and (planned) vehicle and structure concepts for Species; funding from Indiegogo will help keep her on the team to continue her work.

 

And most importantly, Expanding the game: We're dedicated to seeing Species achieve as much of it's potential as it possibly can, and Indiegogo funding can go a long way towards achieving that goal.

With your help, here are a selection of the features we hope to implement in the future:

  • A fully realised ecosystem, where every system impacts and influences every other system, resulting in emergent and unpredictable natural selection pressures.

    Among the features already planned are flight, water bodies for aquatic and amphibious animals, variable temperature and humidity, growing and migrating forests (made out of reproducing trees with hereditary characteristics, no less), basic forms of symbiosis and parasitic behavior, and others.
Biomes!



  • Every conceivable biological niche open for the creatures in the game to fill.

    We want to give them the freedom to evolve into     anything, from realistic to fanciful, blind cave-dwelling dinosaurs to giant carnivorous insects, hydrogen-filled organic blimps to schools of sea-dwelling plankton-filtering birds.

 

  • Engaging, science-inspired Gameplay: Although the game will always remain a relatively open sandbox and won't have any predefined win-conditions, you'll be able to apply artificial selection pressures.

    By running them over with a robotic chainsaw rover.


    On top of that horrifyingly awesome thought, you can change the creatures with     direct genetic manipulation, change the climate and ecosystem for the better or worse, dynamically build the in-game Tree Of Life by collecting samples and finding fossils, trigger disasters, and do awesome SCIENCE™.

  • Complete Modability: A healthy community is key to a successful independant game. By opening as many segments of the game as possible to modding, we can help grow the community. And by using and making online mods, you the community will be able to help unlock far more of Species potential than we developers could do on our own!

 

  • Mac/Linux Implementation: Species is built with Microsoft XNA Game Studio software, which means it’s not natively supported outside of Windows... but we intend to put some research into the matter, to learn what we can. Although we can't promise anything on this particular front, we do hope to make the game as platform-independant as we possibly can.

 

Who are you people?

  • James Schumacher (Quasar), an Independant Games Programmer and the Lead Developer on Species: Artificial Life, Real Evolution.

    I've been programming indie games since I was 16 and have 5 years professional experience, plus 7 years of slightly-less-professional experience debating creationists on the internet. The two interests combined together in the project that became Species ALRE, which I have been working on on an on/off basis since 2007, and consistantly since 2011.
  • Jade Taggart (CrashKat), the artsy person! Freelance digital artist and graphic designer for Species: Artificial Life, Real Evolution.

I specialize in game art and design, which I've been doing for nearly 10 years and hold two degrees in, as well as experience in web development and specialist consulting. While my dev skill lies mostly in 3D content creation and delivery, I also do animation, special effects and 2D artwork.

Professionally, I currently work for CyberKat Hosting as Senior Graphics Designer, and I also provide digital content and specialist consulting on a freelance basis.

     

 



-----------

MOUSE/KEYBOARD CONTROLS
For use with Alpha 0.4.1 Demo release.

Camera

  • Hold Right Click to rotate the camera.
  • Use W,A,S,D to move, hold shift to "sprint"
  • Press Spacebar to toggle camera fall on/off.
  • Press C to lock the camera around the current creature.


Other Controls

  • Click to select a Creature, or a Species if in that mode.
  • Click their respective icons on the left (next to the statistics) to change between Creature, Species and Ecosystem modes.
  • Click the Details button to learn more about the current creature, species or world depending on mode.
  • Click the Time Accelleration buttons (or press ~, 1, 2 or 3) to change the simulation speed.
  • Click the Highlight Filter to get a visual display of various statistics across all creatures on the map.
  • Click the tool icons to activate different interaction tools:
    • Click a creature to feed
    • Click a creature to kill
    • Click a creature to take a gene sample, then click another to splice it into that creatures genome. The spliced creature will then give birth to gene-spliced creatures.
    • Click and hold over a creature to irradiate it. The irradiated creature will then give birth to heavily mutated offspring.
story_txt:
A quick reminder:
The latest proof-of-concept demo release, v0.4.1 Alpha, is available for you to try out.
Please remember, this is only a proof-of-concept demo; many, many planned features have not yet been implemented which will be featured in later releases.
Download Here - (43.5 MB)






Microsoft XNA 3.1 Redistributable is required to run the game. 






Information on Mouse/Keyboard controls can be found here
----------------
 
About the goal...
 We're perfectly aware that the campaign isn't going to get anywhere close to our original, over-optimistic goal of 25k. This is primarily because we vastly overestimated our own self-marketing abilities: our pageview stats are... underwhelming, to say the least.
But this doesn't mean the end of Species. Far from it: we will build this game, at cost if we have to, and since we're using flexible funding the money our contributors have provided will get to us regardless. It will be put towards maintaining the website and paying our artist.
But I just want to make something very very clear:
Species will still get made.
One way or another, we're going to make this game a reality.
Any last-minute contributions would still of course still be a huge help in making sure we stay out of the black for as long as possible, so please don't let the original goal keep you from contributing. 
----------------
 

What is Species: Artificial Life, Real Evolution?


Species is a game about macroscopic-scale evolution using a scientifically accurate simulation that you can explore and interact with, and even perform some science of your own.

 
A randomly generated world in the game. Each map generates a series of biomes and height & fertility maps, which is populated by creatures in the evolution simulation
 
To be more precise, Species is a scientifically-accurate natural-selection simulator which allows you to experience evolution first-hand, simulated from the very first principles of evolutionary science:


Variation (every creature is uniquely defined by it’s genes),


Mutation (child creatures are randomly modified versions of their parents), and 


Natural Selection (the environment affects every creature in their struggle to survive).

With these principles as it’s gameplay mechanics, Species recreates the same unguided pressures that drove the development of all life on earth over the last 4 billion years.
Whether you just want to observe, watching and studying as the tree of life constructs itself from a single species, or you want to be an active influence on the development of the species in the game, is up to you.
 


      

A group of creatures in the game, each randomly generated.Yes, the green one terrifies us too.

There are many good academic evolution simulators across the Internet, evolving colours, numbers, text or even single celled organisms.  There are also many games, claiming to be based on the science of evolution, but which actually implement none of the mechanics behind evolution.
 Species is something new: both a game, accessible and entertaining, allowing you to explore a large 3D world filled with hundreds of unique, procedurally-generated creatures... and a evolutionary simulator,  implemented from the ground up with the intention of making a realistic and genuine model of evolution.
 

       Species simulates the life cycle through birth, adulthood, death, and whatever that pink thing is. 
With herbivores and carnivores, combat, mating, behavioral and physiological evolution, population dynamics like extinctions and explosions, speciation, and many more features to come, the world of Species is a complex, rich, and adaptive environment, featuring:
 
A detailed, macroscopic 3D world: the first of it's kind in a natural selection simulator, filled with hundreds of unique procedurally-generated creatures all competing for survival.
Genuine natural selection: No fitness function, no predefined goals: just survival. The player can aid and interact with the simulation, but they will never control it.
A scientific approach: Evolution, speciation, extinction: these are not a direct functions of the game, they're natural effects of the game's mechanics.
Procedural gameplay: whether you start from a group of slug-worms or generate a population of random creatures, the game carves out it’s own history full of population explosions, speciations and the extinctions of the uncompetitive or just plain unlucky.
Real-time evolution: Select a species, accelerate time, and watch as it’s shape and stats morph in front of your eyes.

      That's one suspicious-looking cactus.
When we first learned that this hadn’t been done before, our reaction was surprise. Out of all the time and energy invested in video games and scientific simulations both, how was it possible that a proper evolution game didn’t already exist?  After all, we wanted to play it, so surely others did too?
But we came to realise: this was something that genuinely hadn’t been done before. A variety of vaguely similar things had been done, but nothing quite like this. So we set out to do it. 
Sometimes, that’s all the reason you need.
 
So, why Indiegogo?
     
Because this thing has the potential to be really, REALLY freaking awesome.
 
Species has been in the works, in some form or another, for the past 8 years or so. In that time, it's developed a long way, and recently has begun growing in leaps and bounds. A year ago, the first public dev videos were released, and the feedback and support we recieved from everyone was very encouraging, and we're ready to take the next step forward in development.
We've been working hard to bring the game up to a high standard both in the simulation and design aspects alike, but now it has reached the point where our work on Species has hit the harsh reality of the real world, and the commitments real life brings with it.
We chose to go with Indiegogo becuase it is a more accessible funding platform to those outside the US, as we in the Species development team are, in the hope that we would be able to raise enough funding to support ourselves during the game's development. 
To that end, funding from Indiegogo will be used for:
Keeping the developers alive: Enough funding to keep our development team fed, sheltered, and clothed for a year while they work full-time on Species.
Web hosting: Funding to keep the site, forums, and download services online, as well as the ability to provide online multiplayer in later releases.
Speaking of Online Multiplayer: Keeping our goals reasonable, there won't be any kind of attempt at making Species into an MMO. But something that can plausibly be added is the ability to physically connect players' maps together, combining their CPU power and creating a potentially limitless online overworld. This is possibly the single most ambitious and difficult-to-implement feature on the list, but if we can do it, it would mean the difference between a self-contained petrie-dish world, and a planet.
 
Sound and Music: Species is going to need a lot of help with audio, which is currently being provided by Brain Sugar. Funding from Indiegogo will keep him on the team, in order to provide a full soundtrack for the game throughout its development.
 
Concept, Art, and Design: In order to become a fully fleshed out world, Species not only needs audio, but striking visuals as well, currently being provided by our graphic designer, Jade Taggart. On top of both environment and creature work, Jade is also developing the UI and (planned) vehicle and structure concepts for Species; funding from Indiegogo will help keep her on the team to continue her work.
 
And most importantly, Expanding the game: We're dedicated to seeing Species achieve as much of it's potential as it possibly can, and Indiegogo funding can go a long way towards achieving that goal. 
With your help, here are a selection of the features we hope to implement in the future:


A fully realised ecosystem, where every system impacts and influences every other system, resulting in emergent and unpredictable natural selection pressures.Among the features already planned are flight, water bodies for aquatic and amphibious animals, variable temperature and humidity, growing and migrating forests (made out of reproducing trees with hereditary characteristics, no less), basic forms of symbiosis and parasitic behavior, and others.

Biomes!



Every conceivable biological niche open for the creatures in the game to fill.We want to give them the freedom to evolve into anything, from realistic to fanciful, blind cave-dwelling dinosaurs to giant carnivorous insects, hydrogen-filled organic blimps to schools of sea-dwelling plankton-filtering birds. 

 


Engaging, science-inspired Gameplay: Although the game will always remain a relatively open sandbox and won't have any predefined win-conditions, you'll be able to apply artificial selection pressures.
By running them over with a robotic chainsaw rover.
On top of that horrifyingly awesome thought, you can change the creatures with direct genetic manipulation, change the climate and ecosystem for the better or worse, dynamically build the in-game Tree Of Life by collecting samples and finding fossils, trigger disasters, and do awesome SCIENCE™. 


Complete Modability: A healthy community is key to a successful independant game. By opening as many segments of the game as possible to modding, we can help grow the community. And by using and making online mods, you the community will be able to help unlock far more of Species potential than we developers could do on our own!

Although we can't promise anything on this particular front, we do hope to make the game as platform-independant as we possibly can.

story:
NEW: You can just buy your Steam key directly in our shop and it will be send immediately.

Please note: Steam keys bought on IndieGoGo are sent out by our team during office hours. Please also check your spam filter!

Wild Buster is the new Sci-Fi Action MMORPG with fast-paced Hack'n'Slash action. It requires strategic team composition, the smart use of special abilities, quick reflexes, and above all, an appreciation for over-the-top weaponry.

Pick from over a dozen unique heroes from two rival factions , the Guardians and Abandon, to take on an aggressive cyborg race called the Broken. In addition to intense boss fights and PvE missions , the game offers so large-scale PvP content where you can claimsoft victory (and of course, loot ) for yourself or your team.

 

Fast-Paced Hack'n'Slash Combat

Combat in Wild Buster Feels genuinely gratifying and fast , rivaling the speed of even the top Hack'n'Slashes . Shooting, slashing, burning, dodging, rolling - think fast, move faster! Wildbuster is easy to start, but hard to master.

 

Unique Heroes to Collect and Level

Over fourteen selectable heroes (with twenty-four-planned) who employ distinctly different play styles , some of them famous characters from other games - such as Serious Sam. Each hero has a variety of different skills . All skills can be customized with items to increase their potential and increase or even add additional effects. Optimize gear , enhance skills , and strategically combine to build your ideal hero . Play as a Mech-Suit Engineer, a Tamer, a Dual-Blade Assassin, a Sniper, and many more.

 

Despite this Wildbuster is not a MOBA but a full RPG with traditional character leveling (up to lvl 50). Plus your overall ranked account level can continue to increase beyond did to unlock attribute bonuses  (think: Paragon System).

 

A full MMORPG

Wild Buster is an MMORPG complete with guild systems, dungeons, and raids (including a group finder). It also includes achievements, an auction house system, and a variety of mounts and pets. In-game gear sets have different attribute increases, rarities, and set bonuses. You can also find familiar professions like crafting, enchanting, armorsmithing, and mining.

 

PVE: intense Missions, Dungeons, and Raids

During raids, heroes take on familiar roles as tank, range DD, melee DD, and support. Strategic team composition is vital here. Assemble a strong team or go home!

  • 500+ quests and daily missions
  • 20+ dungeons with unique boss fights and 3 different difficulties
  • 4 raid instances with challenging boss fights
  • Horde Mode: 4 defence maps where players have to protect a payload against relentless hordes of enemy fighters

 

PvP Features:

The game features 5 vs 5 squad leagues (with 10 vs 10 planned after early access), and free-for-all treasure brawls where the winner takes all! Higher level players also get to battle it out in 4 open PvP zones.

 

The story: Two Rival Factions, One Major Threat!

In a war-torn galaxy, the Broken, an aggressive cyborg race, are hell-bent on dooming the remaining humans to the same desolate half-man-half-machine fate. On the hostile alien planet of Titan, the colonies struggle to defend themselves. Titan’s two rival factions must put their differences aside if they are to prevent the complete annihilation of mankind.

The Guardians are an orderly military organization that relies on strict discipline and intense training to fulfill  their mission of protecting all humans. The Abandon, however, are an alliance of wild, unbound mutants. Though they are less disciplined, Abandon are experts in utilizing weapons and gadgets to adapt and survive even in the harshest environments.

Despite them being rivals, the game allows heroes from both factions to fight side-by-side during missions, dungeons, squad leagues, and all battle arenas.

 

Minimum System Requirements:

  • OS version: Windows 7 (64bit)
  • Processor: Intel i3 or equivalent
  • Disk space: 5GB
  • Memory: 4GB
  • Graphics: Nvidia GeForce GTX 560 or equivalent

For more information, check out the official Steam page.

 

The Korean Busters

The development team behind Wild Buster has contributed to many successful MMORPGs including Seal Online, Rohan Online, Priston Tale 2, Asta Story and Fiesta Online - but this is the game they have always wanted to make - and they need your help to finish it!

 

The Maltese Busters

InselGames is a small independent publisher of online games based in Malta. Members of our team have worked on games such as Last Chaos, Fiesta Online, S4 League, Florensia, Everquest 2 and Planetside 2. Our goal is to bring you the best independent MMOs with a fair business model (TLDR: no pay-to-win)! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

As a small independent publisher with limited resources we need the crowdfunding/pre-sales to finance the ongoing development (e.g. removing pay-to-win elements) and completion of all localization work necessary to bring this gem over to the west!

As a thank you for your support we have put together several bundles that range from Steam Keys for the early access version scheduled for October to exclusive t-shirts and even a chance to meet the team (yup, that's us!) on the sunny island of Malta, or in ever-bustling Seoul (South Korea).

The Impact

If the campaign goal of $10,000 is reached, we will be able to launch the game by paying the developer to prepare our vamped-up Western version “Heroes of Titan”-version(which will have no pay-to-win elements!), buying servers, and completing all necessary localization into English.

 

Risks & Challenges

The server is already running and we are testing the Korean version intensively at the moment. It has all the major features described above, so there should be no technical hurdles - the only possible risk is a delayed delivery of the English and German versions (especially if the campaign goal is not met).

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! If you cannot afford one of our bundles right now, please share this campaign with your friends and guildmates. We would really appreciate any additional support :)

Any questions? Just drop us a line:

  • Email: info@inselgames.com
  • Facebook
  • Imprint

Disclaimer: Unfortunately, it is only possible to back this IndieGoGo campaign if you are from EU, USA, Canada or Switzerland.

story:
ABOUT US
Welcome from Arcangelo and Daniele into SQUIZZY campagne on Indiegogo!
We are two young Italian guy, members of the group "UnitBiz" focused in the area of technology and communication, we love to put oneself at stake and live life as a game unhindered

Our new bigger challenge? Involve you in this new quiz game free for  iOs, Android and Desktop, that will turn/spin your marbles around the world!

OUR COMPANY
we are working hard ourselves in order to create a very good and funny QUIZ game. We work as designer and coders in Italy (FLORENCE!) and after many months of work we have created a prototype of the game.

http://www.unitbiz.net

MAIN CONTRIBUTOR
Our team co-operate with Creativa s.r.l., company behind Dr.Why.  Dr.Why is a Quiz game distributed in many countries in Europe.

SAMSUNG S4 GLOBAL EVENT


COCA COLA WORLD CUP

The company gives us the support to create the game-logic based on 13 years of experience about the multiplayer quiz game in LIVE scenario for many clients:SAMSUNG, FUJIFILM, AS ROMA FOOTBALL, PORSCHE, COCA COLA, CHEVROLET, INTEL, HTC, VOLKWAGEN, CISCO and many others company.

LINK OF Dr.WHY WEBSITE:
http://www.drwhy.co.uk/forbusiness?lang=en
WHAT IS SQUIZZY?
Squizzy is a Multiplayer Multilanguage Mobile Quiz Game made for….Fun!  As you know, many Quiz Game have a limited number of questions created by owner of the game.  With Squizzy you can write the questions by yourself and play with other players.

                               


- PLAY with your friends in Multiplayer (1-to-8 players) and win their Marbles
- FIND rare marbles into the world and take them answering questions!
- EXPLORE your marble collections, share with friends!

MADE QUESTION BY YOURSELF
With SQUIZZY the questions are written directly by players: this create an Infinite based game, more funny!



SQUIZZY has no Points!
SQUIZZY has no Score!

SQUIZZY has MARBLE!

When you play with other players you can win a Marble that your opponent has to give you as a reward. Your main objective is to collect marble of all countries of the world. The are MARBLE about Company Logo, or Product. You can draw “your lucky marble” and play with friends. There is a limited number of Marble that we draw each month.



 

You will discover the best Marble in the world and collect it in every match you win. Everyone can Play, everyone can create a beautiful Marble Collection!


Before lanching the game We want to share the opportunity to join in our project with everyone in the world in original way: PLAY WITH YOUR MARBLE.

With your contribute, you can PLAY with your Marble into Squizzy and We can continue with the Development of the games, graphics and buy software license and server in order to start the project.

With this campagne we want to keep SQUIZZY as Free Game with No ADV!
BUYING A PERK YOU CAN SUPPORT US.

LUCKY MARBLE
Play with your LUCKY MARBLE and Conquere the world of SQUIZZY!
Buying this perk You will get your CUSTOM Marble: your lucky murble!

  Five reasons to buy a Lucky Marble:
  1 - Your Lucky Marble is your "identity" into Squizzy Game:
        when you win/lose, the Player know who you are and can add you as Friend.
        In other words, You are into the Squizzy Community :-)

  2 - You don't need to unlock Logo or Product Marble in order to play:
        play without unlock any type of Marble

  3 - You can join in Lucky Tournament every month:
        only Identity Verified users can join into mouth Tournament

  4 - You never lose your Lucky Marble:
        Logo Marble and Product Marble can be lose

  5 - You can support the Game Development process:
        your name, if you want, can be showed into a Special page insiede
        the Game (iOS, Android, Facebook).

LOGO MARBLE
Have you a company? Do you want that SQUIZZY community know more about your brand by answering at some questions about your Brand? Do you want to support an innovative and young team?  Buy your LOGO Marble ;)

PRODUCT MARBLE
Have you a company? Do you want that SQUIZZY community know more about your Product by answering at some questions about your Product? Do you want to support an innovative and young team?  Buy your PRODUCT Marble ;)

RARE MARBLE
We design 1 RARE MARBLE at month. This Marble is hard to find and is hard to get in your collection. All the players in the world will try to find it. Are you interested to create your Rare Marble? You will get an incredible marketing campagne in the SQUIZZY community.

WHY HELP US ?

  • We can expande the Game with ABILITY match
  • We can Create more and beautiful Marble
  • Buy more Device in order to test the Game
  • Buy software license
  • Complete the Game, Website and Design
  • Complete translation in many Language

What kind of game is SQUIZZY?
SQUIZZY is a multiplayer and multilanguage QUIZ game.

In which platform can I play?
SQUIZZY will be available for Android, iPhone, Windows Phone, PC and MAC (so you can play from desktop)

When it will be released?
We are aiming at a release in November 2013, but this date could change. We work so hard on the platform design and code in order to complete the game as soon as possible.

Why  there are no Points and no Scores?
Well, after every match you Win you'll receive a Marble. You can collect Marble around the world. And you can Play with your Murble that buy in IndieGoGo.

How many languages will support Squizzy?
At startup Squizzy will be translated in English, Italian, Spanish, French, Japanese, Germany, Portuguese. But many other languages will be supported.





DANIELE behind the desktop. Dany is Web and Mobile manager.



ARCANGELO (Creative Director) and DANIELE working on SQUIZZY.
story_txt:
ABOUT USWelcome from Arcangelo and Daniele into SQUIZZY campagne on Indiegogo!We are two young Italian guy, members of the group "UnitBiz" focused in the area of technology and communication, we love to put oneself at stake and live life as a game unhindered

Our new bigger challenge? Involve you in this new quiz game free for  iOs, Android and Desktop, that will turn/spin your marbles around the world!

OUR COMPANYwe are working hard ourselves in order to create a very good and funny QUIZ game. We work as designer and coders in Italy (FLORENCE!) and after many months of work we have created a prototype of the game.http://www.unitbiz.netMAIN CONTRIBUTOROur team co-operate with Creativa s.r.l., company behind Dr.Why.  Dr.Why is a Quiz game distributed in many countries in Europe.

SAMSUNG S4 GLOBAL EVENT

COCA COLA WORLD CUPThe company gives us the support to create the game-logic based on 13 years of experience about the multiplayer quiz game in LIVE scenario for many clients:SAMSUNG, FUJIFILM, AS ROMA FOOTBALL, PORSCHE, COCA COLA, CHEVROLET, INTEL, HTC, VOLKWAGEN, CISCO and many others company.LINK OF Dr.WHY WEBSITE:http://www.drwhy.co.uk/forbusiness?lang=enWHAT IS SQUIZZY?Squizzy is a Multiplayer Multilanguage Mobile Quiz Game made for….Fun!  As you know, many Quiz Game have a limited number of questions created by owner of the game.  With Squizzy you can write the questions by yourself and play with other players.                               
- PLAY with your friends in Multiplayer (1-to-8 players) and win their Marbles- FIND rare marbles into the world and take them answering questions!- EXPLORE your marble collections, share with friends!MADE QUESTION BY YOURSELFWith SQUIZZY the questions are written directly by players: this create an Infinite based game, more funny!

story:
Who is Zidiane?

(the following is a transcript of the video above)

Hello, my name is John Silvia, better known in the skullgirls community as Zidiane. I’ve been very passionate about video games, and in love with fighting games for a very long time, and as far as Skullgirls goes I’ve been very active in it’s community since before the game came out. I am best known for my guide on Cerebella, the character I use. I’m considered the best Solo Cerebella, and one of the better, or best Cerebella’s overall.

And I’m making this video for a drive I’m doing. There’s this tournament named EVO , Evolution Championship Series, on July 12th. It’s the biggest fighting game tournament in the world, and luckily, with a lot of effort and motivation from the Skullgirls community, we were able to become a main game. And that’s amazing, but, unfortunately, our tournament scene hasn’t been very good, so I feel obligated to do everything I can to support the game and community that I love. But unfortunately, I don’t have the funds to make it there. I was working on it, and I was on track to get there, but there’s been a setback, and it’s not gonna happen. Not without a Miracle, one I’m hoping you guys help me with.

I’m gonna keep trying to get there, and I hope that you guys help me. The information for the drive is down below. There’s a video, I was at East Coast Throwdown 5, in New Jersey, last month, there’s a video of something I did, it’s in the gallery so you know I’m not just some random bum. And I’m also going to be giving away all the money that I win, there’s details on how to do that down below. I’m also going to be making bead art, like this, for all the Skullgirls characters. I don’t have all the colors, so I can’t make them at the moment, but I will be sending those to everyone who donated, and got the proper perk, everyone who donated and I will be sending those to you even if I do not make it, because you donating means you cared enough to want to send me, and I think that deserves a bead necklace.

Check me out on Skullheart

What EVO Is & What I Need

Evo, like I said, is the largest Fighting game tournament in the world, with players flying in from all around the world to attend. They've held one every year for over a decade, and last year there were nearly 10,000 people in attendence (either playing or watching). You can check them out here. It's held in Las Vegas, Nevada, in July.

Some of you may be very aware of how much a trip to EVO costs, but from my estimations, this is the price breakdown:

Plane Ticket - $450-500 (depending on if I can get a really cheap ticket)

Hotel Room - $75-$100 (thankfully the FGC likes room sharring, so the price is less than it normally would be for a three day hotel room)

EVO Tournament price - $80

Total min estimate (including tax) - $650-$730

I’ll be working towards this goal as well, but I need your help to make it happen. I need it all by june 30th, but it can take a over a week to recieve funds, so the deadline needs to be earlier.

Perks

Alright. The actual things you get for donating are over there, to the right. For those of you who don't know what an 8-bit Skullgirls necklace is, they are Megaman-styled sprites, started a while ago in the FGC. I can make any other characters (probably) that aren't on that list, but I need to get some help making the 8-bit design first. Click Here to see the first Megaman Sprites I'll be using, and Click Here to see the second set.

Also, be aware, for any one interested in the tutoring, I live in the US, on the East Coast. There are certain places in the world I cannot play online. You can trade any tutoring for any perk of a lower tier than that one.

Also, if I win any money at EVO (either in a tournament or in a money match), I’mgiving it all away to the people who assisted me in getting there. YOU. I’ll set it up that very night and give away everything I won. In order to enter the give-away, simply tweet #SendZidianeToEvo or tweet about this or with a link before June 18th. If you tweet it before EVO (or during EVO) and I have enough to go, I'll look into other prizes I can get you, but I need it before then to get more support.

If I place top 8 at the tournament, I’ll win money. The money is split like this: 60/18/8/4/3/3/2/2 (those are percentages of the total pot). There is a $2000 pot bonus right now, so with that alone, 1st place gets 1200, and 2nd gets about 400, and so on (8th gets 40). That’s before anyone even enters, though, so if, say, 300 people show up (the goal we are aiming for), at 10$ a person, the pot will be $5000, with 1st getting $2000 and scaling down for top 8 places (in that scenario, 8th is 100).

If I have any extra money, I'll be Money Matching people. I'll give away any money I win in those as well, and I will not be using any winnings in money matches (no chance of me winning some money, then losing what I won later).

I'm also goint to be trying to get other prizes to give out. I will try to see if Lab Zero brings any special Skullgirls stuff. If they have anything, I'll try to get my hands on it and get that stuff to you guys as well.

If I don't get make the trip?

Now, that all sounds nice, but what if I don’t make enough to go to EVO? If I don’t get enough money by the time it turns June 17th (I need it early cause IGG says they can take up to 10 days to fund me, and the deadline is June 30th for EVO registration), everyone gets their money back. Simple as that.

The Impact You Will Have On Me and Skullgirls

I can't even explain to you the kind of impact this would have for me. Having never been to EVO before, this would be something for me to remember for the rest of my life. You would make me so happy I would... I don't know what I'd do, but it would be amazing (going to EVO would be amazing, not what I do).

My personal feelings aside, EVO is a very important thing for Skullgirls. You may not know, but the Tournament scene for Skullgirls is nearly dead, and has been since it's release. The tournament aspect is considered to be the number one important thing to the survival of a title (in this case, Skullgirls) in the FGC. Skullgirls actually was on the brink a few months ago, nearly dead, and the devs nearly moved on to other projects. Thankfully, the past few months have seen a surge of activity (through campaigns you might have seen, the Brest Cancer Drive and the Squigly Campaign which raised a combine total of $900k+). That was amazing beyond explanation, but the tournament scene hasn't reacted very much. We are still struggling.

On July 12th, however, is EVO, the world's largest fighting game tournament, and our biggest chance to make a comeback. Skullgirls is going to be an (unofficial) official game on the main stage as thanks for our contributions to the cure for breast cancer, and we need every person we can get to show up to help preserve this second wind. I would very much like to assist Skullgirls in this area by showing up to EVO, but I don’t have the funds right now, and it’s fairly uncertain if I will. Me getting to EVO will help make sure that this community can continue to thrive, and I hope you’ll help me in this.

Stretch Goals

500: If I make this much, and have enough money in my own pocket to still make the trip, I will still do the give away. If I don't get enough donors and have enough money on my own to make the trip, I'll donate the money to myself (to ensure that I reach the goal and can thus access the money in the drive, since this is fixed funding) and still give back to you guys.

1400: There's no way I'll get this much, but if I do, I'll use it to go to EVO next year and hold the exact same giveaway with the exact same rules. In this scenario, you could potentially see someone win Two EVO's in a row and give all of the money from both winnings away for the first time ever.

All money made up until this goal, yet after the 700 mark will be used in money matches, or trying to buy cool Skullgirls stuff at EVO.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren’t financially capable of supporting this but want to, I know exactly how you feel. If you can’t spare a few bucks, maybe you could spread the word? If you got a Twitter, Deviantart, Tumblr, Youtube channel, any help is welcome.

story:
(So as you can see, I accidentally made the campaign only 6 days long.  You can  obviously contribute to me personally past this date (trip begins October 26th) but it might be pretty cool if it does only take 6 days to raise the money.  

Thanks!)


This is a simple fundraiser.  I'm asking for help in funding my trip to Haiti to work with Hope for Haiti's Children.  This will be a short but hopefully powerful trip for everyone involved.  I'll be apart of a group of four men traveling for a week around parts of Haiti, preaching the gospel...and of course taking pictures :)

Contributors (and non contributors for that matter) are welcome to any and all photos and video I take during the week.  I'm also hoping to put together a photo book with photos from my last trip as well as this upcoming one.

Any and all left over money will be split between an on-going Haiti fund at our church and a donation to the church in Haiti we will be working with.

Check out the link below for my experience in Haiti last year.
http://jasonayersmedia.wordpress.com/
